"yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«paá¹ƒ dÅ«teyyapahiá¹‡agamanÄnuyogaá¹ƒ anuyuttÄ viharanti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ, rÄjamahÄmattÄnaá¹ƒ, khattiyÄnaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ, gahapatikÄnaá¹ƒ, kumÄrÄnaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜idha gaccha, amutrÄgaccha, idaá¹ƒ hara, amutra idaá¹ƒ ÄharÄâ€™ti iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄ dÅ«teyyapahiá¹‡agamanÄnuyogÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 204. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te kuhakÄ ca honti lapakÄ ca nemittikÄ ca nippesikÄ ca lÄbhena lÄbhaá¹ƒ nijigÄ«sitÄro ca. iti evarÅ«pÄ kuhanalapanÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ". majjhimasÄ«laá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ. mahÄsÄ«laá¹ƒ 205. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ aá¹…gaá¹ƒ nimittaá¹ƒ uppÄtaá¹ƒ supinaá¹ƒ lakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ mÅ«sikacchinnaá¹ƒ aggihomaá¹ƒ dabbihomaá¹ƒ thusahomaá¹ƒ kaá¹‡ahomaá¹ƒ taá¹‡á¸ulahomaá¹ƒ sappihomaá¹ƒ
â€œWhereas some ascetics and Brahmins, feeding on the food of the faithful, make their living by such base arts, such wrong means of livelihood. such as palmistry (*aá¹…gaá¹ƒ*), divining by signs (*nimittaá¹ƒ*), portents (*uppÄtaá¹ƒ*), dreams (*supinaá¹ƒ*), body-marks (*lakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), mouse-gnawings (*mÅ«sikacchinnaá¹ƒ*), fire-oblations (*aggihomaá¹ƒ*), oblations from a ladle (*dabbihomaá¹ƒ*), of husks (*thusahomaá¹ƒ*), rice-powder (*kaá¹‡ahomaá¹ƒ*), rice- grains (*taá¹‡á¸ulahomaá¹ƒ*), ghee (*sappihomaá¹ƒ*) Offering oblations of oil (*telahomaá¹ƒ*), offering oblations from the mouth (*mukhahomaá¹ƒ*), offering blood oblations (*lohitahomaá¹ƒ*), knowledge of bodily marks (*aá¹…gavijjÄ*), knowledge of house and garden sites (*vatthuvijjÄ*), knowledge of princely duties (*khattavijjÄ*), knowledge of auspicious rites (*Å›ivavijjÄ*), knowledge of spirits (*bhÅ«tavijjÄ*), extensive knowledge (*bhÅ«rivijjÄ*), snake lore (*ahivijjÄ*), poison lore (*visavijjÄ*), scorpion lore (*vicchikavijjÄ*), mouse lore (*mÅ«sikavijjÄ*), bird lore (*sakuá¹‡avijjÄ*), crow lore (*vÄyasavijjÄ*), foretelling the span of life (*pakkajjhÄnaá¹ƒ*), charms against arrows (*saraparittÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), knowledge of the cries of deer (*migacakkaá¹ƒ*), from such base arts and wrong means of livelihood, he refrains. This pertains to his moral discipline.
206. telahomaá¹ƒ mukhahomaá¹ƒ lohitahomaá¹ƒ aá¹…gavijjÄ vatthuvijjÄ khattavijjÄ sivavijjÄ bhÅ«tavijjÄ bhÅ«rivijjÄ ahivijjÄ visavijjÄ vicchikavijjÄ mÅ«sikavijjÄ sakuá¹‡avijjÄ vÄyasavijjÄ pakkajjhÄnaá¹ƒ saraparittÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ migacakkaá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 206. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ maá¹‡ilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ vatthalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ daá¹‡á¸alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ satthalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ asilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ usulakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dhanulakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ Ävudhalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ itthilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ purisalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kumÄralakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kumÄrilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dÄsalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dÄsilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ hatthilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ assalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ mahiá¹ƒsalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ usabhalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ golakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ ajalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ meá¹‡á¸alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kukkuá¹­alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ vaá¹­á¹­akalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ godhÄlakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡ikalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kacchapalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ migalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 207. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ niyyÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ aniyyÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ apayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ apayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ jayo bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ parÄjayo bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ jayo bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ parÄjayo bhavissati, iti imassa jayo bhavissati, imassa parÄjayo bhavissati iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 208. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ candaggÄho bhavissati, sÅ«riyaggÄho bhavissati, nakkhattaggÄho bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ
"Just as some venerable ascetics and Brahmins, while living on food given in faith, maintain their lives by wrong livelihood, by such base practices. Namely: interpreting the marks of gems (*maá¹‡ilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of clothes (*vatthalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of staffs (*daá¹‡á¸alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of weapons (*satthalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of swords (*asilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of arrows (*usulakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of bows (*dhanulakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of armaments (*Ävudhalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of women (*itthilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of men (*purisalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of boys (*kumÄralakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of girls (*kumÄrilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of male slaves (*dÄsalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of female slaves (*dÄsilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of elephants (*hatthilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of horses (*assalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of buffaloes (*mahiá¹ƒsalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of bulls (*usabhalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of cows (*golakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of goats (*ajalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of rams (*meá¹‡á¸alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of cocks (*kukkuá¹­alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of quails (*vaá¹­á¹­akalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of lizards (*godhÄlakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of earrings (*kaá¹‡á¹‡ikalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of tortoises (*kacchapalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), interpreting the marks of deer (*migalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), from such base arts and wrong means of livelihood, he refrains. This pertains to his moral discipline.
207. telahomaá¹ƒ mukhahomaá¹ƒ lohitahomaá¹ƒ aá¹…gavijjÄ vatthuvijjÄ khattavijjÄ sivavijjÄ bhÅ«tavijjÄ bhÅ«rivijjÄ ahivijjÄ visavijjÄ vicchikavijjÄ mÅ«sikavijjÄ sakuá¹‡avijjÄ vÄyasavijjÄ pakkajjhÄnaá¹ƒ saraparittÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ migacakkaá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 206. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ maá¹‡ilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ vatthalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ daá¹‡á¸alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ satthalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ asilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ usulakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dhanulakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ Ävudhalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ itthilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ purisalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kumÄralakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kumÄrilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dÄsalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dÄsilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ hatthilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ assalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ mahiá¹ƒsalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ usabhalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ golakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ ajalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ meá¹‡á¸alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kukkuá¹­alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ vaá¹­á¹­akalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ godhÄlakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡ikalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kacchapalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ migalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 207. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ niyyÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ aniyyÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ apayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ apayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ jayo bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ parÄjayo bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ jayo bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ parÄjayo bhavissati, iti imassa jayo bhavissati, imassa parÄjayo bhavissati iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 208. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ candaggÄho bhavissati, sÅ«riyaggÄho bhavissati, nakkhattaggÄho bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ
"Just as some venerable ascetics and Brahmins, while living on food given in faith, maintain their lives by wrong livelihood, by such base practices. Namely: 'The king will march out (*raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ niyyÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'The king will not march out (*raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ aniyyÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'Our own king will advance (*abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'The foreign king will retreat (*bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ apayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'The foreign king will advance (*bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'Our own king will retreat (*abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ apayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'Our own king will be victorious (*abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ jayo bhavissati*)', 'The foreign king will be defeated (*bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ parÄjayo bhavissati*)', 'The foreign king will be victorious (*bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ jayo bhavissati*)', 'Our own king will be defeated (*abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ parÄjayo bhavissati*)', 'Thus, this one will be victorious (*iti imassa jayo bhavissati*)', 'That one will be defeated (*imassa parÄjayo bhavissati*)', from such base arts and wrong means of livelihood, he refrains. This pertains to his moral discipline.
208. telahomaá¹ƒ mukhahomaá¹ƒ lohitahomaá¹ƒ aá¹…gavijjÄ vatthuvijjÄ khattavijjÄ sivavijjÄ bhÅ«tavijjÄ bhÅ«rivijjÄ ahivijjÄ visavijjÄ vicchikavijjÄ mÅ«sikavijjÄ sakuá¹‡avijjÄ vÄyasavijjÄ pakkajjhÄnaá¹ƒ saraparittÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ migacakkaá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 206. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ maá¹‡ilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ vatthalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ daá¹‡á¸alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ satthalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ asilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ usulakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dhanulakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ Ävudhalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ itthilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ purisalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kumÄralakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kumÄrilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dÄsalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dÄsilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ hatthilakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ assalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ mahiá¹ƒsalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ usabhalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ golakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ ajalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ meá¹‡á¸alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kukkuá¹­alakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ vaá¹­á¹­akalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ godhÄlakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡ikalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ kacchapalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ migalakkhaá¹‡aá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 207. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ niyyÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ aniyyÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ apayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ apayÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ jayo bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ parÄjayo bhavissati, bÄhirÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ jayo bhavissati, abbhantarÄnaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ parÄjayo bhavissati, iti imassa jayo bhavissati, imassa parÄjayo bhavissati iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 208. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ candaggÄho bhavissati, sÅ«riyaggÄho bhavissati, nakkhattaggÄho bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ
"Just as some venerable ascetics and Brahmins, while living on food given in faith, maintain their lives by wrong livelihood, by such base practices. Namely: 'There will be an eclipse of the moon (*candaggÄho bhavissati*)', 'There will be an eclipse of the sun (*sÅ«riyaggÄho bhavissati*)', 'There will be an eclipse of the stars (*nakkhattaggÄho bhavissati*)', 'The moon and the sun will go on their proper courses (*candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'The moon and the sun will go on wrong courses (*candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'The stars will go on their proper courses (*nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati*)', 'The stars will go on wrong courses There will be a fall of meteors, there will be a skyblaze, there will be an earthquake, there will be an earth-roar, there will be a rising and setting, a darkening and brightening of the moon, the sun, the stars; and such will be the outcome of these things: there will be an eclipse of the moon, there will be an eclipse of the sun, there will be an eclipse of a constellation; the sun and the moon will go on their proper courses; there will be an aberration of the sun and moon; the constellations will go on their proper courses; there will be an aberration of a constellation; there will be a fall of meteors, there will be a skyblaze, there will be an earthquake, there will be an earth-roar, there will be a rising and setting, a darkening and brightening of the moon, the sun, the stars. He abstains from such wrong means of livelihood, from such debased arts. This pertains to his moral discipline.
209. bhavissati, ukkÄpÄto bhavissati, disÄá¸Äho bhavissati, bhÅ«micÄlo bhavissati, devadudrabhi bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyanakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uggamanaá¹ƒ ogamanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ vodÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko candaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko sÅ«riyaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko nakkhattaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko ukkÄpÄto bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko disÄá¸Äho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko bhÅ«micÄlo bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko devadudrabhi bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyanakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uggamanaá¹ƒ ogamanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ vodÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 209. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ suvuá¹­á¹­hikÄ bhavissati, dubbuá¹­á¹­hikÄ bhavissati, subhikkhaá¹ƒ bhavissati, dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ bhavissati, khemaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bhayaá¹ƒ bhavissati, rogo bhavissati, Ärogyaá¹ƒ bhavissati, muddÄ, gaá¹‡anÄ, saá¹…khÄnaá¹ƒ, kÄveyyaá¹ƒ, lokÄyataá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 210. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ ÄvÄhanaá¹ƒ vivÄhanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒvaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ vivaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ saá¹…kiraá¹‡aá¹ƒ vikiraá¹‡aá¹ƒ subhagakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ dubbhagakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ viruddhagabbhakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ jivhÄnibandhanaá¹ƒ hanusaá¹ƒhananaá¹ƒ hatthÄbhijappanaá¹ƒ hanujappanaá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡ajappanaá¹ƒ ÄdÄsapaÃ±haá¹ƒ kumÄrikapaÃ±haá¹ƒ devapaÃ±haá¹ƒ Ädiccupaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ mahatupaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ abbhujjalanaá¹ƒ sirivhÄyanaá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 211. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ
â€œOr he might say: â€˜Whereas some ascetics and Brahmins, while living on the food offered by the faithful, earn their living by a wrong means of livelihood, by such debased arts. as predicting: there will be abundant rain; there will be a drought; there will be a good harvest; there will be a famine; there will be security; there will be danger; there will be sickness; there will be health; or accounting, computing, calculating, poetic composition, philosophising, he abstains from such wrong means of livelihood, from such debased arts. This pertains to his moral discipline.
210. bhavissati, ukkÄpÄto bhavissati, disÄá¸Äho bhavissati, bhÅ«micÄlo bhavissati, devadudrabhi bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyanakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uggamanaá¹ƒ ogamanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ vodÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko candaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko sÅ«riyaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko nakkhattaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko ukkÄpÄto bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko disÄá¸Äho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko bhÅ«micÄlo bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko devadudrabhi bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyanakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uggamanaá¹ƒ ogamanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ vodÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 209. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ suvuá¹­á¹­hikÄ bhavissati, dubbuá¹­á¹­hikÄ bhavissati, subhikkhaá¹ƒ bhavissati, dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ bhavissati, khemaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bhayaá¹ƒ bhavissati, rogo bhavissati, Ärogyaá¹ƒ bhavissati, muddÄ, gaá¹‡anÄ, saá¹…khÄnaá¹ƒ, kÄveyyaá¹ƒ, lokÄyataá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 210. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ ÄvÄhanaá¹ƒ vivÄhanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒvaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ vivaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ saá¹…kiraá¹‡aá¹ƒ vikiraá¹‡aá¹ƒ subhagakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ dubbhagakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ viruddhagabbhakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ jivhÄnibandhanaá¹ƒ hanusaá¹ƒhananaá¹ƒ hatthÄbhijappanaá¹ƒ hanujappanaá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡ajappanaá¹ƒ ÄdÄsapaÃ±haá¹ƒ kumÄrikapaÃ±haá¹ƒ devapaÃ±haá¹ƒ Ädiccupaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ mahatupaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ abbhujjalanaá¹ƒ sirivhÄyanaá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 211. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ
â€œOr he might say: â€˜Whereas some ascetics and Brahmins, while living on the food offered by the faithful, earn their living by a wrong means of livelihood, by such debased arts as arranging the giving and taking in marriage, engagements and divorces; declaring the time for saving and spending, bringing good or bad luck, procuring abortions, using spells to bind the tongue, binding the jaw, making the hands jerk, causing deafness, getting answers with a mirror, a girl-medium, a *deva*; worshipping the sun or Great BrahmÄ, breathing fire, invoking the goddess of luck, he abstains from such wrong means of livelihood, from such debased arts. This pertains to his moral discipline.
211. bhavissati, ukkÄpÄto bhavissati, disÄá¸Äho bhavissati, bhÅ«micÄlo bhavissati, devadudrabhi bhavissati, candimasÅ«riyanakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uggamanaá¹ƒ ogamanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ vodÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko candaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko sÅ«riyaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko nakkhattaggÄho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ pathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ nakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uppathagamanaá¹ƒ bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko ukkÄpÄto bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko disÄá¸Äho bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko bhÅ«micÄlo bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄko devadudrabhi bhavissati, evaá¹ƒvipÄkaá¹ƒ candimasÅ«riyanakkhattÄnaá¹ƒ uggamanaá¹ƒ ogamanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ vodÄnaá¹ƒ bhavissati iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 209. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ suvuá¹­á¹­hikÄ bhavissati, dubbuá¹­á¹­hikÄ bhavissati, subhikkhaá¹ƒ bhavissati, dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ bhavissati, khemaá¹ƒ bhavissati, bhayaá¹ƒ bhavissati, rogo bhavissati, Ärogyaá¹ƒ bhavissati, muddÄ, gaá¹‡anÄ, saá¹…khÄnaá¹ƒ, kÄveyyaá¹ƒ, lokÄyataá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 210. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ ÄvÄhanaá¹ƒ vivÄhanaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒvaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ vivaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ saá¹…kiraá¹‡aá¹ƒ vikiraá¹‡aá¹ƒ subhagakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ dubbhagakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ viruddhagabbhakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ jivhÄnibandhanaá¹ƒ hanusaá¹ƒhananaá¹ƒ hatthÄbhijappanaá¹ƒ hanujappanaá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡ajappanaá¹ƒ ÄdÄsapaÃ±haá¹ƒ kumÄrikapaÃ±haá¹ƒ devapaÃ±haá¹ƒ Ädiccupaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ mahatupaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ abbhujjalanaá¹ƒ sirivhÄyanaá¹ƒ iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 211. "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ
â€œOr he might say: â€˜Whereas some ascetics and Brahmins, while living on the food offered by the faithful, earn their living by a wrong means of livelihood, by such debased arts and making a living. As follows: appeasing the deities (*devatÄ*) and redeeming vows to them, making earth-house spells, causing virility or impotence, preparing and consecrating building sites, giving ritual rinsings and bathings, making sacrifices, giving emetics, purges, expectorants and phlegmagogues, giving ear-, eye-, nose-medicine, ointments and counter-ointments, eye-surgery, surgery, pediatrics, using balms to counter the side-effects of previous remedies, or the releasing of herbs. A monk refrains from such base arts and wrong means of livelihood. This pertains to his morality (*Å›Ä«la*).
212. kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ santikammaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhikammaá¹ƒ bhÅ«takammaá¹ƒ bhÅ«rikammaá¹ƒ vassakammaá¹ƒ vossakammaá¹ƒ vatthukammaá¹ƒ vatthuparikammaá¹ƒ Äcamanaá¹ƒ nhÄpanaá¹ƒ juhanaá¹ƒ vamanaá¹ƒ virecanaá¹ƒ uddhaá¹ƒvirecanaá¹ƒ adhovirecanaá¹ƒ sÄ«savirecanaá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡atelaá¹ƒ nettatappanaá¹ƒ natthukammaá¹ƒ aÃ±janaá¹ƒ paccaÃ±janaá¹ƒ sÄlÄkiyaá¹ƒ sallakattiyaá¹ƒ dÄrakatikicchÄ, mÅ«labhesajjÄnaá¹ƒ anuppadÄnaá¹ƒ, osadhÄ«naá¹ƒ paá¹­imokkho iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 212. "sa kho so, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasampanno na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato. seyyathÄpi â€“ mahÄrÄja, rÄjÄ khattiyo muddhÄbhisitto nihatapaccÄmitto na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ paccatthikato, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasampanno na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato. so iminÄ ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato ajjhattaá¹ƒ anavajjasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu sÄ«lasampanno hoti. mahÄsÄ«laá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ. indriyasaá¹ƒvaro 213. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvÄro hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu cakkhunÄ rÅ«paá¹ƒ disvÄ na nimittaggÄhÄ« hoti nÄnubyaÃ±janaggÄhÄ«. yatvÄdhikaraá¹‡amenaá¹ƒ cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ viharantaá¹ƒ abhijjhÄ domanassÄ pÄpakÄ akusalÄ dhammÄ anvÄssaveyyuá¹ƒ, tassa saá¹ƒvarÄya paá¹­ipajjati, rakkhati cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ, cakkhundriye saá¹ƒvaraá¹ƒ Äpajjati. sotena saddaá¹ƒ sutvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ ghÄnena gandhaá¹ƒ ghÄyitvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ jivhÄya rasaá¹ƒ sÄyitvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ kÄyena phoá¹­á¹­habbaá¹ƒ phusitvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ manasÄ dhammaá¹ƒ viÃ±Ã±Äya na nimittaggÄhÄ« hoti nÄnubyaÃ±janaggÄhÄ«. yatvÄdhikaraá¹‡amenaá¹ƒ manindriyaá¹ƒ asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ viharantaá¹ƒ abhijjhÄ domanassÄ pÄpakÄ akusalÄ dhammÄ anvÄssaveyyuá¹ƒ, tassa saá¹ƒvarÄya paá¹­ipajjati, rakkhati manindriyaá¹ƒ, manindriye saá¹ƒvaraá¹ƒ Äpajjati. so iminÄ ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato ajjhattaá¹ƒ abyÄsekasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvÄro hoti.
"And then, great king, that *bhiká¹£u* who is thus perfected in morality (*Å›Ä«lasampanno*) sees no danger from anywhere owing to his being restrained by morality (*Å›Ä«lasaá¹ƒvarato*). Just as a head-anointed noble warrior (*ká¹£atriya*) who has defeated his enemies sees no danger anywhere from his enemies, so the *bhiká¹£u* who is thus possessed of moral discipline sees no danger anywhere in regard to his restraint by moral discipline. Possessing this aggregate of noble virtue (*Äryena Å›Ä«lakkhandhena*), he experiences within himself a bliss that is blameless (*anavajjasukhaá¹ƒ*). In this way, great king, the *bhiká¹£u* is possessed of moral discipline (*Å›Ä«lasampanno*). The great section on morality (*mahÄsÄ«laá¹ƒ*) is finished. Restraint of the Senses (*indriyasaá¹ƒvaro*)
213. kappenti. seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ santikammaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhikammaá¹ƒ bhÅ«takammaá¹ƒ bhÅ«rikammaá¹ƒ vassakammaá¹ƒ vossakammaá¹ƒ vatthukammaá¹ƒ vatthuparikammaá¹ƒ Äcamanaá¹ƒ nhÄpanaá¹ƒ juhanaá¹ƒ vamanaá¹ƒ virecanaá¹ƒ uddhaá¹ƒvirecanaá¹ƒ adhovirecanaá¹ƒ sÄ«savirecanaá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡atelaá¹ƒ nettatappanaá¹ƒ natthukammaá¹ƒ aÃ±janaá¹ƒ paccaÃ±janaá¹ƒ sÄlÄkiyaá¹ƒ sallakattiyaá¹ƒ dÄrakatikicchÄ, mÅ«labhesajjÄnaá¹ƒ anuppadÄnaá¹ƒ, osadhÄ«naá¹ƒ paá¹­imokkho iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 212. "sa kho so, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasampanno na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato. seyyathÄpi â€“ mahÄrÄja, rÄjÄ khattiyo muddhÄbhisitto nihatapaccÄmitto na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ paccatthikato, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasampanno na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato. so iminÄ ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato ajjhattaá¹ƒ anavajjasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu sÄ«lasampanno hoti. mahÄsÄ«laá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ. indriyasaá¹ƒvaro 213. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvÄro hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu cakkhunÄ rÅ«paá¹ƒ disvÄ na nimittaggÄhÄ« hoti nÄnubyaÃ±janaggÄhÄ«. yatvÄdhikaraá¹‡amenaá¹ƒ cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ viharantaá¹ƒ abhijjhÄ domanassÄ pÄpakÄ akusalÄ dhammÄ anvÄssaveyyuá¹ƒ, tassa saá¹ƒvarÄya paá¹­ipajjati, rakkhati cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ, cakkhundriye saá¹ƒvaraá¹ƒ Äpajjati. sotena saddaá¹ƒ sutvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ ghÄnena gandhaá¹ƒ ghÄyitvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ jivhÄya rasaá¹ƒ sÄyitvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ kÄyena phoá¹­á¹­habbaá¹ƒ phusitvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ manasÄ dhammaá¹ƒ viÃ±Ã±Äya na nimittaggÄhÄ« hoti nÄnubyaÃ±janaggÄhÄ«. yatvÄdhikaraá¹‡amenaá¹ƒ manindriyaá¹ƒ asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ viharantaá¹ƒ abhijjhÄ domanassÄ pÄpakÄ akusalÄ dhammÄ anvÄssaveyyuá¹ƒ, tassa saá¹ƒvarÄya paá¹­ipajjati, rakkhati manindriyaá¹ƒ, manindriye saá¹ƒvaraá¹ƒ Äpajjati. so iminÄ ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato ajjhattaá¹ƒ abyÄsekasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvÄro hoti.
"And how, great king, does the *bhiká¹£u* guard the doors of his senses (*indriyesu guttadvÄro*)? Herein, great king, having seen a form (*rÅ«paá¹ƒ*) with the eye (*cakkhunÄ*), the *bhiká¹£u* does not grasp at the sign (*nimitta*) or the details (*anubyaÃ±jana*). Since, if he left the eye faculty (*cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ*) unrestrained (*asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ*), bad, unwholesome states of longing (*abhijjhÄ*) and dejection (*domanassÄ*) might invade him, he practices the way of its restraint (*saá¹ƒvarÄya*), he guards the eye faculty (*cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ*), he undertakes the restraint of the eye faculty (*cakkhundriye saá¹ƒvaram Äpajjati*). On hearing a sound (*Å›abdaá¹ƒ*) with the ear (*Å›otena*)â€¦ on smelling an odor (*gandhaá¹ƒ*) with the nose (*ghÄá¹‡ena*)â€¦ on tasting a flavor (*rasaá¹ƒ*) with the tongue (*jihvÄya*)â€¦ on touching a tangible object (*phoá¹­á¹­habbaá¹ƒ*) with the body (*kÄyena*)â€¦ on cognizing a mind-object (*dhammaá¹ƒ*) with the mind (*manasÄ*), the *bhiká¹£u* does not grasp at the sign (*nimitta*) or the details (*anubyaÃ±jana*). Since, if he left the mind faculty (*manindriyaá¹ƒ*) unrestrained (*asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ*), bad unwholesome states of longing (*abhijjhÄ*) and dejection (*domanassÄ*) might invade him, he practices restraint over it; he guards the mind faculty (*manindriyaá¹ƒ*), he undertakes the restraint of the mind faculty (*manindriye saá¹ƒvaram Äpajjati*). Possessing this noble restraint of the faculties (*Äryena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena*), he experiences within himself a bliss that is unsullied (*abyÄsekasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti*). In this way, great king, the *bhiká¹£u* guards the doors of the sense faculties. Mindfulness and Clear Comprehension (*satisampajaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ*)
214. satisampajaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ 214. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu abhikkante paá¹­ikkante sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, Älokite vilokite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, samiÃ±jite pasÄrite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, saá¹…ghÄá¹­ipattacÄ«varadhÄraá¹‡e sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, asite pÄ«te khÄyite sÄyite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, uccÄrapassÄvakamme sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, gate á¹­hite nisinne sutte jÄgarite bhÄsite tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄve sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti. santoso 215. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena, kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, pakkhÄ« sakuá¹‡o yena yeneva á¸eti, sapattabhÄrova á¸eti. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti. nÄ«varaá¹‡appahÄnaá¹ƒ 216. "so iminÄ ca ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, imÄya ca ariyÄya santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ samannÄgato, vivittaá¹ƒ senÄsanaá¹ƒ bhajati araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ pabbataá¹ƒ kandaraá¹ƒ giriguhaá¹ƒ susÄnaá¹ƒ vanapatthaá¹ƒ abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ. so pacchÄbhattaá¹ƒ piá¹‡á¸apÄtappaá¹­ikkanto nisÄ«dati pallaá¹…kaá¹ƒ ÄbhujitvÄ ujuá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhÄya parimukhaá¹ƒ satiá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hapetvÄ. 217. "so abhijjhaá¹ƒ loke pahÄya vigatÄbhijjhena cetasÄ viharati, abhijjhÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ pahÄya
"And how, great king, is the *bhiká¹£u* endowed with mindfulness and clear comprehension (*satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato*)? Herein, great king, in going forward (*abhikkante*) and returning (*paá¹­ikkante*), the *bhiká¹£u* acts with clear comprehension (*sampajÄnakÄrÄ«*). In looking ahead (*Älokite*) and looking aside (*vilokite*), he acts with clear comprehension. In bending (*samiÃ±jite*) and stretching (*pasÄrite*) the limbs, he acts with clear comprehension. In wearing his robes and cloak and using his almsbowl, he acts with clear comprehension. In eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting, he acts with clear comprehension. In defecating and urinating, he acts with clear comprehension. In going, standing, sitting, lying down, in waking, speaking and in keeping silent, he acts with clear comprehension. In this way, great king, the *bhiká¹£u* is endowed with mindfulness and clear comprehension (*satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato*). Contentment (*santoso*)
215. satisampajaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ 214. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu abhikkante paá¹­ikkante sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, Älokite vilokite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, samiÃ±jite pasÄrite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, saá¹…ghÄá¹­ipattacÄ«varadhÄraá¹‡e sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, asite pÄ«te khÄyite sÄyite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, uccÄrapassÄvakamme sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, gate á¹­hite nisinne sutte jÄgarite bhÄsite tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄve sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti. santoso 215. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena, kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, pakkhÄ« sakuá¹‡o yena yeneva á¸eti, sapattabhÄrova á¸eti. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti. nÄ«varaá¹‡appahÄnaá¹ƒ 216. "so iminÄ ca ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, imÄya ca ariyÄya santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ samannÄgato, vivittaá¹ƒ senÄsanaá¹ƒ bhajati araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ pabbataá¹ƒ kandaraá¹ƒ giriguhaá¹ƒ susÄnaá¹ƒ vanapatthaá¹ƒ abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ. so pacchÄbhattaá¹ƒ piá¹‡á¸apÄtappaá¹­ikkanto nisÄ«dati pallaá¹…kaá¹ƒ ÄbhujitvÄ ujuá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhÄya parimukhaá¹ƒ satiá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hapetvÄ. 217. "so abhijjhaá¹ƒ loke pahÄya vigatÄbhijjhena cetasÄ viharati, abhijjhÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ pahÄya
"And how, great king, is the *bhiká¹£u* content (*santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti*)? Herein, great king, a *bhiká¹£u* is content with robes (*cÄ«vara*) to protect his body (*kÄyaparihÄrikena*), and almsfood (*piá¹‡á¸apÄtena*) to sustain his belly (*kucchiparihÄrikena*). Wherever he goes he sets out taking only along with him. Just as a bird, wherever it goes, flies with its wings as its only burden. in the same way a *bhikkhu* is content with robes to protect his body and almsfood to sustain his belly; Wherever he goes he sets out taking only along with him. In this way, great king, the *bhiká¹£u* is content. Abandoning the Hindrances (*nÄ«varaá¹‡appahÄnaá¹ƒ*)
216. satisampajaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ 214. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu abhikkante paá¹­ikkante sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, Älokite vilokite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, samiÃ±jite pasÄrite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, saá¹…ghÄá¹­ipattacÄ«varadhÄraá¹‡e sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, asite pÄ«te khÄyite sÄyite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, uccÄrapassÄvakamme sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, gate á¹­hite nisinne sutte jÄgarite bhÄsite tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄve sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti. santoso 215. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena, kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, pakkhÄ« sakuá¹‡o yena yeneva á¸eti, sapattabhÄrova á¸eti. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti. nÄ«varaá¹‡appahÄnaá¹ƒ 216. "so iminÄ ca ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, imÄya ca ariyÄya santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ samannÄgato, vivittaá¹ƒ senÄsanaá¹ƒ bhajati araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ pabbataá¹ƒ kandaraá¹ƒ giriguhaá¹ƒ susÄnaá¹ƒ vanapatthaá¹ƒ abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ. so pacchÄbhattaá¹ƒ piá¹‡á¸apÄtappaá¹­ikkanto nisÄ«dati pallaá¹…kaá¹ƒ ÄbhujitvÄ ujuá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhÄya parimukhaá¹ƒ satiá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hapetvÄ. 217. "so abhijjhaá¹ƒ loke pahÄya vigatÄbhijjhena cetasÄ viharati, abhijjhÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ pahÄya
"Then he, equipped with this noble aggregate of moral discipline (*Äryena sÄ«lakkhandhena*), with this noble restraint of the senses (*indriyasaá¹ƒvarena*), with this noble mindfulness and clear comprehension (*satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena*), and with this noble contentment (*santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ*), finds a solitary lodging: a forest (*araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ*), the foot of a tree (*rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ*), a mountain (*pabbataá¹ƒ*), a glen (*kandaraá¹ƒ*), a hillside cave (*giriguhaá¹ƒ*), a charnel-ground (*susÄnaá¹ƒ*), a jungle-thicket (*vanapatthaá¹ƒ*), or in the open air (*abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ*) on a heap of straw (*palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ*). After returning from his almsround, following his meals, he sits down, crosses his legs, holds his body erect, and sets up mindfulness before him.
217. satisampajaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ 214. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu abhikkante paá¹­ikkante sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, Älokite vilokite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, samiÃ±jite pasÄrite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, saá¹…ghÄá¹­ipattacÄ«varadhÄraá¹‡e sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, asite pÄ«te khÄyite sÄyite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, uccÄrapassÄvakamme sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, gate á¹­hite nisinne sutte jÄgarite bhÄsite tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄve sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti. santoso 215. "kathaÃ±ca, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti? idha, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena, kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, pakkhÄ« sakuá¹‡o yena yeneva á¸eti, sapattabhÄrova á¸eti. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. evaá¹ƒ kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti. nÄ«varaá¹‡appahÄnaá¹ƒ 216. "so iminÄ ca ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, imÄya ca ariyÄya santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ samannÄgato, vivittaá¹ƒ senÄsanaá¹ƒ bhajati araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ pabbataá¹ƒ kandaraá¹ƒ giriguhaá¹ƒ susÄnaá¹ƒ vanapatthaá¹ƒ abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ. so pacchÄbhattaá¹ƒ piá¹‡á¸apÄtappaá¹­ikkanto nisÄ«dati pallaá¹…kaá¹ƒ ÄbhujitvÄ ujuá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhÄya parimukhaá¹ƒ satiá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hapetvÄ. 217. "so abhijjhaá¹ƒ loke pahÄya vigatÄbhijjhena cetasÄ viharati, abhijjhÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ pahÄya
"Abandoning hankering (*abhijjhaá¹ƒ*) for the world (*loke*), he dwells with a mind freed from such hankering, and he purifies his mind from it. Abandoning ill-will and hatred (*byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ*) Abiding with a mind free from ill will, compassionate for the welfare of all living beings, he purifies his mind from ill will and hatred. Having abandoned sloth and torpor, he abides free from sloth and torpor, percipient of light, mindful and fully aware; he purifies his mind from sloth and torpor. Abandoning restlessness and remorse, he abides unagitated with a mind inwardly peaceful; he purifies his mind from restlessness and remorse. Abandoning doubt, he abides having gone beyond doubt, unperplexed about wholesome states; he purifies his mind from doubt.
218. abyÄpannacitto viharati sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ«, byÄpÄdapadosÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. thinamiddhaá¹ƒ pahÄya vigatathinamiddho viharati ÄlokasaÃ±Ã±Ä«, sato sampajÄno, thinamiddhÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. uddhaccakukkuccaá¹ƒ pahÄya anuddhato viharati, ajjhattaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasantacitto, uddhaccakukkuccÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. vicikicchaá¹ƒ pahÄya tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho viharati, akathaá¹ƒkathÄ« kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. 218. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante payojeyya. tassa te kammantÄ samijjheyyuá¹ƒ. so yÄni ca porÄá¹‡Äni iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni, tÄni ca byantiá¹ƒ kareyya [byantÄ«kareyya (sÄ«. syÄ. kaá¹ƒ.)], siyÄ cassa uttariá¹ƒ avasiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ dÄrabharaá¹‡Äya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante payojesiá¹ƒ. tassa me te kammantÄ samijjhiá¹ƒsu. sohaá¹ƒ yÄni ca porÄá¹‡Äni iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni, tÄni ca byantiá¹ƒ akÄsiá¹ƒ, atthi ca me uttariá¹ƒ avasiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ dÄrabharaá¹‡ÄyÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 219. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso ÄbÄdhiko assa dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±cassa nacchÄdeyya, na cassa kÄye balamattÄ. so aparena samayena tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mucceyya, bhattaá¹ƒ cassa chÄdeyya, siyÄ cassa kÄye balamattÄ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe ÄbÄdhiko ahosiá¹ƒ dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±ca me nacchÄdesi, na ca me Äsi [na cassa me (ka.)] kÄye balamattÄ. somhi etarahi tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mutto, bhattaÃ±ca me chÄdeti, atthi ca me kÄye balamattÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 220. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso bandhanÄgÄre baddho assa. so aparena samayena tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ mucceyya sotthinÄ abbhayena [ubbayena (sÄ«. ka.)], na cassa kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe bandhanÄgÄre baddho ahosiá¹ƒ, somhi etarahi tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ
"Just as, great king, a man might take a loan and apply it to his business, and his business were to succeed, so that he could pay back his old debts (iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni) and would have enough money left over to maintain a wife. He might think: 'Before this I developed my business by borrowing. Now my businesses have prospered. So I have paid back all the money from the old loans, and I have extra left over to maintain a wife.' And as a result, he would become glad and experience joy (pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, somanassaá¹ƒ).

"seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso ÄbÄdhiko assa dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±cassa nacchÄdeyya, na cassa kÄye balamattÄ. so aparena samayena tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mucceyya, bhattaá¹ƒ cassa chÄdeyya, siyÄ cassa kÄye balamattÄ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe ÄbÄdhiko ahosiá¹ƒ dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±ca me nacchÄdesi, na ca me Äsi [na cassa me (ka.)] kÄye balamattÄ. somhi etarahi tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mutto, bhattaÃ±ca me chÄdeti, atthi ca me kÄye balamattÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 220. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso bandhanÄgÄre baddho assa. so aparena samayena tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ mucceyya sotthinÄ abbhayena [ubbayena (sÄ«. ka.)], na cassa kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe bandhanÄgÄre baddho ahosiá¹ƒ, somhi etarahi tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ
"Just as, great king, a man were to become sick, afflicted, gravely ill, so that he could not enjoy his food and his strength would decline. After some time he would recover from that illness and would enjoy his food and regain his bodily strength. He might think: 'Before this I was ill, afflicted, gravely ill, so that I could not enjoy my food and my body had no strength. Now I have recovered from that illness, I enjoy my food, and my body has strength.' And as a result, he would become glad and experience joy (pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, somanassaá¹ƒ).

"seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso bandhanÄgÄre baddho assa. so aparena samayena tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ mucceyya sotthinÄ abbhayena [ubbayena (sÄ«. ka.)], na cassa kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe bandhanÄgÄre baddho ahosiá¹ƒ, somhi etarahi tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ
"Just as, great king, a man were locked up in a prison. After some time he would be released from prison, safe and secure, with no loss of his possessions. He might think: 'Before this I was imprisoned. Now I am released from that prison, safe and secure, and there is no loss to my possessions.' And as a result, he would become glad and experience joy (pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, somanassaá¹ƒ).
221. mutto sotthinÄ abbhayena. natthi ca me kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 221. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso dÄso assa anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. so aparena samayena tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mucceyya attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe dÄso ahosiá¹ƒ anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. somhi etarahi tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mutto attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 222. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjeyya dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. so aparena samayena taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthareyya sotthinÄ, gÄmantaá¹ƒ anupÄpuá¹‡eyya khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjiá¹ƒ dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthiá¹‡á¹‡o sotthinÄ, gÄmantaá¹ƒ anuppatto khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaâ€™nti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 223. "evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu yathÄ iá¹‡aá¹ƒ yathÄ rogaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ yathÄ dÄsabyaá¹ƒ yathÄ kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ, evaá¹ƒ ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e appahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 224. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, yathÄ Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ yathÄ Ärogyaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ yathÄ bhujissaá¹ƒ yathÄ khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 225. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. paá¹­hamajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 226. "so vivicceva kÄmehi, vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so
"Just as, great king, a man were a slave, without independence, subservient to others, unable to go where he wants. After some time he would be released from slavery and gain his independence; he would no longer be subservient to others but a free man able to go where he wants. He might think: 'Before this I was a slave, without independence, subservient to others, unable to go where I wanted. Now I am released from that slavery, I am independent, not subservient to others, a free man able to go where I want.' And as a result, he would become glad and experience joy (pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, somanassaá¹ƒ).
222. mutto sotthinÄ abbhayena. natthi ca me kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 221. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso dÄso assa anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. so aparena samayena tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mucceyya attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe dÄso ahosiá¹ƒ anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. somhi etarahi tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mutto attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 222. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjeyya dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. so aparena samayena taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthareyya sotthinÄ, gÄmantaá¹ƒ anupÄpuá¹‡eyya khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjiá¹ƒ dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthiá¹‡á¹‡o sotthinÄ, gÄmantaá¹ƒ anuppatto khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaâ€™nti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 223. "evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu yathÄ iá¹‡aá¹ƒ yathÄ rogaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ yathÄ dÄsabyaá¹ƒ yathÄ kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ, evaá¹ƒ ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e appahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 224. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, yathÄ Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ yathÄ Ärogyaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ yathÄ bhujissaá¹ƒ yathÄ khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 225. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. paá¹­hamajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 226. "so vivicceva kÄmehi, vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so
"Just as, great king, a man with wealth and possessions were travelling along a desert road where food was scarce and dangers were many. After some time he would cross over the desert and arrive safely at a village which is safe and free from danger. He might think: "Before this, I was wealthy and prosperous, but I embarked on a dangerous and frightening desert road, a time of famine. Now I have safely crossed that desert, reached the edge of a village, a safe and fearless place." Then, as a result of that, he would gain joy (*pÄmojjaá¹ƒ*) and attain gladness (*somanassaá¹ƒ*).
223. mutto sotthinÄ abbhayena. natthi ca me kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 221. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso dÄso assa anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. so aparena samayena tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mucceyya attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe dÄso ahosiá¹ƒ anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. somhi etarahi tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mutto attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 222. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjeyya dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. so aparena samayena taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthareyya sotthinÄ, gÄmantaá¹ƒ anupÄpuá¹‡eyya khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjiá¹ƒ dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthiá¹‡á¹‡o sotthinÄ, gÄmantaá¹ƒ anuppatto khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaâ€™nti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 223. "evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu yathÄ iá¹‡aá¹ƒ yathÄ rogaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ yathÄ dÄsabyaá¹ƒ yathÄ kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ, evaá¹ƒ ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e appahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 224. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, yathÄ Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ yathÄ Ärogyaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ yathÄ bhujissaá¹ƒ yathÄ khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 225. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. paá¹­hamajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 226. "so vivicceva kÄmehi, vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so
"In the same way, great king (*mahÄrÄja*), when a *bhikkhu* sees that these five hindrances (*paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e*) are unabandoned within himself, he regards that as a debt (*iá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), as a sickness (*rogaá¹ƒ*), as confinement in prison (*bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ*), as slavery (*dÄsabyaá¹ƒ*), as a desert road (*kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ*).
224. mutto sotthinÄ abbhayena. natthi ca me kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 221. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso dÄso assa anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. so aparena samayena tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mucceyya attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe dÄso ahosiá¹ƒ anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. somhi etarahi tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mutto attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 222. "evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu yathÄ iá¹‡aá¹ƒ yathÄ rogaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ yathÄ dÄsabyaá¹ƒ yathÄ kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ, evaá¹ƒ ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e appahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 224. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, yathÄ Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ yathÄ Ärogyaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ yathÄ bhujissaá¹ƒ yathÄ khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 225. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. paá¹­hamajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 226. "But when he sees that these five hindrances have been abandoned within himself, he regards that as freedom from debt (*Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ*), as good health (*Ärogyaá¹ƒ*), as release from prison (*bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ*), as freedom from slavery (*bhujissaá¹ƒ*), as a place of safety (*khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ*).
225. mutto sotthinÄ abbhayena. natthi ca me kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 221. "evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu yathÄ iá¹‡aá¹ƒ yathÄ rogaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ yathÄ dÄsabyaá¹ƒ yathÄ kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ, evaá¹ƒ ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e appahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 224. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, yathÄ Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ yathÄ Ärogyaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ yathÄ bhujissaá¹ƒ yathÄ khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 225. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. paá¹­hamajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 226. "so vivicceva kÄmehi, vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so
"When he sees that these five hindrances have been abandoned within himself, gladness (*pÄmojjaá¹ƒ*) arises. When he is gladdened, rapture (*pÄ«ti*) arises. When his mind is filled with rapture, his body becomes tranquil; tranquil in body, he experiences happiness (*sukhaá¹ƒ*); being happy, his mind becomes concentrated (*samÄdhiyati*). The first *jhÄna*.
226. mutto sotthinÄ abbhayena. natthi ca me kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 221. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso dÄso assa anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. so aparena samayena tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mucceyya attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe dÄso ahosiá¹ƒ anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. somhi etarahi tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mutto attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 222. "evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu yathÄ iá¹‡aá¹ƒ yathÄ rogaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ yathÄ dÄsabyaá¹ƒ yathÄ kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ, evaá¹ƒ ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e appahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 224. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, yathÄ Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ yathÄ Ärogyaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ yathÄ bhujissaá¹ƒ yathÄ khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 225. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. paá¹­hamajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 226. "so vivicceva kÄmehi, vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so
"Quite secluded from sensual pleasures (*kÄmehi*), secluded from unwholesome qualities (*akusalehi dhammehi*), he enters and remains in the first *jhÄna* (*paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ*), which is accompanied by applied thought (*savitakkaá¹ƒ*) and sustained thought (*savicÄraá¹ƒ*), with rapture and pleasure (*pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ*) born of seclusion (*vivekajaá¹ƒ*). He Thus, or in this way, the ordinary person, when describing the virtues of the *TathÄgata*, might say: â€˜The recluse Gotama is abstinent from such indulgence in games and the grounds for negligence.â€™
227. imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. 227. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, dakkho nhÄpako vÄ nhÄpakantevÄsÄ« vÄ kaá¹ƒsathÄle nhÄnÄ«yacuá¹‡á¹‡Äni ÄkiritvÄ udakena paripphosakaá¹ƒ paripphosakaá¹ƒ sanneyya, sÄyaá¹ƒ nhÄnÄ«yapiá¹‡á¸i snehÄnugatÄ snehaparetÄ santarabÄhirÄ phuá¹­Ä snehena, na ca paggharaá¹‡Ä«, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. dutiyajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 228. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu vitakkavicÄrÄnaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasamÄ ajjhattaá¹ƒ sampasÄdanaá¹ƒ cetaso ekodibhÄvaá¹ƒ avitakkaá¹ƒ avicÄraá¹ƒ samÄdhijaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ dutiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. 229. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, udakarahado gambhÄ«ro ubbhidodako [ubbhitodako (syÄ. kaá¹ƒ. ka.)] tassa nevassa puratthimÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na dakkhiá¹‡Äya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na pacchimÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na uttarÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, devo ca na kÄlenakÄlaá¹ƒ sammÄdhÄraá¹ƒ anuppaveccheyya. atha kho tamhÄva udakarahadÄ sÄ«tÄ vÄridhÄrÄ ubbhijjitvÄ tameva udakarahadaá¹ƒ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisandeyya parisandeyya paripÅ«reyya paripphareyya, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato udakarahadassa sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena
"Just as, great king, a skilled bath attendant or his apprentice, having sprinkled soap powder in a metal basin, gradually mixes it with water, so that the ball of soap powder becomes permeated with moisture, encompassed by moisture, suffused with moisture inside and out, yet does not trickle; even so, great king, a *bhikkhu* suffuses, drenches, fills, and permeates this very body with delight and joy born of detachment ( *vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena*), so that there is no part of his entire body untouched by this delight and joy born of detachment. This, too, great king, is a visible fruit of the ascetic life ( *sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphala*), more excellent and sublime than the previous ones. The Second *JhÄna*.
228. imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. 227. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, dakkho nhÄpako vÄ nhÄpakantevÄsÄ« vÄ kaá¹ƒsathÄle nhÄnÄ«yacuá¹‡á¹‡Äni ÄkiritvÄ udakena paripphosakaá¹ƒ paripphosakaá¹ƒ sanneyya, sÄyaá¹ƒ nhÄnÄ«yapiá¹‡á¸i snehÄnugatÄ snehaparetÄ santarabÄhirÄ phuá¹­Ä snehena, na ca paggharaá¹‡Ä«, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. dutiyajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 228. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu vitakkavicÄrÄnaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasamÄ ajjhattaá¹ƒ sampasÄdanaá¹ƒ cetaso ekodibhÄvaá¹ƒ avitakkaá¹ƒ avicÄraá¹ƒ samÄdhijaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ dutiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. 229. "Furthermore, great king, with the subsiding of applied and sustained thought (*vitakka-vicÄrÄnaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasamÄ*), a *bhikkhu*, by gaining inner tranquility and oneness of mind (*ajjhattaá¹ƒ sampasÄdanaá¹ƒ cetaso ekodibhÄvaá¹ƒ*), enters and remains in the second *jhÄna*, which is without applied and sustained thought, born of concentration (*samÄdhijaá¹ƒ*), filled with delight and joy. He suffuses, drenches, fills, and permeates this very body with delight and joy born of concentration (*samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena*), so that there is no part of his entire body untouched by this delight and joy born of concentration.
229. imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. 227. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, dakkho nhÄpako vÄ nhÄpakantevÄsÄ« vÄ kaá¹ƒsathÄle nhÄnÄ«yacuá¹‡á¹‡Äni ÄkiritvÄ udakena paripphosakaá¹ƒ paripphosakaá¹ƒ sanneyya, sÄyaá¹ƒ nhÄnÄ«yapiá¹‡á¸i snehÄnugatÄ snehaparetÄ santarabÄhirÄ phuá¹­Ä snehena, na ca paggharaá¹‡Ä«, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. dutiyajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 228. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu vitakkavicÄrÄnaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasamÄ ajjhattaá¹ƒ sampasÄdanaá¹ƒ cetaso ekodibhÄvaá¹ƒ avitakkaá¹ƒ avicÄraá¹ƒ samÄdhijaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ dutiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. 229. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, udakarahado gambhÄ«ro ubbhidodako [ubbhitodako (syÄ. kaá¹ƒ. ka.)] tassa nevassa puratthimÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na dakkhiá¹‡Äya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na pacchimÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na uttarÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, devo ca na kÄlenakÄlaá¹ƒ sammÄdhÄraá¹ƒ anuppaveccheyya. atha kho tamhÄva udakarahadÄ sÄ«tÄ vÄridhÄrÄ ubbhijjitvÄ tameva udakarahadaá¹ƒ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisandeyya parisandeyya paripÅ«reyya paripphareyya, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato udakarahadassa sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena
"Just as, great king, there were a deep lake whose waters welled up from below, having no inlet for water from the east, west, north, or south, nor would it be refilled from time to time with showers of rain; But from that very lake, cool streams of water would well up and drench, steep, fill, and permeate that very lake with cool water, so that there would be no part of that entire lake untouched by the cool water. Even so, great king, a *bhikkhu* suffuses, drenches, fills, and permeates this very body with delight and joy born of concentration (*samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena*), so that there is no part of his entire body untouched by this delight and joy born of concentration. This, too, great king, is a visible fruit of the ascetic life (*sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphala*), more excellent and sublime than the previous ones. The Third *JhÄna*.
230. apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. tatiyajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 230. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu pÄ«tiyÄ ca virÄgÄ upekkhako ca viharati sato sampajÄno, sukhaÃ±ca kÄyena paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti, yaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ ariyÄ Äcikkhanti â€“ â€˜upekkhako satimÄ sukhavihÄrÄ«â€™ti, tatiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ nippÄ«tikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa nippÄ«tikena sukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. 231. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, uppaliniyaá¹ƒ vÄ paduminiyaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kiniyaá¹ƒ vÄ appekaccÄni uppalÄni vÄ padumÄni vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄni vÄ udake jÄtÄni udake saá¹ƒvaá¸á¸hÄni udakÄnuggatÄni antonimuggaposÄ«ni, tÄni yÄva caggÄ yÄva ca mÅ«lÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisannÄni parisannÄni [abhisandÄni parisandÄni (ka.)] paripÅ«rÄni paripphuá¹­Äni [paripphuá¹­á¹­hÄni (pÄ«.)], nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvataá¹ƒ uppalÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ padumÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ nippÄ«tikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa nippÄ«tikena sukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. catutthajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 232. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahÄnÄ dukkhassa ca pahÄnÄ, pubbeva somanassadomanassÄnaá¹ƒ atthaá¹…gamÄ adukkhamasukhaá¹ƒ upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhiá¹ƒ catutthaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati, so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena pharitvÄ nisinno hoti, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti.
"Furthermore, great king, with the fading away of rapture (*pÄ«tiyÄ ca virÄgÄ*), a *bhikkhu* dwells in equanimity (*upekkhako*), mindful and clearly comprehending, and experiences happiness with the body; thus he enters and dwells in the third *jhÄna*, of which the noble ones declare: 'He dwells happily with equanimity and mindfulness.' He suffuses, drenches, fills, and permeates this very body with happiness free from rapture (*nippÄ«tikena sukhena*), so that there is no part of his entire body untouched by this happiness.
231. apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. tatiyajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 230. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu pÄ«tiyÄ ca virÄgÄ upekkhako ca viharati sato sampajÄno, sukhaÃ±ca kÄyena paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti, yaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ ariyÄ Äcikkhanti â€“ â€˜upekkhako satimÄ sukhavihÄrÄ«â€™ti, tatiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ nippÄ«tikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa nippÄ«tikena sukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. 231. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, uppaliniyaá¹ƒ vÄ paduminiyaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kiniyaá¹ƒ vÄ appekaccÄni uppalÄni vÄ padumÄni vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄni vÄ udake jÄtÄni udake saá¹ƒvaá¸á¸hÄni udakÄnuggatÄni antonimuggaposÄ«ni, tÄni yÄva caggÄ yÄva ca mÅ«lÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisannÄni parisannÄni [abhisandÄni parisandÄni (ka.)] paripÅ«rÄni paripphuá¹­Äni [paripphuá¹­á¹­hÄni (pÄ«.)], nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvataá¹ƒ uppalÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ padumÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ nippÄ«tikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa nippÄ«tikena sukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. catutthajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 232. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahÄnÄ dukkhassa ca pahÄnÄ, pubbeva somanassadomanassÄnaá¹ƒ atthaá¹…gamÄ adukkhamasukhaá¹ƒ upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhiá¹ƒ catutthaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati, so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena pharitvÄ nisinno hoti, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti.
"Just as, great king, suppose in a lotus pond there were blue lotuses ( *uppalÄni*), white lotuses ( *padumÄni*), or red lotuses (*puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄni*) that have been born in the water, grow in the water, and never rise up above the water, but flourish immersed in the water. From their tips to their roots they would be drenched, steeped, saturated, and suffused with cool water, so that there would be no part of those lotuses not suffused with cool water. In the same way, great king, the *bhikkhu* drenches, steeps, saturates and suffuses his body with the happiness free from rapture (*nippÄ«tikena sukhena*), so that there is no part of his entire body which is not. This, too, great king, is a visible fruit of recluseship more excellent and sublime than the previous ones. The Fourth *JhÄna*.
232. apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. tatiyajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 230. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, uppaliniyaá¹ƒ vÄ paduminiyaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kiniyaá¹ƒ vÄ appekaccÄni uppalÄni vÄ padumÄni vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄni vÄ udake jÄtÄni udake saá¹ƒvaá¸á¸hÄni udakÄnuggatÄni antonimuggaposÄ«ni, tÄni yÄva caggÄ yÄva ca mÅ«lÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisannÄni parisannÄni [abhisandÄni parisandÄni (ka.)] paripÅ«rÄni paripphuá¹­Äni [paripphuá¹­á¹­hÄni (pÄ«.)], nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvataá¹ƒ uppalÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ padumÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ nippÄ«tikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa nippÄ«tikena sukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. catutthajjhÄnaá¹ƒ 232. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahÄnÄ dukkhassa ca pahÄnÄ, pubbeva somanassadomanassÄnaá¹ƒ atthaá¹…gamÄ adukkhamasukhaá¹ƒ upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhiá¹ƒ catutthaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati, so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena pharitvÄ nisinno hoti, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti.
"Furthermore, great king, with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and grief, the *bhikkhu* enters and dwells in the fourth *jhÄna*, which is neither pleasant nor painful and contains mindfulness fully purified by equanimity. He sits suffusing his body with a pure bright mind, so that there is no part of his entire body not suffused by a pure bright mind.
233. 233. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso odÄtena vatthena sasÄ«saá¹ƒ pÄrupitvÄ nisinno assa, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa odÄtena vatthena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena pharitvÄ nisinno hoti, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. vipassanÄÃ±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ 234. "so [puna caparaá¹ƒ mahÄrÄja bhikkhu so (ka.)] evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte Ã±Äá¹‡adassanÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so evaá¹ƒ pajÄnÄti â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ kho me kÄyo rÅ«pÄ« cÄtumahÄbhÅ«tiko mÄtÄpettikasambhavo odanakummÄsÅ«pacayo aniccucchÄdana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaá¹ƒsana-dhammo, idaÃ±ca pana me viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ ettha sitaá¹ƒ ettha paá¹­ibaddhaâ€™nti. 235. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, maá¹‡i veá¸·uriyo subho jÄtimÄ aá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒso suparikammakato accho vippasanno anÄvilo sabbÄkÄrasampanno. tatrÄssa suttaá¹ƒ Ävutaá¹ƒ nÄ«laá¹ƒ vÄ pÄ«taá¹ƒ vÄ lohitaá¹ƒ vÄ [pÄ«takaá¹ƒ vÄ lohitakaá¹ƒ vÄ (ka.)] odÄtaá¹ƒ vÄ paá¹‡á¸usuttaá¹ƒ vÄ. tamenaá¹ƒ cakkhumÄ puriso hatthe karitvÄ paccavekkheyya â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ kho maá¹‡i veá¸·uriyo subho jÄtimÄ aá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒso suparikammakato accho vippasanno anÄvilo sabbÄkÄrasampanno, tatridaá¹ƒ suttaá¹ƒ Ävutaá¹ƒ nÄ«laá¹ƒ vÄ pÄ«taá¹ƒ vÄ lohitaá¹ƒ vÄ odÄtaá¹ƒ vÄ paá¹‡á¸usuttaá¹ƒ vÄâ€™ti. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte Ã±Äá¹‡adassanÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so evaá¹ƒ pajÄnÄti â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ kho me kÄyo rÅ«pÄ« cÄtumahÄbhÅ«tiko mÄtÄpettikasambhavo odanakummÄsÅ«pacayo aniccucchÄdanaparimaddanabhedanaviddhaá¹ƒsanadhammo, idaÃ±ca pana me viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ ettha sitaá¹ƒ ettha paá¹­ibaddhaâ€™nti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca.
"Just as, great king, a man might sit covered from head to foot with a white cloth, so that no part of his entire body would be untouched by the white cloth; even so, great king, the *bhikkhu* sits pervading this very body with a mind that is utterly pure and bright, so that no part of his entire body is unpervaded by a mind that is utterly pure and bright. This, too, great king, is a fruit of the monastic life visible in this very life, more surpassing and sublime than the previous fruits of the monastic life visible in this very life. Insight knowledge (*vipassanÄÃ±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ*).

"Again, with the mind thus concentrated, purified, bright, spotless, rid of defilements, pliable, workable, steadfast, and having attained imperturbability, he directs and inclines his mind to knowledge and vision. He understands thus: â€˜This is my body, having material form, composed of the four great elements, born of mother and father, nourished on rice and gruel, subject to impermanence, to being worn and rubbed away, to dissolution and disintegration; and this consciousness of mine is dependent on it and bound up with it.â€™
235. 233. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso odÄtena vatthena sasÄ«saá¹ƒ pÄrupitvÄ nisinno assa, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa odÄtena vatthena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa, evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena pharitvÄ nisinno hoti, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. vipassanÄÃ±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ 234. "so [puna caparaá¹ƒ mahÄrÄja bhikkhu so (ka.)] evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte Ã±Äá¹‡adassanÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so evaá¹ƒ pajÄnÄti â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ kho me kÄyo rÅ«pÄ« cÄtumahÄbhÅ«tiko mÄtÄpettikasambhavo odanakummÄsÅ«pacayo aniccucchÄdana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaá¹ƒsana-dhammo, idaÃ±ca pana me viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ ettha sitaá¹ƒ ettha paá¹­ibaddhaâ€™nti. 235. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, maá¹‡i veá¸·uriyo subho jÄtimÄ aá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒso suparikammakato accho vippasanno anÄvilo sabbÄkÄrasampanno. tatrÄssa suttaá¹ƒ Ävutaá¹ƒ nÄ«laá¹ƒ vÄ pÄ«taá¹ƒ vÄ lohitaá¹ƒ vÄ [pÄ«takaá¹ƒ vÄ lohitakaá¹ƒ vÄ (ka.)] odÄtaá¹ƒ vÄ paá¹‡á¸usuttaá¹ƒ vÄ. tamenaá¹ƒ cakkhumÄ puriso hatthe karitvÄ paccavekkheyya â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ kho maá¹‡i veá¸·uriyo subho jÄtimÄ aá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒso suparikammakato accho vippasanno anÄvilo sabbÄkÄrasampanno, tatridaá¹ƒ suttaá¹ƒ Ävutaá¹ƒ nÄ«laá¹ƒ vÄ pÄ«taá¹ƒ vÄ lohitaá¹ƒ vÄ odÄtaá¹ƒ vÄ paá¹‡á¸usuttaá¹ƒ vÄâ€™ti. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte Ã±Äá¹‡adassanÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so evaá¹ƒ pajÄnÄti â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ kho me kÄyo rÅ«pÄ« cÄtumahÄbhÅ«tiko mÄtÄpettikasambhavo odanakummÄsÅ«pacayo aniccucchÄdanaparimaddanabhedanaviddhaá¹ƒsanadhammo, idaÃ±ca pana me viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ ettha sitaá¹ƒ ettha paá¹­ibaddhaâ€™nti. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca.
"Just as, great king, there might be a *maá¹‡i* jewel, a beryl, of fine water, eight-faceted, well-cut, clear, limpid, flawless, endowed with all good qualities; and in it a thread might be strung, blue or yellow or red or white or brown. A man with good sight, taking it in his hand, might review it thus: â€˜This is a *maá¹‡i* jewel, a beryl, of fine water, eight-faceted, well-cut, clear, limpid, flawless, endowed with all good qualities; and in it is strung this thread, blue or yellow or red or white or brown.â€™ Even so, great king, the *bhikkhu* with mind thus concentrated, purified, bright, spotless, rid of defilements, pliable, workable, steadfast, and having attained imperturbability, directs and inclines his mind to knowledge and vision. He understands thus: â€˜This is my body, having material form, composed of the four great elements, born of mother and father, nourished on rice and gruel, subject to impermanence, to being worn and rubbed away, to dissolution and disintegration; and this consciousness of mine is dependent on it and bound up with it.â€™ This, too, great king, is a fruit of the monastic life visible in this very life, more surpassing and sublime than the previous fruits of the monastic life visible in this very life. The knowledge of the mind-made psychic power.
236. manomayiddhiÃ±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ 236. "so evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte manomayaá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ abhinimmÄnÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so imamhÄ kÄyÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ abhinimminÄti rÅ«piá¹ƒ manomayaá¹ƒ sabbaá¹…gapaccaá¹…giá¹ƒ ahÄ«nindriyaá¹ƒ. 237. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso muÃ±jamhÄ Ä«sikaá¹ƒ pavÄheyya [pabbÄheyya (syÄ. ka.)]. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ muÃ±jo, ayaá¹ƒ Ä«sikÄ, aÃ±Ã±o muÃ±jo, aÃ±Ã±Ä Ä«sikÄ, muÃ±jamhÄ tveva Ä«sikÄ pavÄá¸·hÄâ€™ti [pabbÄá¸·hÄti (syÄ. ka.)]. seyyathÄ vÄ pana, mahÄrÄja, puriso asiá¹ƒ kosiyÄ pavÄheyya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ asi, ayaá¹ƒ kosi, aÃ±Ã±o asi, aÃ±Ã±Ä kosi, kosiyÄ tveva asi pavÄá¸·ho"ti. seyyathÄ vÄ pana, mahÄrÄja, puriso ahiá¹ƒ karaá¹‡á¸Ä uddhareyya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ ahi, ayaá¹ƒ karaá¹‡á¸o. aÃ±Ã±o ahi, aÃ±Ã±o karaá¹‡á¸o, karaá¹‡á¸Ä tveva ahi ubbhatoâ€™ti [uddharito (syÄ. kaá¹ƒ.)]. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte manomayaá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ abhinimmÄnÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so imamhÄ kÄyÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ abhinimminÄti rÅ«piá¹ƒ manomayaá¹ƒ sabbaá¹…gapaccaá¹…giá¹ƒ ahÄ«nindriyaá¹ƒ. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. iddhividhaÃ±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ 238. "so evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte iddhividhÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so anekavihitaá¹ƒ iddhividhaá¹ƒ paccanubhoti â€“ ekopi hutvÄ bahudhÄ hoti, bahudhÄpi hutvÄ eko hoti, ÄvibhÄvaá¹ƒ tirobhÄvaá¹ƒ tirokuá¹­á¹­aá¹ƒ tiropÄkÄraá¹ƒ tiropabbataá¹ƒ asajjamÄno gacchati seyyathÄpi ÄkÄse. pathaviyÄpi ummujjanimujjaá¹ƒ karoti seyyathÄpi udake. udakepi abhijjamÄne gacchati [abhijjamÄno (sÄ«. ka.)] seyyathÄpi
"When his mind is thus concentrated, pure and bright, unblemished, free from defects, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs and inclines it to creating a mind-made body. He creates from this body another body having material form, mind-made, complete in all its parts, not lacking any faculties.
237. manomayiddhiÃ±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ 236. "so evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte manomayaá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ abhinimmÄnÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so imamhÄ kÄyÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ abhinimminÄti rÅ«piá¹ƒ manomayaá¹ƒ sabbaá¹…gapaccaá¹…giá¹ƒ ahÄ«nindriyaá¹ƒ. 237. "seyyathÄpi, mahÄrÄja, puriso muÃ±jamhÄ Ä«sikaá¹ƒ pavÄheyya [pabbÄheyya (syÄ. ka.)]. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ muÃ±jo, ayaá¹ƒ Ä«sikÄ, aÃ±Ã±o muÃ±jo, aÃ±Ã±Ä Ä«sikÄ, muÃ±jamhÄ tveva Ä«sikÄ pavÄá¸·hÄâ€™ti [pabbÄá¸·hÄti (syÄ. ka.)]. seyyathÄ vÄ pana, mahÄrÄja, puriso asiá¹ƒ kosiyÄ pavÄheyya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ asi, ayaá¹ƒ kosi, aÃ±Ã±o asi, aÃ±Ã±Ä kosi, kosiyÄ tveva asi pavÄá¸·ho"ti. seyyathÄ vÄ pana, mahÄrÄja, puriso ahiá¹ƒ karaá¹‡á¸Ä uddhareyya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ayaá¹ƒ ahi, ayaá¹ƒ karaá¹‡á¸o. aÃ±Ã±o ahi, aÃ±Ã±o karaá¹‡á¸o, karaá¹‡á¸Ä tveva ahi ubbhatoâ€™ti [uddharito (syÄ. kaá¹ƒ.)]. evameva kho, mahÄrÄja, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte manomayaá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ abhinimmÄnÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so imamhÄ kÄyÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ abhinimminÄti rÅ«piá¹ƒ manomayaá¹ƒ sabbaá¹…gapaccaá¹…giá¹ƒ ahÄ«nindriyaá¹ƒ. idampi kho, mahÄrÄja, sandiá¹­á¹­hikaá¹ƒ sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalaá¹ƒ purimehi sandiá¹­á¹­hikehi sÄmaÃ±Ã±aphalehi abhikkantataraÃ±ca paá¹‡Ä«tataraÃ±ca. iddhividhaÃ±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ 238. "so evaá¹ƒ samÄhite citte parisuddhe pariyodÄte anaá¹…gaá¹‡e vigatÅ«pakkilese mudubhÅ«te kammaniye á¹­hite ÄneÃ±jappatte iddhividhÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati abhininnÄmeti. so anekavihitaá¹ƒ iddhividhaá¹ƒ paccanubhoti â€“ ekopi hutvÄ bahudhÄ hoti, bahudhÄpi hutvÄ eko hoti, ÄvibhÄvaá¹ƒ tirobhÄvaá¹ƒ tirokuá¹­á¹­aá¹ƒ tiropÄkÄraá¹ƒ tiropabbataá¹ƒ asajjamÄno gacchati seyyathÄpi ÄkÄse. pathaviyÄpi ummujjanimujjaá¹ƒ karoti seyyathÄpi udake. udakepi abhijjamÄne gacchati [abhijjamÄno (sÄ«. ka.)] seyyathÄpi
"Great king, suppose a man were to draw out a reed from its sheath. He would think: 'This is the reed, this is the sheath.
