â€œWell then, Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, it is just the same thing. Those who were, as you say, the first sages of the Brahmins, the makers and expounders of the *mantras*, whose ancient verses are chanted, pronounced and collected by the Brahmins of today â€” Aá¹£á¹­haka, VÄmaka, VÄmadeva, VessÄmitta, YamÄtaggi, Aá¹…gÄ«rasa, BhÄradvÄja, VÄseá¹­á¹­ha, Kassapa, Bhagu â€” whose *mantras* are said to be passed on to you and your teacher: yet you do not thereby become a *á¹›á¹£i* or one practised in the way of a *á¹›á¹£i* â€” such a thing is not possible.
286. pubbakaisibhÄvÄnuyogo 283. "brÄhmaá¹‡o kho pana, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, pokkharasÄti raÃ±Ã±o pasenadissa kosalassa dattikaá¹ƒ bhuÃ±jati. tassa rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo sammukhÄ«bhÄvampi na dadÄti. yadÄpi tena manteti, tirodussantena manteti. yassa kho pana, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, dhammikaá¹ƒ payÄtaá¹ƒ bhikkhaá¹ƒ paá¹­iggaá¹‡heyya, kathaá¹ƒ tassa rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo sammukhÄ«bhÄvampi na dadeyya. passa, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, yÄva aparaddhaÃ±ca te idaá¹ƒ Äcariyassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa. 284. "taá¹ƒ kiá¹ƒ maÃ±Ã±asi, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, idha rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo hatthigÄ«vÄya vÄ nisinno assapiá¹­á¹­he vÄ nisinno rathÅ«patthare vÄ á¹­hito uggehi vÄ rÄjaÃ±Ã±ehi vÄ kiÃ±cideva mantanaá¹ƒ manteyya. so tamhÄ padesÄ apakkamma ekamantaá¹ƒ tiá¹­á¹­heyya. atha Ägaccheyya suddo vÄ suddadÄso vÄ, tasmiá¹ƒ padese á¹­hito tadeva mantanaá¹ƒ manteyya â€“ â€˜evampi rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo Äha, evampi rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo ÄhÄâ€™ti. apinu so rÄjabhaá¹‡itaá¹ƒ vÄ bhaá¹‡ati rÄjamantanaá¹ƒ vÄ manteti? ettÄvatÄ so assa rÄjÄ vÄ rÄjamatto vÄ"ti? "no hidaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". 285. "evameva kho tvaá¹ƒ, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, ye te ahesuá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ pubbakÄ isayo mantÄnaá¹ƒ kattÄro mantÄnaá¹ƒ pavattÄro, yesamidaá¹ƒ etarahi brÄhmaá¹‡Ä porÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ mantapadaá¹ƒ gÄ«taá¹ƒ pavuttaá¹ƒ samihitaá¹ƒ, tadanugÄyanti tadanubhÄsanti bhÄsitamanubhÄsanti vÄcitamanuvÄcenti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ aá¹­á¹­hako vÄmako vÄmadevo vessÄmitto yamataggi [yamadaggi (ka.)] aá¹…gÄ«raso bhÄradvÄjo vÄseá¹­á¹­ho kassapo bhagu â€“ â€˜tyÄhaá¹ƒ mante adhiyÄmi sÄcariyakoâ€™ti, tÄvatÄ tvaá¹ƒ bhavissasi isi vÄ isitthÄya vÄ paá¹­ipannoti netaá¹ƒ á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ vijjati. 286. "taá¹ƒ kiá¹ƒ maÃ±Ã±asi, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, kinti te sutaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ vuddhÄnaá¹ƒ mahallakÄnaá¹ƒ ÄcariyapÄcariyÄnaá¹ƒ bhÄsamÄnÄnaá¹ƒ â€“ ye te ahesuá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ pubbakÄ isayo mantÄnaá¹ƒ kattÄro mantÄnaá¹ƒ pavattÄro,
â€œWhat do you think, Ambaá¹­á¹­ha? What have you heard said by Brahmins who are venerable, aged, the teachers of teachers? Those first sagesâ€¦ Those brahmins nowadays still chant and repeat, repeating what was spoken and reciting what was recited, whose ancient hymn verses that were formerly chanted, uttered, and compiled- that is, Aá¹­á¹­haka, VÄmaka, VÄmadeva, VessÄmitta, Yamataggi, Aá¹…girasa, BhÄradvÄja, VÄseá¹­á¹­ha, Kassapa, and Bhagu. Did they enjoy themselves, well-bathed, well-anointed, with trimmed hair and beards, adorned with jeweled earrings and ornaments [wearing garlands of ornaments (sÄ«. syÄ. pÄ«.)], dressed in white clothes, indulging in the pleasures of the five sense objects and addicted to them, as you and your teacher do now?â€ â€œNo, Venerable Gotama, not that." "...pe...did they eat special fine rice with various soups and curries, seasoned with choice black spices, as you and your teacher do now?" "No, Venerable Gotama, not that." "...pe...did they amuse themselves with women dressed up in flounces and furbelows, as you and your teacher do now?" "No, Venerable Gotama, not that." "...pe...did they ride around in chariots drawn by mares with braided tails, that they urged on by long goad-sticks, as you and your teacher do now?" "No, Venerable Gotama, not that." "...pe...did they have themselves guarded in fortified towns with moats and palisades, by men with long swords [long swords and armour (syÄ. pÄ«.)], as you and your teacher do now?" "No, Venerable Gotama, not that." "So, Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, neither you nor your teacher are a sage nor trained in the way of a sage. And now, Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, as for your doubts and perplexities concerning me, I will clarify these by your asking me questions, and by my answering them." Display of the two characteristics.
287. yesamidaá¹ƒ etarahi brÄhmaá¹‡Ä porÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ mantapadaá¹ƒ gÄ«taá¹ƒ pavuttaá¹ƒ samihitaá¹ƒ, tadanugÄyanti tadanubhÄsanti bhÄsitamanubhÄsanti vÄcitamanuvÄcenti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ aá¹­á¹­hako vÄmako vÄmadevo vessÄmitto yamataggi aá¹…gÄ«raso bhÄradvÄjo vÄseá¹­á¹­ho kassapo bhagu, evaá¹ƒ su te sunhÄtÄ suvilittÄ kappitakesamassÅ« Ämukkamaá¹‡ikuá¹‡á¸alÄbharaá¹‡Ä [ÄmuttamÄlÄbharaá¹‡Ä (sÄ«. syÄ. pÄ«.)] odÄtavatthavasanÄ paÃ±cahi kÄmaguá¹‡ehi samappitÄ samaá¹…gÄ«bhÅ«tÄ paricÄrenti, seyyathÄpi tvaá¹ƒ etarahi sÄcariyako"ti? "no hidaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "â€¦peâ€¦ evaá¹ƒ su te sÄlÄ«naá¹ƒ odanaá¹ƒ sucimaá¹ƒsÅ«pasecanaá¹ƒ vicitakÄá¸·akaá¹ƒ anekasÅ«paá¹ƒ anekabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ paribhuÃ±janti, seyyathÄpi tvaá¹ƒ etarahi sÄcariyako"ti? "no hidaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "â€¦peâ€¦ evaá¹ƒ su te veá¹­hakanatapassÄhi nÄrÄ«hi paricÄrenti, seyyathÄpi tvaá¹ƒ etarahi sÄcariyako"ti? "no hidaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "â€¦peâ€¦ evaá¹ƒ su te kuttavÄlehi vaá¸·avÄrathehi dÄ«ghÄhi patodalaá¹­á¹­hÄ«hi vÄhane vitudentÄ vipariyÄyanti, seyyathÄpi tvaá¹ƒ etarahi sÄcariyako"ti? "no hidaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "â€¦peâ€¦ evaá¹ƒ su te ukkiá¹‡á¹‡aparikhÄsu okkhittapalighÄsu nagarÅ«pakÄrikÄsu dÄ«ghÄsivudhehi [dÄ«ghÄsibaddhehi (syÄ. pÄ«.)] purisehi rakkhÄpenti, seyyathÄpi tvaá¹ƒ etarahi sÄcariyako"ti? "no hidaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "iti kho, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, neva tvaá¹ƒ isi na isitthÄya paá¹­ipanno sÄcariyako. yassa kho pana, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, mayi kaá¹…khÄ vÄ vimati vÄ so maá¹ƒ paÃ±hena, ahaá¹ƒ veyyÄkaraá¹‡ena sodhissÄmÄ«"ti. dvelakkhaá¹‡Ädassanaá¹ƒ 287. atha kho bhagavÄ vihÄrÄ nikkhamma caá¹…kamaá¹ƒ abbhuá¹­á¹­hÄsi. ambaá¹­á¹­hopi mÄá¹‡avo vihÄrÄ nikkhamma caá¹…kamaá¹ƒ abbhuá¹­á¹­hÄsi. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo bhagavantaá¹ƒ caá¹…kamantaá¹ƒ anucaá¹…kamamÄno bhagavato kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni samannesi. addasÄ kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo bhagavato
Then the Lord, leaving his dwelling, started to walk up and down. Ambaá¹­á¹­ha also, leaving his dwelling, started to walk up and down. And as Ambaá¹­á¹­ha walked alongside the Lord as he was walking up and down, he observed the thirty-two marks of a Great Man on the Lordâ€™s body. Ambaá¹­á¹­ha saw on the Lord's body the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, but he was doubtful about two of them. He was doubtful and perplexed about two of these marks: he could not make up his mind or be certain about the sheathed genitals or the large tongue.
288. kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya ca. 288. atha kho bhagavato etadahosi â€“ "passati kho me ayaá¹ƒ ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya cÄ"ti. atha kho bhagavÄ tathÄrÅ«paá¹ƒ iddhÄbhisaá¹…khÄraá¹ƒ abhisaá¹…khÄsi yathÄ addasa ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo bhagavato kosohitaá¹ƒ vatthaguyhaá¹ƒ. atha kho bhagavÄ jivhaá¹ƒ ninnÄmetvÄ ubhopi kaá¹‡á¹‡asotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, ubhopi nÄsikasotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, kevalampi nalÄá¹­amaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ jivhÄya chÄdesi. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­hassa mÄá¹‡avassa etadahosi â€“ "samannÄgato kho samaá¹‡o gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "handa ca dÄni mayaá¹ƒ, bho gotama, gacchÄma, bahukiccÄ mayaá¹ƒ bahukaraá¹‡Ä«yÄ"ti. "yassadÄni tvaá¹ƒ, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, kÄlaá¹ƒ maÃ±Ã±asÄ«"ti. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo vaá¸·avÄrathamÄruyha pakkÄmi. 289. tena kho pana samayena brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti ukkaá¹­á¹­hÄya nikkhamitvÄ mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ƒ sake ÄrÄme nisinno hoti ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒyeva mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ paá¹­imÄnento. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo yena sako ÄrÄmo tena pÄyÄsi. yÄvatikÄ yÄnassa bhÅ«mi, yÄnena gantvÄ yÄnÄ paccorohitvÄ pattikova yena brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 290. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnaá¹ƒ kho ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti etadavoca â€“ "kacci, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, addasa taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotama"nti? "addasÄma kho mayaá¹ƒ, bho, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotama"nti. "kacci, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ tathÄ santaá¹ƒyeva saddo abbhuggato no aÃ±Ã±athÄ, kacci pana so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo tÄdiso no
Then the Lord thought: "This Ambaá¹­á¹­ha sees the thirty-two marks of a Great Man on me, except two. He is doubtful and perplexed about two of these marks: he could not make up his mind or be certain about the sheathed genitals or the large tongue." Then the Lord worked such a feat of supernormal power that Ambaá¹­á¹­ha saw that the Lordâ€™s male organ was enclosed in a sheath. Next the Blessed One extruded his tongue, and he repeatedly touched both ear holes and both nostrils, and he covered the whole of his forehead with his tongue. Then Ambaá¹­á¹­ha thought: â€œThe ascetic Gotama is equipped with all the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, complete and with none missing.â€ Then he said to the Lord: â€˜Reverend Gotama, may I go now? I have much business, much to do.â€™ "Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, do what you now think fit." So Ambaá¹­á¹­ha got back into his chariot drawn by mares and departed.
289. kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya ca. 288. atha kho bhagavato etadahosi â€“ "passati kho me ayaá¹ƒ ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya cÄ"ti. atha kho bhagavÄ tathÄrÅ«paá¹ƒ iddhÄbhisaá¹…khÄraá¹ƒ abhisaá¹…khÄsi yathÄ addasa ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo bhagavato kosohitaá¹ƒ vatthaguyhaá¹ƒ. atha kho bhagavÄ jivhaá¹ƒ ninnÄmetvÄ ubhopi kaá¹‡á¹‡asotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, ubhopi nÄsikasotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, kevalampi nalÄá¹­amaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ jivhÄya chÄdesi. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­hassa mÄá¹‡avassa etadahosi â€“ "samannÄgato kho samaá¹‡o gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "handa ca dÄni mayaá¹ƒ, bho gotama, gacchÄma, bahukiccÄ mayaá¹ƒ bahukaraá¹‡Ä«yÄ"ti. "yassadÄni tvaá¹ƒ, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, kÄlaá¹ƒ maÃ±Ã±asÄ«"ti. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo vaá¸·avÄrathamÄruyha pakkÄmi. 289. tena kho pana samayena brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti ukkaá¹­á¹­hÄya nikkhamitvÄ mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ƒ sake ÄrÄme nisinno hoti ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒyeva mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ paá¹­imÄnento. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo yena sako ÄrÄmo tena pÄyÄsi. yÄvatikÄ yÄnassa bhÅ«mi, yÄnena gantvÄ yÄnÄ paccorohitvÄ pattikova yena brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 290. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnaá¹ƒ kho ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti etadavoca â€“ "kacci, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, addasa taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotama"nti? "addasÄma kho mayaá¹ƒ, bho, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotama"nti. "kacci, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ tathÄ santaá¹ƒyeva saddo abbhuggato no aÃ±Ã±athÄ, kacci pana so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo tÄdiso no
At that time, the Brahmin PokkharasÄti had gone outside and was sitting in his park with a large number of Brahmins, just waiting for Ambaá¹­á¹­ha. Then Ambaá¹­á¹­ha came to the park. He rode in the chariot as far as it would go, and then continued on foot to where Pokkharasati was, saluted him, and sat down to one side.
290. kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya ca. 288. atha kho bhagavato etadahosi â€“ "passati kho me ayaá¹ƒ ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya cÄ"ti. atha kho bhagavÄ tathÄrÅ«paá¹ƒ iddhÄbhisaá¹…khÄraá¹ƒ abhisaá¹…khÄsi yathÄ addasa ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo bhagavato kosohitaá¹ƒ vatthaguyhaá¹ƒ. atha kho bhagavÄ jivhaá¹ƒ ninnÄmetvÄ ubhopi kaá¹‡á¹‡asotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, ubhopi nÄsikasotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, kevalampi nalÄá¹­amaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ jivhÄya chÄdesi. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­hassa mÄá¹‡avassa etadahosi â€“ "samannÄgato kho samaá¹‡o gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "handa ca dÄni mayaá¹ƒ, bho gotama, gacchÄma, bahukiccÄ mayaá¹ƒ bahukaraá¹‡Ä«yÄ"ti. "yassadÄni tvaá¹ƒ, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, kÄlaá¹ƒ maÃ±Ã±asÄ«"ti. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo vaá¸·avÄrathamÄruyha pakkÄmi. 289. tena kho pana samayena brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti ukkaá¹­á¹­hÄya nikkhamitvÄ mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ƒ sake ÄrÄme nisinno hoti ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒyeva mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ paá¹­imÄnento. atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo yena sako ÄrÄmo tena pÄyÄsi. yÄvatikÄ yÄnassa bhÅ«mi, yÄnena gantvÄ yÄnÄ paccorohitvÄ pattikova yena brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 290. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnaá¹ƒ kho ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti etadavoca â€“ "kacci, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, addasa taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotama"nti? "addasÄma kho mayaá¹ƒ, bho, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotama"nti. "kacci, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ tathÄ santaá¹ƒyeva saddo abbhuggato no aÃ±Ã±athÄ, kacci pana so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo tÄdiso no
Then Pokkharasati said to Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, who was sitting to one side: â€˜Well, dear boy, did you see the Reverend Gotama?â€™ â€˜Yes, I saw the Reverend Gotama.â€™ â€˜And was the Reverend Gotama such as he is reported to be, and not otherwise? And is he of such nature, and not â€˜And is he of such nature, and not otherwise?" "Sir, he is as he is reported to be, and he is of such a nature, and not otherwise. He is possessed of the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, all complete, with none missing.â€™ â€œBut was there any conversation between you and the ascetic Gotama?â€ â€œThere was, sir.â€ â€˜And what was this conversation about?â€ Then Ambaá¹­á¹­ha the student told the Brahmin PokkharasÄti all that had passed between the Lord and himself.
291. aÃ±Ã±Ädiso"ti? "tathÄ santaá¹ƒyeva, bho, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ saddo abbhuggato no aÃ±Ã±athÄ, tÄdisova so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo no aÃ±Ã±Ädiso. samannÄgato ca so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. "ahu pana te, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? "ahu kho me, bho, samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti. "yathÄ kathaá¹ƒ pana te, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, ahu samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo yÄvatako [yÄvatiko (ka. pÄ«.)] ahosi bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ kathÄsallÄpo, taá¹ƒ sabbaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa Ärocesi. 291. evaá¹ƒ vutte, brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ paá¹‡á¸itaka [paá¹‡á¸itakÄ], aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ bahussutaka [bahussutakÄ], aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ tevijjaka [tevijjakÄ], evarÅ«pena kira, bho, puriso atthacarakena kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ƒ maraá¹‡Ä apÄyaá¹ƒ duggatiá¹ƒ vinipÄtaá¹ƒ nirayaá¹ƒ upapajjeyya. yadeva kho tvaá¹ƒ, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ Äsajja Äsajja avacÄsi, atha kho so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo amhepi evaá¹ƒ upaneyya upaneyya avaca. aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ paá¹‡á¸itaka, aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ bahussutaka, aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ tevijjaka, evarÅ«pena kira, bho, puriso atthacarakena kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ƒ maraá¹‡Ä apÄyaá¹ƒ duggatiá¹ƒ vinipÄtaá¹ƒ nirayaá¹ƒ upapajjeyyÄ"ti, kupito [so kupito (pÄ«.)] anattamano ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ padasÄyeva pavattesi. icchati ca tÄvadeva bhagavantaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. pokkharasÄtibuddhupasaá¹…kamanaá¹ƒ 292. atha kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "ativikÄlo kho, bho, ajja samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. svedÄni [dÄni sve (sÄ«. ka.)] bhavaá¹ƒ pokkharasÄti samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"ti. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti sake nivesane paá¹‡Ä«taá¹ƒ khÄdanÄ«yaá¹ƒ bhojanÄ«yaá¹ƒ paá¹­iyÄdÄpetvÄ yÄne ÄropetvÄ ukkÄsu
At this PokkharasÄti exclaimed: â€˜Well, youâ€™re a fine little scholar, a fine wise man, a fine expert in the Three Vedas! Anyone going about his business like that ought when he dies, at the breaking-up of the body, to go to the downfall, to the evil path, to ruin, to hell! You have heaped insults on the Reverend Gotama, as a result of which he has brought up more and more things against us! Youâ€™re a fine little scholarâ€¦!â€ He was so angry and enraged that he kicked Ambaá¹­á¹­ha over, and wanted to start out at once to see the Lord. PokkharasÄti's visit to the Buddha
292. aÃ±Ã±Ädiso"ti? "tathÄ santaá¹ƒyeva, bho, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ saddo abbhuggato no aÃ±Ã±athÄ, tÄdisova so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo no aÃ±Ã±Ädiso. samannÄgato ca so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. "yathÄ kathaá¹ƒ pana te, tÄta ambaá¹­á¹­ha, ahu samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? atha kho ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo yÄvatako [yÄvatiko (ka. pÄ«.)] ahosi bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ kathÄsallÄpo, taá¹ƒ sabbaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa Ärocesi. 291. evaá¹ƒ vutte, brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ paá¹‡á¸itaka [paá¹‡á¸itakÄ], aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ bahussutaka [bahussutakÄ], aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ tevijjaka [tevijjakÄ], evarÅ«pena kira, bho, puriso atthacarakena kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ƒ maraá¹‡Ä apÄyaá¹ƒ duggatiá¹ƒ vinipÄtaá¹ƒ nirayaá¹ƒ upapajjeyya. yadeva kho tvaá¹ƒ, ambaá¹­á¹­ha, taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ Äsajja Äsajja avacÄsi, atha kho so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo amhepi evaá¹ƒ upaneyya upaneyya avaca. aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ paá¹‡á¸itaka, aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ bahussutaka, aho vata re amhÄkaá¹ƒ tevijjaka, evarÅ«pena kira, bho, puriso atthacarakena kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ƒ maraá¹‡Ä apÄyaá¹ƒ duggatiá¹ƒ vinipÄtaá¹ƒ nirayaá¹ƒ upapajjeyyÄ"ti, kupito [so kupito (pÄ«.)] anattamano ambaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ padasÄyeva pavattesi. icchati ca tÄvadeva bhagavantaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. pokkharasÄtibuddhupasaá¹…kamanaá¹ƒ 292. atha kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "ativikÄlo kho, bho, ajja samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. svedÄni [dÄni sve (sÄ«. ka.)] bhavaá¹ƒ pokkharasÄti samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"ti. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti sake nivesane paá¹‡Ä«taá¹ƒ khÄdanÄ«yaá¹ƒ bhojanÄ«yaá¹ƒ paá¹­iyÄdÄpetvÄ yÄne ÄropetvÄ ukkÄsu
But the Brahmins said: â€˜It is far too late, sir, to go to see the ascetic Gotama today. The Reverend PokkharasÄti should go to see him tomorrow.â€™ Then the Brahmin PokkharasÄti had good food of various kinds prepared in his own residence, and he had it loaded onto vehicles, and at the torches... He set out for Ukkaá¹­á¹­hÄ while they were being borne along and headed towards the IcchÄnaá¹…gala woodland. Going by vehicle as far as the ground was suitable for vehicles, he dismounted and approached the Blessed One on foot. Having approached, he exchanged courteous greetings with the Blessed One, and after exchanging friendly and courteous conversation, he sat down to one side.
293. dhÄriyamÄnÄsu ukkaá¹­á¹­hÄya niyyÄsi, yena icchÄnaá¹…galavanasaá¹‡á¸o tena pÄyÄsi. yÄvatikÄ yÄnassa bhÅ«mi yÄnena gantvÄ, yÄnÄ paccorohitvÄ pattikova yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 293. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "ÄgamÄ nu kho idha, bho gotama, amhÄkaá¹ƒ antevÄsÄ« ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti? "ÄgamÄ kho te [tedha (syÄ.), te idha (pÄ«.)], brÄhmaá¹‡a, antevÄsÄ« ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti. "ahu pana te, bho gotama, ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? "ahu kho me, brÄhmaá¹‡a, ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti. "yathÄkathaá¹ƒ pana te, bho gotama, ahu ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? atha kho bhagavÄ yÄvatako ahosi ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kathÄsallÄpo, taá¹ƒ sabbaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa Ärocesi. evaá¹ƒ vutte, brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "bÄlo, bho gotama, ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo, khamatu bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo ambaá¹­á¹­hassa mÄá¹‡avassÄ"ti. "sukhÄ« hotu, brÄhmaá¹‡a, ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti. 294. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni samannesi. addasÄ kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya ca. 295. atha kho bhagavato etadahosi â€“ "passati kho me ayaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe, pahÅ«tajivhatÄya cÄ"ti. atha kho bhagavÄ tathÄrÅ«paá¹ƒ iddhÄbhisaá¹…khÄraá¹ƒ abhisaá¹…khÄsi yathÄ addasa brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kosohitaá¹ƒ vatthaguyhaá¹ƒ. atha
Seated to one side, the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* PokkharasÄti said this to the Blessed One: "Did our pupil Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man, come here, venerable Gotama?" "Yes, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, our pupil Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man, came here." "Did you have any conversation with Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man, venerable Gotama?" "Yes, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, I had some conversation with Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man." "What sort of conversation did you have with Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man, venerable Gotama?" Then the Blessed One told the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* PokkharasÄti all the conversation he had had with Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man. When this was said, the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* PokkharasÄti said this to the Blessed One: "Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man, is a fool, venerable Gotama. May venerable Gotama forgive Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man." "May Ambaá¹­á¹­ha, the young man, be happy, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*."
294. dhÄriyamÄnÄsu ukkaá¹­á¹­hÄya niyyÄsi, yena icchÄnaá¹…galavanasaá¹‡á¸o tena pÄyÄsi. yÄvatikÄ yÄnassa bhÅ«mi yÄnena gantvÄ, yÄnÄ paccorohitvÄ pattikova yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 293. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "ÄgamÄ nu kho idha, bho gotama, amhÄkaá¹ƒ antevÄsÄ« ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti? "ÄgamÄ kho te [tedha (syÄ.), te idha (pÄ«.)], brÄhmaá¹‡a, antevÄsÄ« ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti. "ahu pana te, bho gotama, ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? "ahu kho me, brÄhmaá¹‡a, ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti. "yathÄkathaá¹ƒ pana te, bho gotama, ahu ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? atha kho bhagavÄ yÄvatako ahosi ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kathÄsallÄpo, taá¹ƒ sabbaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa Ärocesi. evaá¹ƒ vutte, brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "bÄlo, bho gotama, ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo, khamatu bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo ambaá¹­á¹­hassa mÄá¹‡avassÄ"ti. "sukhÄ« hotu, brÄhmaá¹‡a, ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti. 294. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni samannesi. addasÄ kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya ca. 295. atha kho bhagavato etadahosi â€“ "passati kho me ayaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe, pahÅ«tajivhatÄya cÄ"ti. atha kho bhagavÄ tathÄrÅ«paá¹ƒ iddhÄbhisaá¹…khÄraá¹ƒ abhisaá¹…khÄsi yathÄ addasa brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kosohitaá¹ƒ vatthaguyhaá¹ƒ. atha
Then the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* PokkharasÄti examined the Blessed One's body for the thirty-two marks of a great man (*dvattiá¹ƒsa-mahÄpurisa-lakkhaá¹‡Äni*). The *brÄhmaá¹‡a* PokkharasÄti saw most of the thirty-two marks of a great man on the Blessed Oneâ€™s body, except for two. He doubted, was uncertain, could not decide, and was not convinced about two marks of a great man: the concealed genitals (*kosohite vatthaguyhe*) and the large tongue (*pahÅ«tajivhatÄya*).
295. dhÄriyamÄnÄsu ukkaá¹­á¹­hÄya niyyÄsi, yena icchÄnaá¹…galavanasaá¹‡á¸o tena pÄyÄsi. yÄvatikÄ yÄnassa bhÅ«mi yÄnena gantvÄ, yÄnÄ paccorohitvÄ pattikova yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 293. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "ÄgamÄ nu kho idha, bho gotama, amhÄkaá¹ƒ antevÄsÄ« ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti? "ÄgamÄ kho te [tedha (syÄ.), te idha (pÄ«.)], brÄhmaá¹‡a, antevÄsÄ« ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti. "ahu pana te, bho gotama, ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? "ahu kho me, brÄhmaá¹‡a, ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti. "yathÄkathaá¹ƒ pana te, bho gotama, ahu ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kocideva kathÄsallÄpo"ti? atha kho bhagavÄ yÄvatako ahosi ambaá¹­á¹­hena mÄá¹‡avena saddhiá¹ƒ kathÄsallÄpo, taá¹ƒ sabbaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa Ärocesi. evaá¹ƒ vutte, brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "bÄlo, bho gotama, ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo, khamatu bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo ambaá¹­á¹­hassa mÄá¹‡avassÄ"ti. "sukhÄ« hotu, brÄhmaá¹‡a, ambaá¹­á¹­ho mÄá¹‡avo"ti. 294. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni samannesi. addasÄ kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kÄye dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahÅ«tajivhatÄya ca. 295. atha kho bhagavato etadahosi â€“ "passati kho me ayaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡Äni yebhuyyena á¹­hapetvÄ dve. dvÄ«su mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu kaá¹…khati vicikicchati nÄdhimuccati na sampasÄ«dati â€“ kosohite ca vatthaguyhe, pahÅ«tajivhatÄya cÄ"ti. atha kho bhagavÄ tathÄrÅ«paá¹ƒ iddhÄbhisaá¹…khÄraá¹ƒ abhisaá¹…khÄsi yathÄ addasa brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato kosohitaá¹ƒ vatthaguyhaá¹ƒ. atha
Then it occurred to the Blessed One: "This *brÄhmaá¹‡a* PokkharasÄti sees most of the thirty-two marks of a great man on me, except for two. He doubts, is uncertain, cannot decide, and is not convinced about two marks of a great man: the concealed genitals (*kosohite vatthaguyhe*) and the large tongue (*pahÅ«tajivhatÄya*)." Then the Blessed One manifested such a feat of psychic power (*iddhÄbhisaá¹…khÄraá¹ƒ abhisaá¹…khÄsi*) that the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* PokkharasÄti saw the Blessed One's concealed genitals (*kosohitaá¹ƒ vatthaguyhaá¹ƒ*). Then Then, indeed, the Blessed One, having extended his tongue, stroked and touched both ear-holes, stroked and touched both nostrils, and covered even the entire circle of his forehead with his tongue.
296. kho bhagavÄ jivhaá¹ƒ ninnÄmetvÄ ubhopi kaá¹‡á¹‡asotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, ubhopi nÄsikasotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, kevalampi nalÄá¹­amaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ jivhÄya chÄdesi. 296. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa etadahosi â€“ "samannÄgato kho samaá¹‡o gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "adhivÄsetu me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo ajjatanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 297. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ viditvÄ bhagavato kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocesi â€“ "kÄlo, bho gotama, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. atha kho bhagavÄ pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena yena brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ paÃ±Ã±atte Äsane nisÄ«di. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ paá¹‡Ä«tena khÄdanÄ«yena bhojanÄ«yena sahatthÄ santappesi sampavÄresi, mÄá¹‡avakÄpi bhikkhusaá¹…ghaá¹ƒ. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ bhuttÄviá¹ƒ onÄ«tapattapÄá¹‡iá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ nÄ«caá¹ƒ Äsanaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 298. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnassa kho brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa bhagavÄ anupubbiá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ kathesi, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ dÄnakathaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakathaá¹ƒ saggakathaá¹ƒ, kÄmÄnaá¹ƒ ÄdÄ«navaá¹ƒ okÄraá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ, nekkhamme Änisaá¹ƒsaá¹ƒ pakÄsesi. yadÄ bhagavÄ aÃ±Ã±Äsi brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ kallacittaá¹ƒ muducittaá¹ƒ vinÄ«varaá¹‡acittaá¹ƒ udaggacittaá¹ƒ pasannacittaá¹ƒ, atha yÄ buddhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄmukkaá¹ƒsikÄ dhammadesanÄ, taá¹ƒ pakÄsesi â€“ dukkhaá¹ƒ samudayaá¹ƒ nirodhaá¹ƒ maggaá¹ƒ. seyyathÄpi nÄma suddhaá¹ƒ vatthaá¹ƒ apagatakÄá¸·akaá¹ƒ sammadeva rajanaá¹ƒ paá¹­iggaá¹‡heyya, evameva brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa tasmiÃ±Ã±eva Äsane virajaá¹ƒ vÄ«tamalaá¹ƒ dhammacakkhuá¹ƒ udapÄdi â€“ "yaá¹ƒ kiÃ±ci samudayadhammaá¹ƒ, sabbaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ nirodhadhamma"nti. pokkharasÄtiupÄsakattapaá¹­ivedanÄ 299. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti diá¹­á¹­hadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogÄá¸·hadhammo tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho vigatakathaá¹ƒkatho
Then, indeed, the brahmin PokkharasÄti thought: "The ascetic Gotama is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man (*dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi*), complete and not incomplete." He said this to the Blessed One: "May the honored Gotama accept a meal today with the Order of Monks." The Blessed One accepted in silence.
297. kho bhagavÄ jivhaá¹ƒ ninnÄmetvÄ ubhopi kaá¹‡á¹‡asotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, ubhopi nÄsikasotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, kevalampi nalÄá¹­amaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ jivhÄya chÄdesi. 296. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa etadahosi â€“ "samannÄgato kho samaá¹‡o gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "adhivÄsetu me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo ajjatanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 297. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ viditvÄ bhagavato kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocesi â€“ "kÄlo, bho gotama, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. atha kho bhagavÄ pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena yena brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ paÃ±Ã±atte Äsane nisÄ«di. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ paá¹‡Ä«tena khÄdanÄ«yena bhojanÄ«yena sahatthÄ santappesi sampavÄresi, mÄá¹‡avakÄpi bhikkhusaá¹…ghaá¹ƒ. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ bhuttÄviá¹ƒ onÄ«tapattapÄá¹‡iá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ nÄ«caá¹ƒ Äsanaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 298. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnassa kho brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa bhagavÄ anupubbiá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ kathesi, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ dÄnakathaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakathaá¹ƒ saggakathaá¹ƒ, kÄmÄnaá¹ƒ ÄdÄ«navaá¹ƒ okÄraá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ, nekkhamme Änisaá¹ƒsaá¹ƒ pakÄsesi. yadÄ bhagavÄ aÃ±Ã±Äsi brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ kallacittaá¹ƒ muducittaá¹ƒ vinÄ«varaá¹‡acittaá¹ƒ udaggacittaá¹ƒ pasannacittaá¹ƒ, atha yÄ buddhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄmukkaá¹ƒsikÄ dhammadesanÄ, taá¹ƒ pakÄsesi â€“ dukkhaá¹ƒ samudayaá¹ƒ nirodhaá¹ƒ maggaá¹ƒ. seyyathÄpi nÄma suddhaá¹ƒ vatthaá¹ƒ apagatakÄá¸·akaá¹ƒ sammadeva rajanaá¹ƒ paá¹­iggaá¹‡heyya, evameva brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa tasmiÃ±Ã±eva Äsane virajaá¹ƒ vÄ«tamalaá¹ƒ dhammacakkhuá¹ƒ udapÄdi â€“ "yaá¹ƒ kiÃ±ci samudayadhammaá¹ƒ, sabbaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ nirodhadhamma"nti. pokkharasÄtiupÄsakattapaá¹­ivedanÄ 299. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti diá¹­á¹­hadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogÄá¸·hadhammo tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho vigatakathaá¹ƒkatho
Then, indeed, the brahmin PokkharasÄti, knowing of the Blessed One's acceptance, announced the time to the Blessed One: "It is time, honored Gotama, the meal is ready." Then, indeed, the Blessed One, having dressed in the morning time, taking his bowl and robe, together with the Order of Monks, went to the residence of the brahmin PokkharasÄti; having arrived, he sat down on the prepared seat. Then, indeed, the brahmin PokkharasÄti, with his own hands, satisfied and served the Blessed One with delicious foods, both hard and soft; and the young men [served] the Order of Monks. Then, indeed, the brahmin PokkharasÄti, when the Blessed One had finished eating and had removed his hand from the bowl, taking a certain low seat, sat down to one side.
298. kho bhagavÄ jivhaá¹ƒ ninnÄmetvÄ ubhopi kaá¹‡á¹‡asotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, ubhopi nÄsikasotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, kevalampi nalÄá¹­amaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ jivhÄya chÄdesi. 296. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa etadahosi â€“ "samannÄgato kho samaá¹‡o gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "adhivÄsetu me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo ajjatanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 297. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ viditvÄ bhagavato kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocesi â€“ "kÄlo, bho gotama, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. atha kho bhagavÄ pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena yena brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ paÃ±Ã±atte Äsane nisÄ«di. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ paá¹‡Ä«tena khÄdanÄ«yena bhojanÄ«yena sahatthÄ santappesi sampavÄresi, mÄá¹‡avakÄpi bhikkhusaá¹…ghaá¹ƒ. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ bhuttÄviá¹ƒ onÄ«tapattapÄá¹‡iá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ nÄ«caá¹ƒ Äsanaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 298. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnassa kho brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa bhagavÄ anupubbiá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ kathesi, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ dÄnakathaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakathaá¹ƒ saggakathaá¹ƒ, kÄmÄnaá¹ƒ ÄdÄ«navaá¹ƒ okÄraá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ, nekkhamme Änisaá¹ƒsaá¹ƒ pakÄsesi. yadÄ bhagavÄ aÃ±Ã±Äsi brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ kallacittaá¹ƒ muducittaá¹ƒ vinÄ«varaá¹‡acittaá¹ƒ udaggacittaá¹ƒ pasannacittaá¹ƒ, atha yÄ buddhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄmukkaá¹ƒsikÄ dhammadesanÄ, taá¹ƒ pakÄsesi â€“ dukkhaá¹ƒ samudayaá¹ƒ nirodhaá¹ƒ maggaá¹ƒ. seyyathÄpi nÄma suddhaá¹ƒ vatthaá¹ƒ apagatakÄá¸·akaá¹ƒ sammadeva rajanaá¹ƒ paá¹­iggaá¹‡heyya, evameva brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa tasmiÃ±Ã±eva Äsane virajaá¹ƒ vÄ«tamalaá¹ƒ dhammacakkhuá¹ƒ udapÄdi â€“ "yaá¹ƒ kiÃ±ci samudayadhammaá¹ƒ, sabbaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ nirodhadhamma"nti. pokkharasÄtiupÄsakattapaá¹­ivedanÄ 299. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti diá¹­á¹­hadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogÄá¸·hadhammo tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho vigatakathaá¹ƒkatho
As the brahmin PokkharasÄti was sitting to one side, the Blessed One gave a progressive talk, that is to say, a talk on giving (*dÄnakathaá¹ƒ*), a talk on virtue (*sÄ«lakathaá¹ƒ*), a talk on heaven (*saggakathaá¹ƒ*), the danger, wretchedness, and corruption of sensual pleasures (*kÄmÄnaá¹ƒ ÄdÄ«navaá¹ƒ okÄraá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ*), and he revealed the benefit of renunciation (*nekkhamme Änisaá¹ƒsaá¹ƒ*). When the Blessed One knew that the brahmin PokkharasÄti's mind was pliant, soft, free from hindrances, uplifted, and serene, then he revealed that teaching on the Dhamma (*dhammadesanÄ*) which is unique to the Buddhas: suffering (*dukkhaá¹ƒ*), its origin (*samudayaá¹ƒ*), its cessation (*nirodhaá¹ƒ*), and the path (*maggaá¹ƒ*). Just as a clean cloth, free from stains, would perfectly absorb dye, even so, as the brahmin PokkharasÄti was sitting in that very seat, the stainless and immaculate eye of the Dharma (*dhammacakkhuá¹ƒ*) arose in him: "Whatever is subject to arising, all that is subject to cessation." Declaration of PokkharasÄti as a lay follower.
299. kho bhagavÄ jivhaá¹ƒ ninnÄmetvÄ ubhopi kaá¹‡á¹‡asotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, ubhopi nÄsikasotÄni anumasi paá¹­imasi, kevalampi nalÄá¹­amaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ jivhÄya chÄdesi. 296. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa etadahosi â€“ "samannÄgato kho samaá¹‡o gotamo dvattiá¹ƒsamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡ehi paripuá¹‡á¹‡ehi no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ehÄ«"ti. bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "adhivÄsetu me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo ajjatanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 297. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ viditvÄ bhagavato kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocesi â€“ "kÄlo, bho gotama, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. atha kho bhagavÄ pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena yena brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti bhagavantaá¹ƒ bhuttÄviá¹ƒ onÄ«tapattapÄá¹‡iá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ nÄ«caá¹ƒ Äsanaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. 298. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnassa kho brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa bhagavÄ anupubbiá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ kathesi, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ dÄnakathaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakathaá¹ƒ saggakathaá¹ƒ, kÄmÄnaá¹ƒ ÄdÄ«navaá¹ƒ okÄraá¹ƒ saá¹ƒkilesaá¹ƒ, nekkhamme Änisaá¹ƒsaá¹ƒ pakÄsesi. yadÄ bhagavÄ aÃ±Ã±Äsi brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ pokkharasÄtiá¹ƒ kallacittaá¹ƒ muducittaá¹ƒ vinÄ«varaá¹‡acittaá¹ƒ udaggacittaá¹ƒ pasannacittaá¹ƒ, atha yÄ buddhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄmukkaá¹ƒsikÄ dhammadesanÄ, taá¹ƒ pakÄsesi â€“ dukkhaá¹ƒ samudayaá¹ƒ nirodhaá¹ƒ maggaá¹ƒ. seyyathÄpi nÄma suddhaá¹ƒ vatthaá¹ƒ apagatakÄá¸·akaá¹ƒ sammadeva rajanaá¹ƒ paá¹­iggaá¹‡heyya, evameva brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa tasmiÃ±Ã±eva Äsane virajaá¹ƒ vÄ«tamalaá¹ƒ dhammacakkhuá¹ƒ udapÄdi â€“ "yaá¹ƒ kiÃ±ci samudayadhammaá¹ƒ, sabbaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ nirodhadhamma"nti. pokkharasÄtiupÄsakattapaá¹­ivedanÄ 299. atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti diá¹­á¹­hadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogÄá¸·hadhammo tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho vigatakathaá¹ƒkatho
Then, indeed, the brahmin PokkharasÄti, having seen the Dharma (*diá¹­á¹­hadhammo*), having attained the Dharma (*pattadhammo*), having known the Dharma (*viditadhammo*), having fathomed the Dharma (*pariyogÄá¸·hadhammo*), having crossed over doubt (*tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho*), having eliminated perplexity (*vigatakathaá¹ƒkatho*)
300. 4. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸asuttaá¹ƒ campeyyakabrÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ 300. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ aá¹…gesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena campÄ tadavasari. tatra sudaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re. tena kho pana samayena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o campaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. 301. assosuá¹ƒ kho campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito aá¹…gesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi campaá¹ƒ anuppatto campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. atha kho campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ campÄya nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« [saá¹…ghÄ saá¹…ghÄ« (sÄ«. syÄ. pÄ«.)] gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena gaggarÄ pokkharaá¹‡Ä« tenupasaá¹…kamanti. 302. tena kho pana samayena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o uparipÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ƒ upagato hoti. addasÄ kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o campeyyake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike campÄya nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« [saá¹…ghe saá¹…ghÄ« (sÄ«. pÄ«.) saá¹…ghÄ saá¹…ghÄ« (syÄ.)] gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te yena gaggarÄ pokkharaá¹‡Ä« tenupasaá¹…kamante. disvÄ khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "kiá¹ƒ nu kho, bho khatte, campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ
Thus have I heard. On one occasion the Blessed One was travelling among the Aá¹…gas with a large company of some five hundred monks, and he arrived at CampÄ. At CampÄ he stayed by the bank of the GaggarÄ lotus pond. At that time, the brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a was living at CampÄ, a populous place, full of grass, timber, water and grain, which had been given to him by King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadha as a royal gift, a royal endowment, a sacred grant.
301. 4. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸asuttaá¹ƒ campeyyakabrÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ 300. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ aá¹…gesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena campÄ tadavasari. tatra sudaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re. tena kho pana samayena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o campaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. 301. assosuá¹ƒ kho campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito aá¹…gesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi campaá¹ƒ anuppatto campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. atha kho campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ campÄya nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« [saá¹…ghÄ saá¹…ghÄ« (sÄ«. syÄ. pÄ«.)] gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena gaggarÄ pokkharaá¹‡Ä« tenupasaá¹…kamanti. 302. tena kho pana samayena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o uparipÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ƒ upagato hoti. addasÄ kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o campeyyake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike campÄya nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« [saá¹…ghe saá¹…ghÄ« (sÄ«. pÄ«.) saá¹…ghÄ saá¹…ghÄ« (syÄ.)] gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te yena gaggarÄ pokkharaá¹‡Ä« tenupasaá¹…kamante. disvÄ khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "kiá¹ƒ nu kho, bho khatte, campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ
And the Brahmins and householders of CampÄ heard say: â€œThe ascetic Gotama of the Sakyans, who has gone forth from the Sakya clan is travelling among the Aá¹…gasâ€¦ and is staying by Gaggaraâ€™s lotus-pool. concerning whom a good report has been spread about: â€œThis Blessed Lord is an Arhat, a fully-enlightened Buddha ( *sammÄsambuddho*), perfected in knowledge and conduct ( *vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno*), a Well-Farer ( *sugato*), Knower of the worlds ( *lokavidÅ«*), unequalled Trainer of men to be tamed ( *anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi*), Teacher of gods and humans ( *satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ*), a Buddha, a Blessed Lord.â€ He proclaims this world with its gods ( *sadevakaá¹ƒ*), its MÄras ( *samÄrakaá¹ƒ*), and its BrahmÄs ( *sabrahmakaá¹ƒ*), this generation with its recluses and brahmins ( *sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ*), its princes and its people ( *sadevamanussaá¹ƒ*), which he has himself realised by direct knowledge ( *abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ*). He teaches the Dhamma that is good at the beginning, good in the middle, and good at the end; with the right meaning and phrasing, and he reveals the spiritual life ( *brahmacariyaá¹ƒ*) that is utterly perfect and pure. It is good to see such Arahants.â€™â€œ Thereupon the Brahmins and householders of CampÄ, leaving CampÄ in great crowds, in vast numbers, went to Gaggaraâ€™s lotus-pond.
302. 4. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸asuttaá¹ƒ campeyyakabrÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ 300. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ aá¹…gesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena campÄ tadavasari. tatra sudaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re. tena kho pana samayena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o campaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. 301. assosuá¹ƒ kho campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito aá¹…gesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi campaá¹ƒ anuppatto campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. atha kho campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ campÄya nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« [saá¹…ghÄ saá¹…ghÄ« (sÄ«. syÄ. pÄ«.)] gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena gaggarÄ pokkharaá¹‡Ä« tenupasaá¹…kamanti. 302. tena kho pana samayena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o uparipÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ƒ upagato hoti. addasÄ kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o campeyyake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike campÄya nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« [saá¹…ghe saá¹…ghÄ« (sÄ«. pÄ«.) saá¹…ghÄ saá¹…ghÄ« (syÄ.)] gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te yena gaggarÄ pokkharaá¹‡Ä« tenupasaá¹…kamante. disvÄ khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "kiá¹ƒ nu kho, bho khatte, campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ
Just then, the Brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a had gone up to his verandah for his midday rest. Seeing all the Brahmins and householders making for Gaggaraâ€™s lotus-pond, he asked his steward the reason. Having departed from CampÄ, they are approaching the Gaggara Pond in a group, a host." "Sir, the ascetic **Gautama** (**Gotama**), a son of the **ÅšÄkyas**, who went forth from the **ÅšÄkya** clan, wandering in Aá¹…ga, has arrived at CampÄ with a large community of monks, about five hundred monks, and is staying on the bank of the Gaggara Pond in CampÄ. A good report of the venerable **Gautama** has spread abroad: "Indeed, that Blessed One is an *arahant*, a perfectly enlightened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, well-gone, knower of the world, unsurpassed trainer of those who can be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed." They are approaching the venerable **Gautama** for a sight (of him)." "Then, steward, go to the **brÄhmaá¹‡as** (Brahmins) and householders of Campeyya and say to them: 'The brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a says this: "Please wait, gentlemen, the brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a will approach the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him)."'" "Yes, sir," the steward replied to the brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a, and he went to the **brÄhmaá¹‡as** (Brahmins) and householders of Campeyya, and having approached the **brÄhmaá¹‡as** (Brahmins) and householders of Campeyya, he said this: "The brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a says this: 'Please wait, gentlemen, the brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a will approach the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him)."'" The story of Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a's virtues.
303. campÄya nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena gaggarÄ pokkharaá¹‡Ä« tenupasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti? "atthi kho, bho, samaá¹‡o gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito aá¹…gesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi campaá¹ƒ anuppatto campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. tamete bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti. "tena hi, bho khatte, yena campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ campeyyake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike evaá¹ƒ vadehi â€“ â€˜soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o, bho, brÄhmaá¹‡o evamÄha â€“ Ägamentu kira bhavanto, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸opi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"â€™ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so khattÄ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena campeyyakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ campeyyake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike etadavoca â€“ "soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o bho brÄhmaá¹‡o evamÄha â€“ â€˜Ägamentu kira bhavanto, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸opi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"â€™ti. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aguá¹‡akathÄ 303. tena kho pana samayena nÄnÄverajjakÄnaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ paÃ±camattÄni brÄhmaá¹‡asatÄni campÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹­ivasanti kenacideva karaá¹‡Ä«yena. assosuá¹ƒ kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä â€“ "soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o kira brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"ti. atha kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä yena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o tenupasaá¹…kamiá¹ƒsu, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "saccaá¹ƒ kira bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"ti? "evaá¹ƒ kho me, bho, hoti â€“ â€˜ahampi samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ«"â€™ti. "mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kami. na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. sace bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissati,
Then, on that occasion, some five hundred **brÄhmaá¹‡as** (Brahmins) from various realms were residing in CampÄ for some business or other. The **brÄhmaá¹‡as** (Brahmins) heard: "The brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a, it is said, will approach the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him)." Then the **brÄhmaá¹‡as** (Brahmins) approached the brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a, and having approached the brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a, they said this: "Is it true that the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a will approach the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him)?" "Yes, gentlemen, this is what I intend: 'I too will approach the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him).'" "May the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a not approach the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him). It is not fitting for the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a to approach the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him). If the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a approaches the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him), those who desire the meaning of the *mantras* (spells), who wish to study the *mantras* (spells), will come near the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aâ€¦ "The esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is old, aged, advanced in years, has reached the last stage, is advanced in age; the ascetic **Gautama** is young and recently gone forthâ€¦ "The esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is revered, respected, esteemed, worshipped, honored by King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadhaâ€¦ "The esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is revered, respected, esteemed, worshipped, honored by the brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) PokkharasÄtiâ€¦ "The esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a dwells in CampÄ, a populous place, with grass, timber, water, and grain in abundance, a royal domain, granted by King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadha, a royal gift, a *brahmadeyya* (Brahmin-grant). Since the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a dwells in CampÄ, a populous place, with grass, timber, water, and grain in abundance, a royal domain, granted by King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadha, a royal gift, a *brahmadeyya* (Brahmin-grant). Because of this disadvantage, the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a should not approach the ascetic **Gautama** for a sight (of him); rather, the ascetic **Gautama** should approach the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a for a sight (of him)." The story of the Buddha's virtues.
304. Ägacchanti bhoto soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa santike mantatthikÄ mante adhiyitukÄmÄ â€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o jiá¹‡á¹‡o vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, samaá¹‡o gotamo taruá¹‡o ceva taruá¹‡apabbajito caâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o raÃ±Ã±o mÄgadhassa seniyassa bimbisÄrassa sakkato garukato mÄnito pÅ«jito apacitoâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa sakkato garukato mÄnito pÅ«jito apacitoâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o campaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ, raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ, rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. yampi bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o campaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ, raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ, rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. iminÄpaá¹…gena na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ, samaá¹‡otveva gotamo arahati bhavantaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamitu"nti. buddhaguá¹‡akathÄ 304. evaá¹ƒ vutte, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "tena hi, bho, mamapi suá¹‡Ätha, yathÄ mayameva arahÄma taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ, natveva arahati so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo amhÄkaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca, saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ, akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena. yampi bho samaá¹‡o gotamo ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ, akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, iminÄpaá¹…gena na arahati so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo amhÄkaá¹ƒ dassanÄya
When this was said, the brÄhmaá¹‡a (Brahmin) Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a said this to those **brÄhmaá¹‡as** (Brahmins): "Then, gentlemen, listen to me, as to why we alone are fit to approach the venerable **Gautama** for a sight (of him), but the venerable **Gautama** is not fit to approach us for a sight (of him). The ascetic **Gautama**, gentlemen, is well-born on both sides, from both mother and father, of pure descent back to the seventh generation of ancestors, unblemished, irreproachable in regard to birth. Since the venerable ascetic **Gautama** is well-born on both sides, from both mother and father, of pure descent back to the seventh generation of ancestors, unblemished, irreproachable in regard to birth, because of this disadvantage, that venerable **Gautama** is not fit for our sight. Indeed, King Pasenadi of Kosala has gone for refuge to the ascetic Gotama (Åšramaá¹‡a Gautama), together with his son, his wife, his entourage and his ministers. Indeed, the Brahmin PokkharasÄti has gone for refuge to the ascetic Gotama (Åšramaá¹‡a Gautama), together with his son, his wife, his entourage and his ministers. Indeed, the ascetic Gotama (Åšramaá¹‡a Gautama) is esteemed, made much of, honored, revered and venerated by King Seniya Bimbisara of Magadha. Indeed, the ascetic Gotama (Åšramaá¹‡a Gautama) is esteemed, made much of, honored, revered and venerated by King Pasenadi of Kosala. Indeed, the ascetic Gotama (Åšramaá¹‡a Gautama) is esteemed, made much of, honored, revered and venerated by the Brahmin PokkharasÄti. The ascetic Gotama (Åšramaá¹‡a Gautama) has arrived in Campa and is staying by Gaggaraâ€™s lotus-pond. And whatever ascetics or Brahmins come to our territory are our guests. And guests should be honored, respected, revered, and venerated by us. Having come to Campa and staying by Gaggaraâ€™s lotus-pond, the ascetic Gotama (Åšramaá¹‡a Gautama) is our guest, and guests should be honored, respected, revered, and venerated by us. Therefore it is not proper that the esteemed Gotama (Gotamaá¸¥) should come to visit us. But rather we are fit to visit the esteemed Gotama (Gotamaá¹ƒ). However much I might praise the honored Gotama (Gotamassa), the honored Gotama (Gotamo) is not just that much. Indeed the honored Gotama (Gotamo) is of immeasurable praise.
305. "samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ khalu, bho, gotamaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo saputto sabhariyo sapariso sÄmacco pÄá¹‡ehi saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ gatoâ€¦peâ€¦ "samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ khalu, bho, gotamaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡o pokkharasÄti saputto sabhariyo sapariso sÄmacco pÄá¹‡ehi saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ gatoâ€¦peâ€¦ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo raÃ±Ã±o mÄgadhassa seniyassa bimbisÄrassa sakkato garukato mÄnito pÅ«jito apacitoâ€¦peâ€¦ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo raÃ±Ã±o pasenadissa kosalassa sakkato garukato mÄnito pÅ«jito apacitoâ€¦peâ€¦ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa sakkato garukato mÄnito pÅ«jito apacitoâ€¦peâ€¦ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo campaá¹ƒ anuppatto, campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re. ye kho pana, bho, keci samaá¹‡Ä vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä vÄ amhÄkaá¹ƒ gÄmakhettaá¹ƒ Ägacchanti atithÄ« no te honti. atithÄ« kho panamhehi sakkÄtabbÄ garukÄtabbÄ mÄnetabbÄ pÅ«jetabbÄ apacetabbÄ. yampi, bho, samaá¹‡o gotamo campaá¹ƒ anuppatto campÄyaá¹ƒ viharati gaggarÄya pokkharaá¹‡iyÄ tÄ«re, atithimhÄkaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo, atithi kho panamhehi sakkÄtabbo garukÄtabbo mÄnetabbo pÅ«jetabbo apacetabbo. iminÄpaá¹…gena na arahati so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo amhÄkaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. atha kho mayameva arahÄma taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. ettake kho ahaá¹ƒ, bho, tassa bhoto gotamassa vaá¹‡á¹‡e pariyÄpuá¹‡Ämi, no ca kho so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo ettakavaá¹‡á¹‡o. aparimÄá¹‡avaá¹‡á¹‡o hi so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo"ti. 305. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "yathÄ kho bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡assa gotamassa vaá¹‡á¹‡e bhÄsati ito cepi so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo yojanasate viharati, alameva saddhena kulaputtena dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ api puá¹­osenÄ"ti. "tena hi, bho, sabbeva mayaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ"ti.
When this was said, the Brahmins said this to the Brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a: â€˜Sir, since the esteemed Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a speaks in praise of the ascetic Gotama (Gotamassa), even if that esteemed Gotama (Gotamo) were staying a hundred yojanas away, it would be quite fitting for a believing clansman to go visit him, even with a shoulder-bag.â€™ â€œThen, sir, let us all go to visit the ascetic Gotama (Gotamaá¹ƒ)." The thought of Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a
306. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aparivitakko 306. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ƒ yena gaggarÄ pokkharaá¹‡Ä« tenupasaá¹…kami. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa tirovanasaá¹‡á¸agatassa evaá¹ƒ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi â€“ "ahaÃ±ceva kho pana samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyyaá¹ƒ, tatra ce maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ â€˜na kho esa, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±ho evaá¹ƒ pucchitabbo, evaá¹ƒ nÄmesa, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±ho pucchitabboâ€™ti, tena maá¹ƒ ayaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya â€“ â€˜bÄlo soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o abyatto, nÄsakkhi samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ yoniso paÃ±haá¹ƒ pucchituâ€™nti. yaá¹ƒ kho panÄyaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya, yasopi tassa hÄyetha. yassa kho pana yaso hÄyetha, bhogÄpi tassa hÄyeyyuá¹ƒ. yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ. mamaÃ±ceva kho pana samaá¹‡o gotamo paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya, tassa cÄhaá¹ƒ paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡ena cittaá¹ƒ na ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ, tatra ce maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ â€˜na kho esa, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±ho evaá¹ƒ byÄkÄtabbo, evaá¹ƒ nÄmesa, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±ho byÄkÄtabboâ€™ti, tena maá¹ƒ ayaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya â€“ â€˜bÄlo soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o abyatto, nÄsakkhi samaá¹‡assa gotamassa paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡ena cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdhetuâ€™nti. yaá¹ƒ kho panÄyaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya, yasopi tassa hÄyetha. yassa kho pana yaso hÄyetha, bhogÄpi tassa hÄyeyyuá¹ƒ. yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ. ahaÃ±ceva kho pana evaá¹ƒ samÄ«pagato samÄno adisvÄva samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ nivatteyyaá¹ƒ, tena maá¹ƒ ayaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya â€“ â€˜bÄlo soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o abyatto mÄnathaddho bhÄ«to ca, no visahati samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ, kathaÃ±hi nÄma evaá¹ƒ samÄ«pagato samÄno adisvÄ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ nivattissatÄ«â€™ti. yaá¹ƒ kho panÄyaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya, yasopi tassa hÄyetha. yassa kho pana yaso hÄyetha, bhogÄpi tassa hÄyeyyuá¹ƒ, yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ"ti. 307. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. campeyyakÄpi kho
Then the Brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a went with a large company of Brahmins to Gaggara's lotus pond. Then, when the Brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a had gone into the forest thicket, this thought arose in his mind: "If I were to ask the ascetic Gotama (Gotamaá¹ƒ) a question, and the ascetic Gotama (Gotamo) were to say to me, 'That is not the way to ask the question, Brahmin, this is the way to ask the question,' then this assembly would despise me, saying, 'The Brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is a fool, he is incompetent, he could not ask the ascetic Gotama (Gotamaá¹ƒ) a question properly.'" If this assembly were to despise someone, his reputation would suffer. If someone's reputation were to suffer, his income would also suffer. For our income depends on gaining a reputation. If the ascetic Gotama (Gotamo) were to ask me a question, and I could not satisfy his mind with an explanation of that question, and the ascetic Gotama (Gotamo) were to say to me, 'That is not the way to explain the question, Brahmin, this is the way to explain the question,' then this assembly would despise me, saying, 'The Brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is a fool, he is incompetent, he could not satisfy the mind of the ascetic Gotama (Gotamassa) with an explanation of the question.'" If this assembly were to despise someone, his reputation would suffer. If someone's reputation were to suffer, his income would also suffer. For our income depends on gaining a reputation. If, having come so near, I were to turn back without even seeing the ascetic Gotama (Gotamaá¹ƒ), this assembly would despise me, saying: â€˜The Brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is a fool, incompetent, arrogant, and fearful, and cannot bear to visit the ascetic Gotama (Gotamaá¹ƒ). How could he, having come so near, turn back without seeing the ascetic Gotama (Gotamaá¹ƒ)?â€™" If this assembly were to despise someone, his reputation would suffer. If someone's reputation were to suffer, his income would also suffer, for our income depends on gaining a reputation."

Then the Brahmin Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a went to where the Blessed One (BhagavÄ) was, and exchanged greetings with the Blessed One (BhagavatÄ). When the courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side. The Campeyyakas also... Some of the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* householders, having bowed down to the Blessed One (bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ), sat down to one side. Some exchanged courteous greetings with the Blessed One (bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodiá¹ƒsu), and after an exchange of friendly greetings and courtesies (sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ), sat down to one side. Some, having raised their hands palm-to-palm in front of the heart towards the Blessed One (yena bhagavÄ tenaÃ±jaliá¹ƒ paá¹‡ÄmetvÄ), sat down to one side. Some, after announcing their name and clan (nÄmagottaá¹ƒ sÄvetvÄ), sat down to one side. Some, remaining silent (tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÅ«tÄ), sat down to one side.
308. brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ appekacce bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodiá¹ƒsu, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ 308. tatrapi sudaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o etadeva bahulamanuvitakkento nisinno hoti â€“ "ahaÃ±ceva kho pana samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyyaá¹ƒ, tatra ce maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo evaá¹ƒ yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ. mamaÃ±ceva kho pana samaá¹‡o gotamo paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya, tassa cÄhaá¹ƒ paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡ena cittaá¹ƒ na ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ, tatra ce maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo evaá¹ƒ yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ. aho vata maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo sake Äcariyake tevijjake paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya, addhÄ vatassÄhaá¹ƒ cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡enÄ"ti. brÄhmaá¹‡apaÃ±Ã±atti 309. atha kho bhagavato soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa cetasÄ cetoparivitakkamaÃ±Ã±Äya etadahosi â€“ "vihaÃ±Ã±ati kho ayaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o sakena cittena.
