There, too, Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, was sitting, reflecting much on this very idea: "If I were to ask the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama a question (samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyyaá¹ƒ), and if the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama were to say to me thus: 'This, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, is not the way to ask the question; this, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, is how the question should be asked,' then this assembly (parisÄ) would despise me: 'Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* is a fool, inept, he could not ask the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama a question properly (yoniso paÃ±haá¹ƒ pucchitu)â€™nti." And if anyone were despised by this assembly (parisÄ paribhaveyya), his reputation (yaso) would suffer (hÄyetha). And if a manâ€™s reputation (yaso hÄyetha) suffers, his income (bhogÄ) would suffer (hÄyeyyuá¹ƒ). For our income (bhogÄ) depends on the gaining of reputation (yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ). "And if the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama were to ask me a question (paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya), and I could not satisfy his mind (cittaá¹ƒ na ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ) with an explanation of that question (paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡ena), and if the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama were to say to me thus: 'This, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, is not the way to explain the question (paÃ±ho evaá¹ƒ byÄkÄtabbo); this, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, is how the question should be explained (paÃ±ho byÄkÄtabbo),' then this assembly (parisÄ) would despise me: 'Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* is a fool, inept, he could not satisfy the mind (cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdhetu) of the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama with an explanation of the question (paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡ena)â€™nti." And if anyone were despised by this assembly (parisÄ paribhaveyya), his reputation (yaso) would suffer (hÄyetha). And if a manâ€™s reputation (yaso hÄyetha) suffers, his income (bhogÄ) would suffer (hÄyeyyuá¹ƒ). For our income (bhogÄ) depends on the gaining of reputation (yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ). "If only the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama would ask me a question (paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya) from my own field (sake Äcariyake), that of the Three Vedas (tevijjake)! Then I could surely satisfy his mind (cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ) with an explanation of the question (paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡enÄ)!" *BrÄhmaá¹‡a*-precept (brÄhmaá¹‡apaÃ±Ã±atti).
309. brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ appekacce bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodiá¹ƒsu, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce yena bhagavÄ tenaÃ±jaliá¹ƒ paá¹‡ÄmetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce nÄmagottaá¹ƒ sÄvetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÅ«tÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu. 308. tatrapi sudaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o etadeva bahulamanuvitakkento nisinno hoti â€“ "ahaÃ±ceva kho pana samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyyaá¹ƒ, tatra ce maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ â€˜na kho esa, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±ho evaá¹ƒ pucchitabbo, evaá¹ƒ nÄmesa, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±ho pucchitabboâ€™ti, tena maá¹ƒ ayaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya â€“ â€˜bÄlo soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o abyatto, nÄsakkhi samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ yoniso paÃ±haá¹ƒ pucchituâ€™nti. yaá¹ƒ kho panÄyaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya, yasopi tassa hÄyetha. yassa kho pana yaso hÄyetha, bhogÄpi tassa hÄyeyyuá¹ƒ. yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ. mamaÃ±ceva kho pana samaá¹‡o gotamo paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya, tassa cÄhaá¹ƒ paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡ena cittaá¹ƒ na ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ, tatra ce maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ â€˜na kho esa, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±ho evaá¹ƒ byÄkÄtabbo, evaá¹ƒ nÄmesa, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±ho byÄkÄtabboâ€™ti, tena maá¹ƒ ayaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya â€“ â€˜bÄlo soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o abyatto, nÄsakkhi samaá¹‡assa gotamassa paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡ena cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdhetuâ€™nti. yaá¹ƒ kho panÄyaá¹ƒ parisÄ paribhaveyya, yasopi tassa hÄyetha. yassa kho pana yaso hÄyetha, bhogÄpi tassa hÄyeyyuá¹ƒ. yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ. aho vata maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo sake Äcariyake tevijjake paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya, addhÄ vatassÄhaá¹ƒ cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡enÄ"ti. brÄhmaá¹‡apaÃ±Ã±atti 309. atha kho bhagavato soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa cetasÄ cetoparivitakkamaÃ±Ã±Äya etadahosi â€“ "vihaÃ±Ã±ati kho ayaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o sakena cittena. yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ sake Äcariyake tevijjake paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya"nti. atha kho bhagavÄ
Then the Blessed One (bhagavato), knowing with his mind the reflection in the mind (cetasÄ cetoparivitakkamaÃ±Ã±Äya) of Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, thought thus (etadahosi): "This Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* is troubled (vihaÃ±Ã±ati kho ayaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o) in his own mind (sakena cittena). Suppose I were to ask Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* (soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ) a question from his own field (sake Äcariyake), that of the Three Vedas (tevijjake) (paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya)"nti. Then the Blessed One (atha kho bhagavÄ)... So he said to Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the Brahmin: "By how many qualities, O Brahmin, do Brahmins identify a Brahmin? How can one who declares, 'I am a Brahmin,' speak truthfully and not incur falsehood?"
310. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "katihi pana, brÄhmaá¹‡a, aá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. 310. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa etadahosi â€“ "yaá¹ƒ vata no ahosi icchitaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ Äkaá¹…khitaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ adhippetaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ abhipatthitaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜aho vata maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo sake Äcariyake tevijjake paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya, addhÄ vatassÄhaá¹ƒ cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡enÄâ€™ti, tatra maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo sake Äcariyake tevijjake paÃ±haá¹ƒ pucchati. addhÄ vatassÄhaá¹ƒ cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdhessÄmi paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡enÄ"ti. 311. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o abbhunnÄmetvÄ kÄyaá¹ƒ anuviloketvÄ parisaá¹ƒ bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "paÃ±cahi, bho gotama, aá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ Äpajjeyya. katamehi paÃ±cahi? idha, bho gotama, brÄhmaá¹‡o ubhato sujÄto hoti mÄtito ca pitito ca, saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, ajjhÄyako hoti mantadharo tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayo, abhirÅ«po hoti dassanÄ«yo pÄsÄdiko paramÄya vaá¹‡á¹‡apokkharatÄya samannÄgato brahmavaá¹‡á¹‡Ä« brahmavacchasÄ« akhuddÄvakÄso dassanÄya, sÄ«lavÄ hoti vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito ca hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho, bho gotama, paÃ±cahi aá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. "imesaá¹ƒ pana, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±cannaá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ sakkÄ ekaá¹ƒ aá¹…gaá¹ƒ á¹­hapayitvÄ catÅ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apetuá¹ƒ, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti.
Then the following thought occurred to Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the Brahmin: "What I wanted, what I hoped for, what I desired, what I longed forâ€”'Oh, that the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama would ask me a question about the traditional lore of the three Vedas! Truly, I would satisfy his mind with an explanation of the question'â€”now the *samaá¹‡a* Gotama is asking me a question about the traditional lore of the three Vedas. Truly, I will satisfy his mind with an explanation of the question."
311. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "katihi pana, brÄhmaá¹‡a, aá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. 310. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa etadahosi â€“ "yaá¹ƒ vata no ahosi icchitaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ Äkaá¹…khitaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ adhippetaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ abhipatthitaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜aho vata maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo sake Äcariyake tevijjake paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccheyya, addhÄ vatassÄhaá¹ƒ cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdheyyaá¹ƒ paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡enÄâ€™ti, tatra maá¹ƒ samaá¹‡o gotamo sake Äcariyake tevijjake paÃ±haá¹ƒ pucchati. addhÄ vatassÄhaá¹ƒ cittaá¹ƒ ÄrÄdhessÄmi paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡enÄ"ti. 311. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o abbhunnÄmetvÄ kÄyaá¹ƒ anuviloketvÄ parisaá¹ƒ bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "paÃ±cahi, bho gotama, aá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ Äpajjeyya. katamehi paÃ±cahi? idha, bho gotama, brÄhmaá¹‡o ubhato sujÄto hoti mÄtito ca pitito ca, saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, ajjhÄyako hoti mantadharo tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayo, abhirÅ«po hoti dassanÄ«yo pÄsÄdiko paramÄya vaá¹‡á¹‡apokkharatÄya samannÄgato brahmavaá¹‡á¹‡Ä« brahmavacchasÄ« akhuddÄvakÄso dassanÄya, sÄ«lavÄ hoti vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito ca hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho, bho gotama, paÃ±cahi aá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. "imesaá¹ƒ pana, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±cannaá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ sakkÄ ekaá¹ƒ aá¹…gaá¹ƒ á¹­hapayitvÄ catÅ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apetuá¹ƒ, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti.
Then Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the Brahmin straightened up, looked around at the assembly, and said to the Blessed One: "With five qualities, O Gotama, do Brahmins identify a Brahmin; one who declares, 'I am a Brahmin,' speaks truthfully and does not incur falsehood. Which are the five? Here, O Gotama, a Brahmin is well-born on both sides, from mother and father, of pure descent back to the seventh generation of ancestors, unblemished and irreproachable in regard to birth; he is a reciter of the Vedas (*adhyÄyaka*), a master of the *mantras* (*mantadhara*), one who has reached the further shore of the three Vedas, with their vocabularies (*nighaá¹‡á¸u*) and indices (*keá¹­ubha*), complete with etymology (*sÄkkharappabheda*) and accounts of the past (*itihÄsa*) as the fifth, skilled in *padako* and grammar (*veyyÄkaraá¹‡a*), and not inept in *lokÄyata* and the characteristics of a great man (*mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡a*); he is handsome, pleasant to look upon, inspiring confidence, possessed of supreme beauty of complexion, of brahminical color, of brahminical luster, with a faultless build; he is virtuous (*Å›Ä«lavÄ*), with developed virtue (*vuddhasÄ«lÄ«*), possessing developed virtue; and he is learned (*paá¹‡á¸ita*) and wise (*medhÄvÄ«*), the first or second to take the ladle (*sujaá¹ƒ*) when it is offered. It is with these five qualities, O Gotama, that Brahmins identify a Brahmin; one who declares, 'I am a Brahmin,' speaks truthfully and does not incur falsehood." "But, Brahmin, is it possible that if one of these five qualities were omitted, Brahmins could still identify a Brahmin as being possessed of four qualities, and one who declares, 'I am a Brahmin,' would speak truthfully and not incur falsehood?"
312. "sakkÄ, bho gotama. imesaÃ±hi, bho gotama, paÃ±cannaá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ á¹­hapayÄma. kiÃ±hi vaá¹‡á¹‡o karissati? yato kho, bho gotama, brÄhmaá¹‡o ubhato sujÄto hoti mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, ajjhÄyako ca hoti mantadharo ca tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayo, sÄ«lavÄ ca hoti vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito ca hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho bho gotama catÅ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. 312. "imesaá¹ƒ pana, brÄhmaá¹‡a, catunnaá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ sakkÄ ekaá¹ƒ aá¹…gaá¹ƒ á¹­hapayitvÄ tÄ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apetuá¹ƒ, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti? "sakkÄ, bho gotama. imesaÃ±hi, bho gotama, catunnaá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ mante á¹­hapayÄma. kiÃ±hi mantÄ karissanti? yato kho, bho gotama, brÄhmaá¹‡o ubhato sujÄto hoti mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, sÄ«lavÄ ca hoti vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito ca hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho, bho gotama, tÄ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. "imesaá¹ƒ pana, brÄhmaá¹‡a, tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ sakkÄ ekaá¹ƒ aá¹…gaá¹ƒ á¹­hapayitvÄ dvÄ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apetuá¹ƒ, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti? "sakkÄ, bho gotama. imesaÃ±hi, bho gotama, tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ jÄtiá¹ƒ á¹­hapayÄma. kiÃ±hi jÄti karissati? yato kho, bho gotama, brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄ«lavÄ hoti vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito ca
â€œBut, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, if one of these four qualities could be omitted, leaving three with which Brahmins could recognize a Brahmin, and when declaring â€œI am a Brahminâ€ one would speak correctly, and not incur falsehood?â€ â€œIt is possible, Gotama." Indeed, Master Gotama, we could leave out the mantras of these four qualities. What can mantras do? If, Master Gotama, a *brÄhmaá¹‡a* is well-born on both sides, from his mother and father, of pure descent back to the seventh generation of ancestors, unblemished and irreproachable in regard to his birth; and is virtuous, of increasing virtue, endowed with increasing virtue; and is learned and wise, and is the first or second to hold the sacrificial ladle. Brahmins recognize a Brahmin by these three qualities, good Gotama, and when declaring â€œI am a Brahminâ€ one would speak correctly, and not incur falsehood.â€™ â€œBut, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, if one of these three qualities could be omitted, leaving two with which Brahmins could recognize a Brahmin, and when declaring â€œI am a Brahminâ€ one would speak correctly, and not incur falsehood?â€ â€œIt is possible, Gotama." Indeed, Master Gotama, we could leave out birth of these three qualities. What can birth do? If, Master Gotama, a *brÄhmaá¹‡a* is virtuous, of increasing virtue, endowed with increasing virtue; and is learned and wise, and is the first or second to hold the sacrificial ladle. Brahmins recognize a Brahmin by these two qualities, good Gotama, and when declaring â€œI am a Brahminâ€ one would speak correctly, and not incur falsehood.â€™
313. hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho, bho gotama, dvÄ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. 313. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o evaá¹ƒ avaca, mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o evaá¹ƒ avaca. apavadateva bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ, apavadati mante, apavadati jÄtiá¹ƒ ekaá¹ƒsena. bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡asseva gotamassa vÄdaá¹ƒ anupakkhandatÄ«"ti. 314. atha kho bhagavÄ te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "sace kho tumhÄkaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ â€˜appassuto ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, akalyÄá¹‡avÄkkaraá¹‡o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, duppaÃ±Ã±o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, na ca pahoti soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ asmiá¹ƒ vacane paá¹­imantetuâ€™nti, tiá¹­á¹­hatu soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, tumhe mayÄ saddhiá¹ƒ mantavho asmiá¹ƒ vacane. sace pana tumhÄkaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ â€˜bahussuto ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, kalyÄá¹‡avÄkkaraá¹‡o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, paá¹‡á¸ito ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, pahoti ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ asmiá¹ƒ vacane paá¹­imantetuâ€™nti, tiá¹­á¹­hatha tumhe, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o mayÄ saddhiá¹ƒ paá¹­imantetÅ«"ti. 315. evaá¹ƒ vutte, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "tiá¹­á¹­hatu bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo, tuá¹‡hÄ« bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo hotu, ahameva tesaá¹ƒ sahadhammena paá¹­ivacanaá¹ƒ karissÄmÄ«"ti. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "mÄ bhavanto evaá¹ƒ avacuttha, mÄ bhavanto evaá¹ƒ avacuttha â€“ â€˜apavadateva bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ, apavadati mante, apavadati jÄtiá¹ƒ ekaá¹ƒsena. bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡asseva gotamassa vÄdaá¹ƒ anupakkhandatÄ«â€™ti. nÄhaá¹ƒ, bho, apavadÄmi vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ mante vÄ jÄtiá¹ƒ vÄ"ti.
When this was said, those Brahmins said this to the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a: â€œReverend Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a, do not say that! Reverend Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a, do not say that! The Reverend Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is decrying appearance, the mantras, and birth, completely. The Reverend Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is actually adopting the ascetic Gotamaâ€™s own words!â€
314. hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho, bho gotama, dvÄ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. 313. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o evaá¹ƒ avaca, mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o evaá¹ƒ avaca. apavadateva bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ, apavadati mante, apavadati jÄtiá¹ƒ ekaá¹ƒsena. bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡asseva gotamassa vÄdaá¹ƒ anupakkhandatÄ«"ti. 314. atha kho bhagavÄ te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "sace kho tumhÄkaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ â€˜appassuto ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, akalyÄá¹‡avÄkkaraá¹‡o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, duppaÃ±Ã±o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, na ca pahoti soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ asmiá¹ƒ vacane paá¹­imantetuâ€™nti, tiá¹­á¹­hatu soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, tumhe mayÄ saddhiá¹ƒ mantavho asmiá¹ƒ vacane. sace pana tumhÄkaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ â€˜bahussuto ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, kalyÄá¹‡avÄkkaraá¹‡o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, paá¹‡á¸ito ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, pahoti ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ asmiá¹ƒ vacane paá¹­imantetuâ€™nti, tiá¹­á¹­hatha tumhe, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o mayÄ saddhiá¹ƒ paá¹­imantetÅ«"ti. 315. evaá¹ƒ vutte, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "tiá¹­á¹­hatu bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo, tuá¹‡hÄ« bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo hotu, ahameva tesaá¹ƒ sahadhammena paá¹­ivacanaá¹ƒ karissÄmÄ«"ti. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "mÄ bhavanto evaá¹ƒ avacuttha, mÄ bhavanto evaá¹ƒ avacuttha â€“ â€˜apavadateva bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ, apavadati mante, apavadati jÄtiá¹ƒ ekaá¹ƒsena. bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡asseva gotamassa vÄdaá¹ƒ anupakkhandatÄ«â€™ti. nÄhaá¹ƒ, bho, apavadÄmi vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ mante vÄ jÄtiá¹ƒ vÄ"ti.
Then the Blessed One said this to the Brahmins: â€œIf you Brahmins think this: â€˜The *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is unlearned, the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is of impure speech, the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is unwise, and the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is not capable of arguing in this matter with the ascetic Gotama,â€™ let the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a be, and you discuss this matter with me. But if you Brahmins think this: â€˜The *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is learned, the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is of pure speech, the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is wise, and the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is capable of arguing in this matter with the ascetic Gotama,â€™ then you be silent, and let the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a argue with me!â€
315. hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho, bho gotama, dvÄ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. 313. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o evaá¹ƒ avaca, mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o evaá¹ƒ avaca. apavadateva bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ, apavadati mante, apavadati jÄtiá¹ƒ ekaá¹ƒsena. bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡asseva gotamassa vÄdaá¹ƒ anupakkhandatÄ«"ti. 314. atha kho bhagavÄ te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "sace kho tumhÄkaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ â€˜appassuto ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, akalyÄá¹‡avÄkkaraá¹‡o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, duppaÃ±Ã±o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, na ca pahoti soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ asmiá¹ƒ vacane paá¹­imantetuâ€™nti, tiá¹­á¹­hatu soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, tumhe mayÄ saddhiá¹ƒ mantavho asmiá¹ƒ vacane. sace pana tumhÄkaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ â€˜bahussuto ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, kalyÄá¹‡avÄkkaraá¹‡o ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, paá¹‡á¸ito ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o, pahoti ca soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡ena gotamena saddhiá¹ƒ asmiá¹ƒ vacane paá¹­imantetuâ€™nti, tiá¹­á¹­hatha tumhe, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o mayÄ saddhiá¹ƒ paá¹­imantetÅ«"ti. 315. evaá¹ƒ vutte, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "tiá¹­á¹­hatu bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo, tuá¹‡hÄ« bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo hotu, ahameva tesaá¹ƒ sahadhammena paá¹­ivacanaá¹ƒ karissÄmÄ«"ti. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "mÄ bhavanto evaá¹ƒ avacuttha, mÄ bhavanto evaá¹ƒ avacuttha â€“ â€˜apavadateva bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ, apavadati mante, apavadati jÄtiá¹ƒ ekaá¹ƒsena. bhavaá¹ƒ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o samaá¹‡asseva gotamassa vÄdaá¹ƒ anupakkhandatÄ«â€™ti. nÄhaá¹ƒ, bho, apavadÄmi vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ mante vÄ jÄtiá¹ƒ vÄ"ti.
When this was said, the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a said this to the Blessed One: â€œLet that be, Reverend Gotama, may Reverend Gotama be silent. I myself will give them an answer in accordance with the Dhamma!â€ Then the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a said this to those Brahmins: â€œReverends, do not say that! Reverends, do not say that! The Reverend Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is decrying appearance, the mantras, and birth, completely. The Reverend Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a is actually adopting the ascetic Gotamaâ€™s own words!â€ I do not decry appearance, or mantras, or birth.
316. 316. tena kho pana samayena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa bhÄgineyyo aá¹…gako nÄma mÄá¹‡avako tassaá¹ƒ parisÄyaá¹ƒ nisinno hoti. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "passanti no bhonto imaá¹ƒ aá¹…gakaá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ amhÄkaá¹ƒ bhÄgineyya"nti? "evaá¹ƒ, bho". "aá¹…gako kho, bho, mÄá¹‡avako abhirÅ«po dassanÄ«yo pÄsÄdiko paramÄya vaá¹‡á¹‡apokkharatÄya samannÄgato brahmavaá¹‡á¹‡Ä« brahmavacchasÄ« akhuddÄvakÄso dassanÄya, nÄssa imissaá¹ƒ parisÄyaá¹ƒ samasamo atthi vaá¹‡á¹‡ena á¹­hapetvÄ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ. aá¹…gako kho mÄá¹‡avako ajjhÄyako mantadharo, tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayo. ahamassa mante vÄcetÄ. aá¹…gako kho mÄá¹‡avako ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena. ahamassa mÄtÄpitaro jÄnÄmi. aá¹…gako kho mÄá¹‡avako pÄá¹‡ampi haneyya, adinnampi Ädiyeyya, paradÄrampi gaccheyya, musÄvÄdampi bhaá¹‡eyya, majjampi piveyya, ettha dÄni, bho, kiá¹ƒ vaá¹‡á¹‡o karissati, kiá¹ƒ mantÄ, kiá¹ƒ jÄti? yato kho, bho, brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄ«lavÄ ca hoti vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito ca hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho, bho, dvÄ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. sÄ«lapaÃ±Ã±ÄkathÄ 317. "imesaá¹ƒ pana, brÄhmaá¹‡a, dvinnaá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ sakkÄ ekaá¹ƒ aá¹…gaá¹ƒ á¹­hapayitvÄ ekena aá¹…gena samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apetuá¹ƒ, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti? "no hidaá¹ƒ, bho gotama. sÄ«laparidhotÄ hi, bho gotama, paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±Äparidhotaá¹ƒ sÄ«laá¹ƒ. yattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ tattha paÃ±Ã±Ä, yattha paÃ±Ã±Ä tattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lavato paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±avato sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lapaÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±ca pana lokasmiá¹ƒ aggamakkhÄyati. seyyathÄpi, bho gotama, hatthena vÄ hatthaá¹ƒ dhoveyya, pÄdena vÄ pÄdaá¹ƒ dhoveyya, evameva kho, bho gotama, sÄ«laparidhotÄ paÃ±Ã±Ä,
Now at that time, Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aâ€™s nephew, a young man named Aá¹…gaka, was sitting in that assembly. Then Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* said to those *brÄhmaá¹‡as*: "Gentlemen, do you see this young man Aá¹…gaka, our nephew?" "Yes, sir." "Aá¹…gaka, sir, is handsome, good-looking, pleasing, of supremely fair complexion, in form and countenance like BrahmÄ, of no mean appearance, and there is none in this assembly his equal in appearance, except the ascetic Gotama. Aá¹…gaka, sir, is a scholar, versed in the *mantras*, accomplished in the Three Vedas, with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology, and the histories as the fifth; skilled in philology and grammar, he is fully versed in natural philosophy and in the marks of a Great Man (*mahÄpurisa-lakkhaá¹‡esu anavayo*). I was his *mantra*-teacher. Aá¹…gaka, sir, is well-born on both sides, of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken, of irreproachable birth. I know his parents. Aá¹…gaka, sir, might even kill a living being, take what is not given, go to another's wife, speak falsely, and drink intoxicants. Now what good, sir, would appearance, *mantras*, or birth do? It is when a *brÄhmaá¹‡a* is virtuous, of mature virtue, possessed of mature virtue, wise, and intelligent, whether he is the first or second among those who receive gifts. Brahmins recognize a *brÄhmaá¹‡a* as a *brÄhmaá¹‡a* when he possesses these two qualities, and declaring 'I am a *brÄhmaá¹‡a*', he would be speaking correctly, and would not be subject to falsehood." The Discourse on Morality and Wisdom
317. 316. tena kho pana samayena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa bhÄgineyyo aá¹…gako nÄma mÄá¹‡avako tassaá¹ƒ parisÄyaá¹ƒ nisinno hoti. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“ "passanti no bhonto imaá¹ƒ aá¹…gakaá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ amhÄkaá¹ƒ bhÄgineyya"nti? "evaá¹ƒ, bho". "aá¹…gako kho, bho, mÄá¹‡avako abhirÅ«po dassanÄ«yo pÄsÄdiko paramÄya vaá¹‡á¹‡apokkharatÄya samannÄgato brahmavaá¹‡á¹‡Ä« brahmavacchasÄ« akhuddÄvakÄso dassanÄya, nÄssa imissaá¹ƒ parisÄyaá¹ƒ samasamo atthi vaá¹‡á¹‡ena á¹­hapetvÄ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ. aá¹…gako kho mÄá¹‡avako ajjhÄyako mantadharo, tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayo. ahamassa mante vÄcetÄ. aá¹…gako kho mÄá¹‡avako ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena. ahamassa mÄtÄpitaro jÄnÄmi. aá¹…gako kho mÄá¹‡avako pÄá¹‡ampi haneyya, adinnampi Ädiyeyya, paradÄrampi gaccheyya, musÄvÄdampi bhaá¹‡eyya, majjampi piveyya, ettha dÄni, bho, kiá¹ƒ vaá¹‡á¹‡o karissati, kiá¹ƒ mantÄ, kiá¹ƒ jÄti? yato kho, bho, brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄ«lavÄ ca hoti vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito ca hoti medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. imehi kho, bho, dvÄ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apenti, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti. sÄ«lapaÃ±Ã±ÄkathÄ 317. "imesaá¹ƒ pana, brÄhmaá¹‡a, dvinnaá¹ƒ aá¹…gÄnaá¹ƒ sakkÄ ekaá¹ƒ aá¹…gaá¹ƒ á¹­hapayitvÄ ekena aá¹…gena samannÄgataá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ paÃ±Ã±apetuá¹ƒ, â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡osmÄ«â€™ti ca vadamÄno sammÄ vadeyya, na ca pana musÄvÄdaá¹ƒ ÄpajjeyyÄ"ti? "no hidaá¹ƒ, bho gotama. sÄ«laparidhotÄ hi, bho gotama, paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±Äparidhotaá¹ƒ sÄ«laá¹ƒ. yattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ tattha paÃ±Ã±Ä, yattha paÃ±Ã±Ä tattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lavato paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±avato sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lapaÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±ca pana lokasmiá¹ƒ aggamakkhÄyati. seyyathÄpi, bho gotama, hatthena vÄ hatthaá¹ƒ dhoveyya, pÄdena vÄ pÄdaá¹ƒ dhoveyya, evameva kho, bho gotama, sÄ«laparidhotÄ paÃ±Ã±Ä,
"But, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, is it possible that, omitting one of these two qualities, *brÄhmaá¹‡as* might recognize a *brÄhmaá¹‡a* as a *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, and declaring 'I am a *brÄhmaá¹‡a*', he would be speaking correctly, and would not be subject to falsehood?" "No, Gotama, it is not." For morality (*sÄ«la*) purifies wisdom (*paÃ±Ã±Ä*), Gotama, and wisdom (*paÃ±Ã±Ä*) purifies morality (*sÄ«la*). Where there is morality (*sÄ«la*), there is wisdom (*paÃ±Ã±Ä*); where there is wisdom (*paÃ±Ã±Ä*), there is morality (*sÄ«la*). The moral man has wisdom (*paÃ±Ã±Ä*), and the wise man has morality (*sÄ«la*). And the combination of morality (*sÄ«la*) and wisdom (*paÃ±Ã±Ä*) is called the highest thing in the world. Just as, Gotama, one hand might wash the other, or one foot the other, even so, Gotama, morality (*sÄ«la*) purifies wisdom (*paÃ±Ã±Ä*), Wisdom is purified by morality. Where there is morality, there is wisdom; where there is wisdom, there is morality. The moral man has wisdom, and the wise man has morality. And the combination of morality and wisdom is called the highest thing in the world. â€˜So it is, Brahmin. So it is, Brahmin. Morality, Brahmin, is purified by wisdom, and wisdom is purified by morality. Where there is morality, there is wisdom; where there is wisdom, there is morality. The moral man has wisdom, and the wise man has morality. And the combination of morality and wisdom is called the highest thing in the world. Just as, Brahmin, one hand washes the other, or one foot the other, so too, Brahmin, morality is purified by wisdom, and wisdom is purified by morality. Where there is morality, there is wisdom; where there is wisdom, there is morality. The moral man has wisdom, and the wise man has morality. And the combination of morality and wisdom is called the highest thing in the world.

â€œBut what is that morality, Brahmin? What is that wisdom?â€ â€œWe have reached the limit of our understanding in this matter, venerable Gotama. It would be well if the Reverend Gotama were to explain the meaning of this.â€™ â€˜Then listen, Brahmin, pay proper attention, and I will tell you.â€™ â€˜Yes, sirâ€™, said Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the Brahmin in reply to the Blessed One. The Blessed One said: â€œHere, Brahmin, a *TathÄgata* arises in the world, worthy and rightly self-awakenedâ€¦peâ€¦ (as in paragraphs 190-212, so it should be expanded in detail). Thus, Brahmin, a monk is perfected in morality. That, Brahmin, is morality...pe...he attains the first *jhÄna*, and dwells in it...pe...the second *jhÄna*...pe...the third *jhÄna*...pe...he attains the fourth *jhÄna*, and dwells in itâ€¦peâ€¦He directs and inclines his mind to the knowledge and vision. This too is for him in wisdomâ€¦peâ€¦ â€˜There is nothing further here,â€™ he understands. This too is for him in wisdom. This, Brahmin, is wisdom.â€ Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a's report of becoming a lay follower.
319. paÃ±Ã±Äparidhotaá¹ƒ sÄ«laá¹ƒ. yattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ tattha paÃ±Ã±Ä, yattha paÃ±Ã±Ä tattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lavato paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±avato sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lapaÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±ca pana lokasmiá¹ƒ aggamakkhÄyatÄ«"ti. "evametaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, evametaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, sÄ«laparidhotÄ hi, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±Äparidhotaá¹ƒ sÄ«laá¹ƒ. yattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ tattha paÃ±Ã±Ä, yattha paÃ±Ã±Ä tattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lavato paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±avato sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lapaÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±ca pana lokasmiá¹ƒ aggamakkhÄyati. seyyathÄpi, brÄhmaá¹‡a, hatthena vÄ hatthaá¹ƒ dhoveyya, pÄdena vÄ pÄdaá¹ƒ dhoveyya, evameva kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, sÄ«laparidhotÄ paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±Äparidhotaá¹ƒ sÄ«laá¹ƒ. yattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ tattha paÃ±Ã±Ä, yattha paÃ±Ã±Ä tattha sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lavato paÃ±Ã±Ä, paÃ±Ã±avato sÄ«laá¹ƒ. sÄ«lapaÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±ca pana lokasmiá¹ƒ aggamakkhÄyati. 318. "katamaá¹ƒ pana taá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, sÄ«laá¹ƒ? katamÄ sÄ paÃ±Ã±Ä"ti? "ettakaparamÄva mayaá¹ƒ, bho gotama, etasmiá¹ƒ atthe. sÄdhu vata bhavantaá¹ƒyeva gotamaá¹ƒ paá¹­ibhÄtu etassa bhÄsitassa attho"ti. "tena hi, brÄhmaá¹‡a, suá¹‡ohi, sÄdhukaá¹ƒ manasikarohi, bhÄsissÄmÄ«"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavato paccassosi. bhagavÄ etadavoca â€“ "idha, brÄhmaá¹‡a, tathÄgato loke uppajjati arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddhoâ€¦peâ€¦ (yathÄ 190-212 anucchedesu tathÄ vitthÄretabbaá¹ƒ). evaá¹ƒ kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, bhikkhu sÄ«lasampanno hoti. idaá¹ƒ kho taá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, sÄ«laá¹ƒâ€¦peâ€¦ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharatiâ€¦peâ€¦ dutiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒâ€¦peâ€¦ tatiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒâ€¦peâ€¦ catutthaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharatiâ€¦peâ€¦ Ã±Äá¹‡adassanÄya cittaá¹ƒ abhinÄ«harati, abhininnÄmeti. idampissa hoti paÃ±Ã±Äyaâ€¦peâ€¦ nÄparaá¹ƒ itthattÄyÄti pajÄnÄti, idampissa hoti paÃ±Ã±Äya ayaá¹ƒ kho sÄ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, paÃ±Ã±Ä"ti. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aupÄsakattapaá¹­ivedanÄ 319. evaá¹ƒ vutte, soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "abhikkantaá¹ƒ, bho gotama, abhikkantaá¹ƒ, bho gotama. seyyathÄpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaá¹ƒ vÄ ukkujjeyya, paá¹­icchannaá¹ƒ vÄ vivareyya, mÅ«á¸·hassa vÄ maggaá¹ƒ Äcikkheyya, andhakÄre vÄ telapajjotaá¹ƒ dhÄreyya, â€˜cakkhumanto rÅ«pÄni dakkhantÄ«â€™ti, evamevaá¹ƒ bhotÄ gotamena anekapariyÄyena dhammo pakÄsito. esÄhaá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ gacchÄmi, dhammaÃ±ca, bhikkhusaá¹…ghaÃ±ca. upÄsakaá¹ƒ maá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo dhÄretu ajjatagge pÄá¹‡upetaá¹ƒ saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ
When this was said, Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a the Brahmin said this to the Blessed One: "Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent, Master Gotama! Master Gotama has made the *Dhamma* clear in many ways, as though he were turning upright what had been overthrown, revealing what was hidden, showing the way to one who was lost; or holding up a lamp in the dark for those with eyesight to see forms. And I go for refuge to the Blessed Gotama, to the *Dhamma* and to the *Saá¹…gha* of monks. May the Venerable Gotama accept me as a lay follower who has taken refuge from this day onwards, as long as life shall last." Morality is [now] covered. And may the Reverend Gotama accept tomorrowâ€™s meal from me together with the *saá¹ƒgha* of *bhikkhus*. The Fortunate One consented by maintaining silence. Then *Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a* the *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, knowing that the Blessed One had consented, rose from his seat, paid homage to the Blessed One, circumambulated him keeping him on his right side and departed. Then *Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a* the *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, as the night was ending, had exquisite staple and non-staple food prepared in his own residence, and had the time announced to the Blessed One: â€œItâ€™s time, good Gotama. The meal is ready.â€ Then the Blessed One, having dressed in the early morning and taking his bowl and outer robe, went with the *saá¹ƒgha* of *bhikkhus* to the residence of *Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a* the *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, and sat down on the seat made ready. Then *Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a* the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* personally served the *saá¹ƒgha* of *bhikkhus* headed by the Buddha with choice staple and non-staple food until they were contented and satisfied. Then *Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a* the *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, when the Lord had eaten and had removed his hand from his bowl, took a low seat and sat down to one side. Having sat down to one side, *Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a* the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* said this to the Blessed One: "If I, good Gotama, were in an assembly and were to rise from my seat and salute the Reverend Gotama, that assembly would despise me. And if that assembly were to despise me, my reputation would suffer. And if my reputation were to suffer, my income would suffer as well. Our income depends on the gaining of a reputation. And if I, good Gotama, were in an assembly and were to join my palms in greeting, may the Reverend Gotama take it as if I had risen from my seat. And if I, good Gotama, were in an assembly and were to take off my turban, may you take it as if I had bowed my head. And if I, good Gotama, when riding in my carriage, were to alight from the carriage to salute the Reverend Gotama, that assembly would despise me. And if that assembly were to despise me, my reputation would suffer, and if my reputation were to suffer, my income would suffer as well. Our income depends on the gaining of a reputation. And if I, good Gotama, when riding in my carriage, were to raise my goad, may the Reverend Gotama take it as if I had alighted from my carriage. And if I, good Gotama, when riding in my carriage, were to lower my parasol, may the Reverend Gotama take it as if I had bowed my head.â€ Then the Lord, having instructed *Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸a* the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* with a talk on *dhamma*, inspired him, fired him with enthusiasm and delighted him, rose from his seat and departed. The *Soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸asutta* is finished, the fourth.
320. gataá¹ƒ. adhivÄsetu ca me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 320. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ paá¹­iyÄdÄpetvÄ bhagavato kÄlaá¹ƒ ÄrocÄpesi â€“ "kÄlo, bho gotama, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. atha kho bhagavÄ pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena yena soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸assa brÄhmaá¹‡assa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ paÃ±Ã±atte Äsane nisÄ«di. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o buddhappamukhaá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghaá¹ƒ paá¹‡Ä«tena khÄdanÄ«yena bhojanÄ«yena sahatthÄ santappesi sampavÄresi. 321. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ bhuttÄviá¹ƒ onÄ«tapattapÄá¹‡iá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ nÄ«caá¹ƒ Äsanaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "ahaÃ±ceva kho pana, bho gotama, parisagato samÄno ÄsanÄ vuá¹­á¹­hahitvÄ bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ abhivÄdeyyaá¹ƒ, tena maá¹ƒ sÄ parisÄ paribhaveyya. yaá¹ƒ kho pana sÄ parisÄ paribhaveyya, yasopi tassa hÄyetha. yassa kho pana yaso hÄyetha, bhogÄpi tassa hÄyeyyuá¹ƒ. yasoladdhÄ kho panamhÄkaá¹ƒ bhogÄ. ahaÃ±ceva kho pana, bho 321. gataá¹ƒ. adhivÄsetu ca me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 320. atha kho soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸o brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ 322. ahaÃ±ceva kho pana, bho gotama, yÄnagato samÄno chattaá¹ƒ apanÄmeyyaá¹ƒ, sirasÄ me taá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo abhivÄdanaá¹ƒ dhÄretÅ«"ti. 322. atha kho bhagavÄ soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸aá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ dhammiyÄ kathÄya sandassetvÄ samÄdapetvÄ samuttejetvÄ sampahaá¹ƒsetvÄ uá¹­á¹­hÄyÄsanÄ pakkÄmÄ«ti. soá¹‡adaá¹‡á¸asuttaá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ catutthaá¹ƒ.
[Translation for paragraph 322]
323. 5. kÅ«á¹­adantasuttaá¹ƒ khÄá¹‡umatakabrÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ 323. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ nÄma magadhÄnaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡agÄmo tadavasari. tatra sudaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa mahÄyaÃ±Ã±o upakkhaá¹­o hoti. satta ca usabhasatÄni satta ca vacchatarasatÄni satta ca vacchatarÄ«satÄni satta ca ajasatÄni satta ca urabbhasatÄni thÅ«á¹‡Å«panÄ«tÄni honti yaÃ±Ã±atthÄya. 324. assosuá¹ƒ kho khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ anuppatto khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. 325. atha kho khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamanti.
Thus have I heard. On one occasion the Blessed One was travelling in Magadha with a large Saá¹…gha of monks, about five hundred in all. He arrived at a Brahmin village in Magadha called KhÄá¹‡umata. There the Blessed One stayed in the Ambalaá¹­á¹­hika park. At that time, the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta was living in KhÄá¹‡umata, a populous place, full of grass, timber, water and corn, which had been given to him by King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadha as a royal gift, with royal powers and as a sacred grant. At that time, KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin was planning a great sacrifice (mahÄyaÃ±Ã±o). Seven hundred bulls, seven hundred bullocks, seven hundred heifers, seven hundred he-goats, and seven hundred rams were all tied up to the sacrificial posts for the purpose of the sacrifice.
324. 5. kÅ«á¹­adantasuttaá¹ƒ khÄá¹‡umatakabrÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ 323. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ nÄma magadhÄnaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡agÄmo tadavasari. tatra sudaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa mahÄyaÃ±Ã±o upakkhaá¹­o hoti. satta ca usabhasatÄni satta ca vacchatarasatÄni satta ca vacchatarÄ«satÄni satta ca ajasatÄni satta ca urabbhasatÄni thÅ«á¹‡Å«panÄ«tÄni honti yaÃ±Ã±atthÄya. 324. assosuá¹ƒ kho khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ anuppatto khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. 325. atha kho khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamanti.
The Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata heard, "The ascetic Gotama, the son of the ÅšÄkyans, who went forth from the ÅšÄkya clan, is travelling in Magadha with a large Saá¹…gha of monks, about five hundred in all. He has arrived at KhÄá¹‡umata and is staying in the Ambalaá¹­á¹­hika park. And concerning that Venerable Gotama such a good reputation has spread, 'Indeed, the Blessed One is an **arahant**, a fully enlightened **Buddha**, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a **Sugata**, a knower of the worlds, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, an enlightened one, a Blessed One.' He makes known this world with its gods (**devas**), with **MÄras**, and with **BrahmÄs**, this generation with its ascetics (**Å›ramaá¹‡a**) and Brahmins (**brÄhmaá¹‡a**), its princes and people, having realized it by his own super-knowledge (**abhiÃ±Ã±Ä**). He teaches the **Dhamma**, which is lovely in its beginning, lovely in its middle, lovely in its ending, in the spirit and in the letter. He displays the fully perfect and purified holy life (**brahmacariya**). It is good to see such worthy **arahants**."
325. 5. kÅ«á¹­adantasuttaá¹ƒ khÄá¹‡umatakabrÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ 323. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ nÄma magadhÄnaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡agÄmo tadavasari. tatra sudaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa mahÄyaÃ±Ã±o upakkhaá¹­o hoti. satta ca usabhasatÄni satta ca vacchatarasatÄni satta ca vacchatarÄ«satÄni satta ca ajasatÄni satta ca urabbhasatÄni thÅ«á¹‡Å«panÄ«tÄni honti yaÃ±Ã±atthÄya. 324. assosuá¹ƒ kho khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ anuppatto khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. 325. atha kho khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamanti.
Then the Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata, leaving KhÄá¹‡umata in groups, went to the Ambalaá¹­á¹­hika park.
326. 326. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o uparipÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ƒ upagato hoti. addasÄ kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamante. disvÄ khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "kiá¹ƒ nu kho, bho khatte, khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti. 327. "atthi kho, bho, samaá¹‡o gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ anuppatto, khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. tamete bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti. 328. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa etadahosi â€“ "sutaá¹ƒ kho pana metaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜samaá¹‡o gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ jÄnÄtÄ«â€™ti. na kho panÄhaá¹ƒ jÄnÄmi tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ. icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ puccheyya"nti. 329. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "tena hi, bho khatte, yena khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kama. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike evaá¹ƒ vadehi â€“ â€˜kÅ«á¹­adanto, bho, brÄhmaá¹‡o evamÄha â€“ "Ägamentu kira bhavanto, kÅ«á¹­adantopi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"â€™ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so khattÄ kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kami. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike etadavoca â€“ "kÅ«á¹­adanto, bho, brÄhmaá¹‡o evamÄha â€“ â€˜Ägamentu kira bhonto, kÅ«á¹­adantopi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"â€™ti.
At that time, KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin had gone up to his palace for his midday rest. KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin saw the Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata leaving KhÄá¹‡umata in groups and heading towards the Ambalaá¹­á¹­hika park. Seeing them, he called his steward and asked, "Why are the Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata leaving KhÄá¹‡umata in groups and heading towards the Ambalaá¹­á¹­hika park?"
327. 326. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o uparipÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ƒ upagato hoti. addasÄ kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamante. disvÄ khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "kiá¹ƒ nu kho, bho khatte, khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti. 327. "atthi kho, bho, samaá¹‡o gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ anuppatto, khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. tamete bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti. 328. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa etadahosi â€“ "sutaá¹ƒ kho pana metaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜samaá¹‡o gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ jÄnÄtÄ«â€™ti. na kho panÄhaá¹ƒ jÄnÄmi tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ. icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ puccheyya"nti. 329. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "tena hi, bho khatte, yena khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kama. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike evaá¹ƒ vadehi â€“ â€˜kÅ«á¹­adanto, bho, brÄhmaá¹‡o evamÄha â€“ "Ägamentu kira bhavanto, kÅ«á¹­adantopi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"â€™ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so khattÄ kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kami. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike etadavoca â€“ "kÅ«á¹­adanto, bho, brÄhmaá¹‡o evamÄha â€“ â€˜Ägamentu kira bhonto, kÅ«á¹­adantopi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"â€™ti.
"Sir, it is because the ascetic Gotama, the son of the ÅšÄkyans, who went forth from the ÅšÄkya clan, is travelling in Magadha with a large Saá¹…gha of monks, about five hundred in all. He has arrived at KhÄá¹‡umata and is staying in the Ambalaá¹­á¹­hika park. And concerning that Venerable Gotama such a good reputation has spread, 'Indeed, the Blessed One is an **arahant**, a fully enlightened **Buddha**, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a **Sugata**, a knower of the worlds, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, an enlightened one, a Blessed One.' They are going to see that Venerable Gotama."
328. 326. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o uparipÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ƒ upagato hoti. addasÄ kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamante. disvÄ khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "kiá¹ƒ nu kho, bho khatte, khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti. 327. Then KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin thought, "I have heard that the ascetic Gotama knows the threefold success of sacrifice with its sixteen requisites. But I do not know the threefold success of sacrifice with its sixteen requisites. And I want to perform a great sacrifice (mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a). Suppose I were to go to the ascetic Gotama and ask him about the threefold success of sacrifice with its sixteen requisites."
329. 326. tena kho pana samayena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o uparipÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ƒ upagato hoti. addasÄ kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamante. disvÄ khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "kiá¹ƒ nu kho, bho khatte, khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ khÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ« gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenupasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti. 327. "atthi kho, bho, samaá¹‡o gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ anuppatto, khÄá¹‡umate viharati ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹ƒ. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™ti. tamete bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamantÄ«"ti. 328. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa etadahosi â€“ "sutaá¹ƒ kho pana metaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜samaá¹‡o gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ jÄnÄtÄ«â€™ti. na kho panÄhaá¹ƒ jÄnÄmi tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ. icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ puccheyya"nti. 329. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khattaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "tena hi, bho khatte, yena khÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kama. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ khÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike evaá¹ƒ vadehi â€“ â€˜kÅ«á¹­adanto, bho, brÄhmaá¹‡o evamÄha â€“ "Ägamentu kira bhavanto, kÅ«á¹­adantopi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"â€™ti.
