Then KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin called his steward and said, "Go to the Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata. Having gone, tell the Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata, 'KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin says this: "Please wait, may you be well, KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin will also go to see the ascetic Gotama."'" "Yes, sir," the steward replied to KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin, and went to the Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata. Having gone, he told the Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata, "KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin says this: 'Please wait, may you be well, KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin will also go to see the ascetic Gotama.'" The Qualities of KÅ«á¹­adanta
330. kÅ«á¹­adantaguá¹‡akathÄ 330. tena kho pana samayena anekÄni brÄhmaá¹‡asatÄni khÄá¹‡umate paá¹­ivasanti â€“ "kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ anubhavissÄmÄ"ti. assosuá¹ƒ kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä â€“ "kÅ«á¹­adanto kira brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"ti. atha kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä yena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o tenupasaá¹…kamiá¹ƒsu. 331. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "saccaá¹ƒ kira bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"ti? "evaá¹ƒ kho me, bho, hoti â€“ â€˜ahampi samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ«"â€™ti. "mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kami. na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. sace bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissati, bhoto kÅ«á¹­adantassa yaso hÄyissati, samaá¹‡assa gotamassa yaso abhivaá¸á¸hissati. yampi bhoto kÅ«á¹­adantassa yaso hÄyissati, samaá¹‡assa gotamassa yaso abhivaá¸á¸hissati, iminÄpaá¹…gena na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. samaá¹‡o tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena. yampi bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, iminÄpaá¹…gena na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. samaá¹‡o tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajatoâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto ajjhÄyako mantadharo tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayoâ€¦peâ€¦
At that time, many hundreds of Brahmins were residing at KhÄá¹‡umata, thinking, "We will partake in the great sacrifice (mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ) of the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta." The Brahmins heard, "It is said that the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta will visit the renunciate (samaá¹‡a) Gotama to see him." Then the Brahmins went to where the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta was.
331. kÅ«á¹­adantaguá¹‡akathÄ 330. tena kho pana samayena anekÄni brÄhmaá¹‡asatÄni khÄá¹‡umate paá¹­ivasanti â€“ "kÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ anubhavissÄmÄ"ti. assosuá¹ƒ kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä â€“ "kÅ«á¹­adanto kira brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"ti. atha kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä yena kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o tenupasaá¹…kamiá¹ƒsu. 331. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "saccaá¹ƒ kira bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ«"ti? "evaá¹ƒ kho me, bho, hoti â€“ â€˜ahampi samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ«"â€™ti. "mÄ bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kami. na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. sace bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissati, bhoto kÅ«á¹­adantassa yaso hÄyissati, samaá¹‡assa gotamassa yaso abhivaá¸á¸hissati. yampi bhoto kÅ«á¹­adantassa yaso hÄyissati, samaá¹‡assa gotamassa yaso abhivaá¸á¸hissati, iminÄpaá¹…gena na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. samaá¹‡o tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena. yampi bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, iminÄpaá¹…gena na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. samaá¹‡o tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajatoâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto ajjhÄyako mantadharo tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayoâ€¦peâ€¦
Having approached, they said this to the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta: "Is it true that you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, will visit the renunciate Gotama to see him?" "Yes, indeed, gentlemen, it occurs to me, â€˜I, too, shall visit the renunciate Gotama to see him.â€™" "Revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, do not visit the renunciate Gotama. It is not fitting that you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, should visit the renunciate Gotama to see him. If you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, visit the renunciate Gotama to see him, your, KÅ«á¹­adanta's, glory will diminish, and the glory of the renunciate Gotama will increase. Moreover, because your, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta's, glory will diminish, and the glory of the renunciate Gotama will increase, it is not fitting that you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, should visit the renunciate Gotama to see him. The renunciate Gotama, indeed, is the one who should visit you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, to see you. "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are well-born on both sides, from the mother and from the father, of pure lineage (saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko) back to the seventh generation of ancestors, unblemished and irreproachable in regard to birth (jÄtivÄdena). Moreover, because you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are well-born on both sides, from the mother and from the father, of pure lineage back to the seventh generation of ancestors, unblemished and irreproachable in regard to birth, it is not fitting that you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, should visit the renunciate Gotama to see him. The renunciate Gotama, indeed, is the one who should visit you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, to see you. "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are rich, with great wealth, with great possessions, having abundant resources and equipment, abundant gold and silverâ€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are a reciter (ajjhÄyaka), a possessor of mantras (mantadharo), one who has gone to the further shore of the three Vedas (tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ«), with their vocabularies (sanighaá¹‡á¸u), etymologies (keá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ), phonology (sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ), and fifthly, the traditions (itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ), a master of verses (padako), skilled in grammar (veyyÄkaraá¹‡o), not deficient in worldly (lokÄyata) marks of a great man (mahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu)â€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are handsome (abhirÅ«po), pleasing to see (dassanÄ«yo), inspiring confidence (pÄsÄdiko), possessing the highest beauty of complexion (paramÄya vaá¹‡á¹‡apokkharatÄya), with the color of BrahmÄ (brahmavaá¹‡á¹‡Ä«), with the glory of BrahmÄ (brahmavacchasÄ«), with no hidden parts to your body (akhuddÄvakÄso) for seeingâ€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are virtuous (sÄ«lavÄ), with developed virtue (vuddhasÄ«lÄ«), endowed with developed virtueâ€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, have auspicious speech (kalyÄá¹‡avÄco), with auspicious delivery of speech (kalyÄá¹‡avÄkkaraá¹‡o), endowed with refined speech (poriyÄ vÄcÄya), articulate (vissaá¹­á¹­hÄya), without stammering (anelagalÄya), capable of making known the meaning (atthassa viÃ±Ã±ÄpaniyÄ)â€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are the teacher of many teachers (ÄcariyapÄcariyo), you teach the mantras to three hundred young students (mÄá¹‡avakasatÄni), and many young students from various regions and various districts come into the presence of you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, desiring the meaning of the mantras, desiring to study the mantrasâ€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are aged (jiá¹‡á¹‡o), old (vuddho), advanced in years (mahallako), far gone in life (addhagato), reached old age (vayoanuppatto). The renunciate Gotama is young (taruá¹‡o), newly gone forth (taruá¹‡apabbajito)â€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are honored (sakkato), respected (garukato), esteemed (mÄnito), venerated (pÅ«jito), and worshipped (apacito) by King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadha (mÄgadhassa)â€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, are honored, respected, esteemed, venerated, and worshipped by the Brahmin PokkharasÄtiâ€¦ "For you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, reside at KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ, which is populous (sattussadaá¹ƒ), with grass, timber, water, and grain (sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ), a royal estate (rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ), given by King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadha, a royal grant, a gift of BrahmÄ (brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ). Because you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, reside at KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ, which is populous, with grass, timber, water, and grain, a royal estate, given by King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadha, a royal grant, a gift of BrahmÄ, it is not fitting that you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, should visit the renunciate Gotama to see him. The renunciate Gotama, indeed, is the one who should visit you, revered KÅ«á¹­adanta, to see you." The Qualities of Buddha
332. "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto abhirÅ«po dassanÄ«yo pÄsÄdiko paramÄya vaá¹‡á¹‡apokkharatÄya samannÄgato brahmavaá¹‡á¹‡Ä« brahmavacchasÄ« akhuddÄvakÄso dassanÄyaâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto sÄ«lavÄ vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgatoâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto kalyÄá¹‡avÄco kalyÄá¹‡avÄkkaraá¹‡o poriyÄ vÄcÄya samannÄgato vissaá¹­á¹­hÄya anelagalÄya atthassa viÃ±Ã±ÄpaniyÄâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto bahÅ«naá¹ƒ ÄcariyapÄcariyo tÄ«á¹‡i mÄá¹‡avakasatÄni mante vÄceti, bahÅ« kho pana nÄnÄdisÄ nÄnÄjanapadÄ mÄá¹‡avakÄ Ägacchanti bhoto kÅ«á¹­adantassa santike mantatthikÄ mante adhiyitukÄmÄâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto jiá¹‡á¹‡o vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto. samaá¹‡o gotamo taruá¹‡o ceva taruá¹‡apabbajito caâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto raÃ±Ã±o mÄgadhassa seniyassa bimbisÄrassa sakkato garukato mÄnito pÅ«jito apacitoâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡assa pokkharasÄtissa sakkato garukato mÄnito pÅ«jito apacitoâ€¦peâ€¦ "bhavaÃ±hi kÅ«á¹­adanto khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. yampi bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto khÄá¹‡umataá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ, raÃ±Ã±Ä mÄgadhena seniyena bimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ, iminÄpaá¹…gena na arahati bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ. samaá¹‡otveva gotamo arahati bhavantaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamitu"nti. buddhaguá¹‡akathÄ 332. evaá¹ƒ vutte kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o te brÄhmaá¹‡e etadavoca â€“
Having been spoken to thus, the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta said this to the Brahmins:
333. 333. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "yathÄ kho bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡assa gotamassa vaá¹‡á¹‡e bhÄsati, ito cepi so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo yojanasate viharati, alameva saddhena kulaputtena dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ api puá¹­osenÄ"ti. "tena hi, bho, sabbeva mayaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ"ti. mahÄvijitarÄjayaÃ±Ã±akathÄ 334. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ƒ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. khÄá¹‡umatakÄpi kho brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ appekacce bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodiá¹ƒsu, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce yena bhagavÄ tenaÃ±jaliá¹ƒ paá¹‡ÄmetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce nÄmagottaá¹ƒ sÄvetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÅ«tÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu. 335. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "sutaá¹ƒ metaá¹ƒ, bho gotama â€“ â€˜samaá¹‡o gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ jÄnÄtÄ«â€™ti. na kho panÄhaá¹ƒ jÄnÄmi tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ. icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. sÄdhu me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ desetÅ«"ti. 336. "tena hi, brÄhmaá¹‡a, suá¹‡Ähi sÄdhukaá¹ƒ manasikarohi, bhÄsissÄmÄ«"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavato paccassosi. bhagavÄ etadavoca â€“ "bhÅ«tapubbaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito nÄma ahosi aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajato pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tadhanadhaÃ±Ã±o paripuá¹‡á¹‡akosakoá¹­á¹­hÄgÄro. atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa rahogatassa paá¹­isallÄ«nassa evaá¹ƒ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi â€“ â€˜adhigatÄ kho me vipulÄ mÄnusakÄ bhogÄ, mahantaá¹ƒ pathavimaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ abhivijiya
When this was said, the Brahmins spoke thus to the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta: â€œSir, since the esteemed KÅ«á¹­adanta speaks in praise of the ascetic Gotama (Gautama), even if that esteemed Gotama were dwelling a hundred *yojanas* away from here, it would be worthwhile for a faithful clansman to go to see him, even with a shoulder-bag.â€ â€œThen, sir, let us all go to see the ascetic Gotama.â€ The Story of King MahÄvijita's Great Sacrifice
334. 333. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "yathÄ kho bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡assa gotamassa vaá¹‡á¹‡e bhÄsati, ito cepi so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo yojanasate viharati, alameva saddhena kulaputtena dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ api puá¹­osenÄ"ti. "tena hi, bho, sabbeva mayaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ"ti. mahÄvijitarÄjayaÃ±Ã±akathÄ 334. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ƒ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. khÄá¹‡umatakÄpi kho brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ appekacce bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodiá¹ƒsu, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce yena bhagavÄ tenaÃ±jaliá¹ƒ paá¹‡ÄmetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce nÄmagottaá¹ƒ sÄvetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÅ«tÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu. 335. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "sutaá¹ƒ metaá¹ƒ, bho gotama â€“ â€˜samaá¹‡o gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ jÄnÄtÄ«â€™ti. na kho panÄhaá¹ƒ jÄnÄmi tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ. icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. sÄdhu me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ desetÅ«"ti. 336. "tena hi, brÄhmaá¹‡a, suá¹‡Ähi sÄdhukaá¹ƒ manasikarohi, bhÄsissÄmÄ«"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavato paccassosi. bhagavÄ etadavoca â€“ "bhÅ«tapubbaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito nÄma ahosi aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajato pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tadhanadhaÃ±Ã±o paripuá¹‡á¹‡akosakoá¹­á¹­hÄgÄro. atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa rahogatassa paá¹­isallÄ«nassa evaá¹ƒ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi â€“ â€˜adhigatÄ kho me vipulÄ mÄnusakÄ bhogÄ, mahantaá¹ƒ pathavimaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ abhivijiya
Then the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta, together with a large group of Brahmins, approached Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ, where the Blessed One (BhagavÄ) was; having approached, he exchanged greetings with the Blessed One. Having concluded their exchange of courteous and amiable talk, he sat down at one side. Some of the Brahmins and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata also, having greeted the Blessed One, sat down at one side; some exchanged greetings with the Blessed One, and having concluded their exchange of courteous and amiable talk, sat down at one side; some, raising their hands in reverential salutation towards the Blessed One, sat down at one side; some, announcing their name and clan, sat down at one side; some sat down at one side in silence.
335. 333. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "yathÄ kho bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡assa gotamassa vaá¹‡á¹‡e bhÄsati, ito cepi so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo yojanasate viharati, alameva saddhena kulaputtena dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ api puá¹­osenÄ"ti. "tena hi, bho, sabbeva mayaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ"ti. mahÄvijitarÄjayaÃ±Ã±akathÄ 334. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ƒ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. khÄá¹‡umatakÄpi kho brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ appekacce bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodiá¹ƒsu, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce yena bhagavÄ tenaÃ±jaliá¹ƒ paá¹‡ÄmetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce nÄmagottaá¹ƒ sÄvetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÅ«tÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu. 335. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "sutaá¹ƒ metaá¹ƒ, bho gotama â€“ â€˜samaá¹‡o gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ jÄnÄtÄ«â€™ti. na kho panÄhaá¹ƒ jÄnÄmi tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ. icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. sÄdhu me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ desetÅ«"ti. 336. "tena hi, brÄhmaá¹‡a, suá¹‡Ähi sÄdhukaá¹ƒ manasikarohi, bhÄsissÄmÄ«"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavato paccassosi. bhagavÄ etadavoca â€“ "bhÅ«tapubbaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito nÄma ahosi aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajato pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tadhanadhaÃ±Ã±o paripuá¹‡á¹‡akosakoá¹­á¹­hÄgÄro. atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa rahogatassa paá¹­isallÄ«nassa evaá¹ƒ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi â€“ â€˜adhigatÄ kho me vipulÄ mÄnusakÄ bhogÄ, mahantaá¹ƒ pathavimaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ abhivijiya
Having sat down at one side, the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta said this to the Blessed One: â€œI have heard this, venerable Gotama, that Gotama the ascetic knows the threefold success of sacrifice (*tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ*) along with its sixteen requisites (*soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ*).â€ "However, I do not know the threefold success of sacrifice along with its sixteen requisites. I want to perform a great sacrifice (*mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ*). Venerable Gotama, may you explain to me the threefold success of sacrifice, along with its sixteen requisites."
336. 333. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "yathÄ kho bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡assa gotamassa vaá¹‡á¹‡e bhÄsati, ito cepi so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo yojanasate viharati, alameva saddhena kulaputtena dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹ƒ api puá¹­osenÄ"ti. "tena hi, bho, sabbeva mayaá¹ƒ samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ"ti. mahÄvijitarÄjayaÃ±Ã±akathÄ 334. atha kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ƒ yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. khÄá¹‡umatakÄpi kho brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ appekacce bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ƒ sammodiá¹ƒsu, sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce yena bhagavÄ tenaÃ±jaliá¹ƒ paá¹‡ÄmetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce nÄmagottaá¹ƒ sÄvetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu, appekacce tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÅ«tÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«diá¹ƒsu. 335. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "sutaá¹ƒ metaá¹ƒ, bho gotama â€“ â€˜samaá¹‡o gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ jÄnÄtÄ«â€™ti. na kho panÄhaá¹ƒ jÄnÄmi tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ. icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. sÄdhu me bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo tividhaá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ƒ soá¸·asaparikkhÄraá¹ƒ desetÅ«"ti. 336. "tena hi, brÄhmaá¹‡a, suá¹‡Ähi sÄdhukaá¹ƒ manasikarohi, bhÄsissÄmÄ«"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavato paccassosi. bhagavÄ etadavoca â€“ "bhÅ«tapubbaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito nÄma ahosi aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajato pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tadhanadhaÃ±Ã±o paripuá¹‡á¹‡akosakoá¹­á¹­hÄgÄro. atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa rahogatassa paá¹­isallÄ«nassa evaá¹ƒ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi â€“ â€˜adhigatÄ kho me vipulÄ mÄnusakÄ bhogÄ, mahantaá¹ƒ pathavimaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ abhivijiya
â€œThen, Brahmin, listen and pay close attention; I will speak.â€ â€œYes, sir,â€ replied the Brahmin KÅ«á¹­adanta to the Blessed One. The Blessed One said this: â€œIn the past, Brahmin, there was a king named MahÄvijita. He was rich, of great wealth, with abundant resources, plentiful gold and silver, plentiful possessions and equipment, plentiful wealth and grain, and full storehouses and granaries. Then, Brahmin, it occurred to King MahÄvijita, while alone in private retreat, â€˜I have obtained abundant human enjoyments; I dwell having conquered a great territory of the earth; I reside [here], and I should perform a great sacrifice (*mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a*) so that I may enjoy benefits and peace for a long time.â€™â€
337. ajjhÄvasÄmi, yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajeyyaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. 337. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito purohitaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄmantetvÄ etadavoca â€“ â€˜idha mayhaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rahogatassa paá¹­isallÄ«nassa evaá¹ƒ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi â€“ adhigatÄ kho me vipulÄ mÄnusakÄ bhogÄ, mahantaá¹ƒ pathavimaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ abhivijiya ajjhÄvasÄmi. yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajeyyaá¹ƒ yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. icchÄmahaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. anusÄsatu maá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄ"â€™ti. 338. "evaá¹ƒ vutte, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o rÄjÄnaá¹ƒ mahÄvijitaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜bhoto kho raÃ±Ã±o janapado sakaá¹‡á¹­ako sauppÄ«á¸·o, gÄmaghÄtÄpi dissanti, nigamaghÄtÄpi dissanti, nagaraghÄtÄpi dissanti, panthaduhanÄpi dissanti. bhavaá¹ƒ kho pana rÄjÄ evaá¹ƒ sakaá¹‡á¹­ake janapade sauppÄ«á¸·e balimuddhareyya, akiccakÄrÄ« assa tena bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ. siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o evamassa â€“ "ahametaá¹ƒ dassukhÄ«laá¹ƒ vadhena vÄ bandhena vÄ jÄniyÄ vÄ garahÄya vÄ pabbÄjanÄya vÄ samÅ«hanissÄmÄ«"ti, na kho panetassa dassukhÄ«lassa evaá¹ƒ sammÄ samugghÄto hoti. ye te hatÄvasesakÄ bhavissanti, te pacchÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ƒ viheá¹­hessanti. api ca kho idaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒvidhÄnaá¹ƒ Ägamma evametassa dassukhÄ«lassa sammÄ samugghÄto hoti. tena hi bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti kasigorakkhe, tesaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ bÄ«jabhattaá¹ƒ anuppadetu. ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti vÄá¹‡ijjÄya, tesaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ pÄbhataá¹ƒ anuppadetu. ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti rÄjaporise, tesaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ bhattavetanaá¹ƒ pakappetu. te ca manussÄ sakammapasutÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ƒ na viheá¹­hessanti, mahÄ ca raÃ±Ã±o rÄsiko bhavissati. khemaá¹­á¹­hitÄ janapadÄ akaá¹‡á¹­akÄ anuppÄ«á¸·Ä. manussÄ mudÄ modamÄnÄ ure putte naccentÄ apÄrutagharÄ maÃ±Ã±e viharissantÄ«â€™ti. â€˜evaá¹ƒ, bhoâ€™ti kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito purohitassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ ye raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahiá¹ƒsu kasigorakkhe, tesaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ mahÄvijito bÄ«jabhattaá¹ƒ anuppadÄsi.
"Then, brahmin, King MahÄvijita addressed the chaplain brahmin and said: â€˜Here, brahmin, when I was alone, in seclusion, this thought arose in my mind: "I have acquired extensive human riches, and having conquered a large territory, I reside [here]. I should perform a great sacrifice (*mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a*) so that I may enjoy benefits and peace for a long time." I wish to make a great sacrifice (*mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a*). Instruct me, reverend sir, how this may be done to my lasting benefit and happiness.â€™"
338. ajjhÄvasÄmi, yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajeyyaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. 337. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito purohitaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄmantetvÄ etadavoca â€“ â€˜idha mayhaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rahogatassa paá¹­isallÄ«nassa evaá¹ƒ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi â€“ adhigatÄ kho me vipulÄ mÄnusakÄ bhogÄ, mahantaá¹ƒ pathavimaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ƒ abhivijiya ajjhÄvasÄmi. yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajeyyaá¹ƒ yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. icchÄmahaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. anusÄsatu maá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄ"â€™ti. 338. "evaá¹ƒ vutte, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o rÄjÄnaá¹ƒ mahÄvijitaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜bhoto kho raÃ±Ã±o janapado sakaá¹‡á¹­ako sauppÄ«á¸·o, gÄmaghÄtÄpi dissanti, nigamaghÄtÄpi dissanti, nagaraghÄtÄpi dissanti, panthaduhanÄpi dissanti. bhavaá¹ƒ kho pana rÄjÄ evaá¹ƒ sakaá¹‡á¹­ake janapade sauppÄ«á¸·e balimuddhareyya, akiccakÄrÄ« assa tena bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ. siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o evamassa â€“ "ahametaá¹ƒ dassukhÄ«laá¹ƒ vadhena vÄ bandhena vÄ jÄniyÄ vÄ garahÄya vÄ pabbÄjanÄya vÄ samÅ«hanissÄmÄ«"ti, na kho panetassa dassukhÄ«lassa evaá¹ƒ sammÄ samugghÄto hoti. ye te hatÄvasesakÄ bhavissanti, te pacchÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ƒ viheá¹­hessanti. api ca kho idaá¹ƒ saá¹ƒvidhÄnaá¹ƒ Ägamma evametassa dassukhÄ«lassa sammÄ samugghÄto hoti. tena hi bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti kasigorakkhe, tesaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ bÄ«jabhattaá¹ƒ anuppadetu. ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti vÄá¹‡ijjÄya, tesaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ pÄbhataá¹ƒ anuppadetu. ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti rÄjaporise, tesaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ bhattavetanaá¹ƒ pakappetu. te ca manussÄ sakammapasutÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ƒ na viheá¹­hessanti, mahÄ ca raÃ±Ã±o rÄsiko bhavissati. khemaá¹­á¹­hitÄ janapadÄ akaá¹‡á¹­akÄ anuppÄ«á¸·Ä. manussÄ mudÄ modamÄnÄ ure putte naccentÄ apÄrutagharÄ maÃ±Ã±e viharissantÄ«â€™ti. â€˜evaá¹ƒ, bhoâ€™ti kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito purohitassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ ye raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahiá¹ƒsu kasigorakkhe, tesaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ mahÄvijito bÄ«jabhattaá¹ƒ anuppadÄsi.
"When this was said, brahmin, the chaplain brahmin said to King MahÄvijita: â€˜Your Majestyâ€™s realm is beset by thieves and is being ravaged; villages are being destroyed, towns are being destroyed, cities are being destroyed, and highway robbery is rife. If Your Majesty were to levy taxes in such a troubled and dangerous realm, Your Majesty would be acting wrongly. Your Majesty might think: "I will eliminate this scourge of robbers by execution, imprisonment, confiscation, threats, or banishment," but that is not the way to truly end this plague of robbers. Those who survive will later harm Your Majestyâ€™s realm. However, if this plan is implemented, this plague of robbers can be truly eliminated. Therefore, Your Majesty should provide seeds and food to those in Your Majestyâ€™s realm who are engaged in farming and cattle-raising. Your Majesty should provide capital to those in Your Majestyâ€™s realm who are engaged in trade. Your Majesty should fix proper wages and food for those in Your Majestyâ€™s realm who are in government service. Then these people, being engaged in their own occupations, will not harm Your Majestyâ€™s realm, and Your Majestyâ€™s revenues will be greatly increased. The land will be peaceful, free from thorns, and unthreatened. The people will be joyous and happy, dancing with their children in their arms, and I believe they will live in open houses.â€™ 'Yes, sir,' replied King MahÄvijita to the chaplain brahmin, and he promised, and King MahÄvijita provided seeds and food to those in the kingdom who were diligent in farming and cattle raising. And those in the kingâ€™s country who were eager for trade, to them King MahÄvijita gave gifts. And those in the kingâ€™s country who were eager as royal servants, to them King MahÄvijita assigned food and wages. And those people, intent on their own occupations, did not harm the kingdom, and the kingâ€™s revenue was great. The land was tranquil, without trouble, without oppression. The people, with joy in their hearts, played with their children and lived in houses with open doors. Then, the brÄhmin, King MahÄvijita summoned the chaplain ( *purohita* ) who was a *brÄhmin*, and said this: â€œThe plague of robbers has been eradicated by you, and following your plan, my revenue has grown.â€ The land is tranquil and not beset by thieves, and the people with joy in their hearts play with their children and dwell in open houses. â€œNow I wish to make a great sacrifice ( *mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a* ), brÄhmin." "Instruct me, Reverend Sir, as to how this may be to my lasting benefit and happiness.â€ Four requisites.
339. ye ca raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahiá¹ƒsu vÄá¹‡ijjÄya, tesaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ mahÄvijito pÄbhataá¹ƒ anuppadÄsi. ye ca raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahiá¹ƒsu rÄjaporise, tesaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ mahÄvijito bhattavetanaá¹ƒ pakappesi. te ca manussÄ sakammapasutÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ƒ na viheá¹­hiá¹ƒsu, mahÄ ca raÃ±Ã±o rÄsiko ahosi. khemaá¹­á¹­hitÄ janapadÄ akaá¹‡á¹­akÄ anuppÄ«á¸·Ä manussÄ mudÄ modamÄnÄ ure putte naccentÄ apÄrutagharÄ maÃ±Ã±e vihariá¹ƒsu. atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito purohitaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄmantetvÄ etadavoca â€“ â€˜samÅ«hato kho me bhoto dassukhÄ«lo, bhoto saá¹ƒvidhÄnaá¹ƒ Ägamma mahÄ ca me rÄsiko. khemaá¹­á¹­hitÄ janapadÄ akaá¹‡á¹­akÄ anuppÄ«á¸·Ä manussÄ mudÄ modamÄnÄ ure putte naccentÄ apÄrutagharÄ maÃ±Ã±e viharanti. icchÄmahaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡a mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. anusÄsatu maá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. catuparikkhÄraá¹ƒ 339. "tena hi bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade khattiyÄ ÄnuyantÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca te bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ Ämantayataá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜icchÄmahaá¹ƒ, bho, mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ, anujÄnantu me bhavanto yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade amaccÄ pÄrisajjÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ caâ€¦peâ€¦ brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ caâ€¦peâ€¦ gahapatinecayikÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, te bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ Ämantayataá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜icchÄmahaá¹ƒ, bho, mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ, anujÄnantu me bhavanto yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. â€˜evaá¹ƒ, bhoâ€™ti kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito purohitassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ ye raÃ±Ã±o janapade khattiyÄ ÄnuyantÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, te rÄjÄ mahÄvijito Ämantesi â€“ â€˜icchÄmahaá¹ƒ, bho, mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ, anujÄnantu me bhavanto yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄ"ti. â€˜yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ, yaÃ±Ã±akÄlo mahÄrÄjÄâ€™ti. ye raÃ±Ã±o janapade amaccÄ pÄrisajjÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ caâ€¦peâ€¦ brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ caâ€¦peâ€¦ gahapatinecayikÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, te rÄjÄ mahÄvijito Ämantesi â€“ â€˜icchÄmahaá¹ƒ,
â€œThen, Your Majesty the king, you should summon those Ká¹£atriyas in your country who are followers, the townsfolk ( *negama* ) and the country-folk (*jÄnapada*), and say to them, â€˜I wish to make a great sacrifice ( *mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a* ), sirs, assist me in this, gentlemen, that it may be to my lasting benefit and happiness.â€™â€ "Summon your advisors (*amaccÄ*) and counselors (*pÄrisajjÄ*), the townsfolk (*negamÄ*) and the country-folk (*jÄnapadÄ*)â€¦peâ€¦the influential Brahmins ( *brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ* ) and the townsfolk (*negamÄ*) and the country-folk (*jÄnapadÄ*)â€¦peâ€¦the wealthy householders (*gahapatinecayikÄ*) and the townsfolk ( *negamÄ* ) and the country-folk (*jÄnapadÄ*), and say to them, â€˜I wish to make a great sacrifice ( *mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a* ), sirs, assist me in this, gentlemen, that it may be to my lasting benefit and happiness.â€™â€œ â€œ'Very well, sir,' said the *brÄhmin*. King MahÄvijita, having promised the chaplain ( *purohita* ) who was a *brÄhmin*, summoned those Ká¹£atriyas in his country who were followers, the townsfolk ( *negama* ) and the country-folk (*jÄnapada*), and said to them, â€˜I wish to make a great sacrifice ( *mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a* ), sirs, assist me in this, gentlemen, that it may be to my lasting benefit and happiness.â€™" â€œSire, let the sacrifice ( *yaÃ±Ã±a* ) begin, now is the time, Your Majesty.â€ "Summon your advisors (*amaccÄ*) and counselors (*pÄrisajjÄ*), the townsfolk (*negamÄ*) and the country-folk (*jÄnapadÄ*)â€¦peâ€¦the influential Brahmins ( *brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ* ) and the townsfolk (*negamÄ*) and the country-folk (*jÄnapadÄ*)â€¦peâ€¦the wealthy householders (*gahapatinecayikÄ*) and the townsfolk ( *negamÄ* ) and the country-folk (*jÄnapadÄ*)," King MahÄvijita said to them: â€œI wish to, sirs, perform a great sacrifice ( *mahÄyaÃ±Ã±a* ). Grant me permission, gentlemen, so that it may be for my lasting benefit and happiness.â€™â€ â€œSire, let the sacrifice ( *yaÃ±Ã±a* ) begin, now is the time, Your Majesty.â€ These four assenting groups will be the accessories for the sacrifice ( *yaÃ±Ã±a* ). Eight requisites.
340. bho, mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. anujÄnantu me bhavanto yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. â€˜yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ, yaÃ±Ã±akÄlo mahÄrÄjÄâ€™ti. itime cattÄro anumatipakkhÄ tasseva yaÃ±Ã±assa parikkhÄrÄ bhavanti. aá¹­á¹­ha parikkhÄrÄ 340. "rÄjÄ mahÄvijito aá¹­á¹­hahaá¹…gehi samannÄgato, ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena abhirÅ«po dassanÄ«yo pÄsÄdiko paramÄya vaá¹‡á¹‡apokkharatÄya samannÄgato brahmavaá¹‡á¹‡Ä« brahmavacchasÄ« akhuddÄvakÄso dassanÄya, aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajato pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tadhanadhaÃ±Ã±o paripuá¹‡á¹‡akosakoá¹­á¹­hÄgÄro, balavÄ caturaá¹…giniyÄ senÄya samannÄgato assavÄya ovÄdapaá¹­ikarÄya sahati [patapati (sÄ«. pÄ«.), tapati (syÄ.)] maÃ±Ã±e paccatthike yasasÄ, saddho dÄyako dÄnapati anÄvaá¹­advÄro samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡akapaá¹‡addhikavaá¹‡ibbakayÄcakÄnaá¹ƒ opÄnabhÅ«to puÃ±Ã±Äni karoti, bahussuto tassa tassa sutajÄtassa, tassa tasseva kho pana bhÄsitassa atthaá¹ƒ jÄnÄti â€˜ayaá¹ƒ imassa bhÄsitassa attho ayaá¹ƒ imassa bhÄsitassa atthoâ€™ti, paá¹‡á¸ito, viyatto, medhÄvÄ«, paá¹­ibalo, atÄ«tÄnÄgatapaccuppanne atthe cintetuá¹ƒ. rÄjÄ mahÄvijito imehi aá¹­á¹­hahaá¹…gehi samannÄgato. iti imÄnipi aá¹­á¹­haá¹…gÄni tasseva yaÃ±Ã±assa parikkhÄrÄ bhavanti. catuparikkhÄraá¹ƒ 341. "purohito [purohitopi (ka. sÄ«. ka.)] brÄhmaá¹‡o catuhaá¹…gehi samannÄgato. ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, ajjhÄyako mantadharo tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayo, sÄ«lavÄ vuddhasÄ«lÄ«
â€œKing MahÄvijita is endowed with eight things. He is well-born on both sides, from his mother and father, of pure conception back to the seventh generation of ancestors, irreproachable, blameless with regard to his caste, handsome, pleasing, inspiring confidence, possessed of the greatest beauty of complexion, of brahmin-like hue, with brahmin-like radiance, offering no small opportunity for viewing; rich, very wealthy, having great possessions, possessing abundant gold and silver, possessing abundant implements of wealth, possessing abundant riches and grain, possessing fully stocked storehouses and granaries; powerful, possessed of a four-divisioned army, obedient, responsive to advice, able to overcome, I think, enemies by his fame; faithful, a giver, a patron of gifts, with open door to ascetics, brahmins, the wretched, wayfarers, beggars, and supplicants, a well-spring of meritorious deeds, very learned, knowing the meaning of each and every saying that has come down to him, knowing, 'This is the meaning of this saying, this is the meaning of this saying,' wise, skilled, intelligent, capable, and able to reflect on past, future, and present matters.â€ King MahÄvijita is endowed with these eight things. These constitute the accessories for the sacrifice ( *yaÃ±Ã±a* ). Four requisites.
341. bho, mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajituá¹ƒ. anujÄnantu me bhavanto yaá¹ƒ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. â€˜yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ, yaÃ±Ã±akÄlo mahÄrÄjÄâ€™ti. itime cattÄro anumatipakkhÄ tasseva yaÃ±Ã±assa parikkhÄrÄ bhavanti. aá¹­á¹­ha parikkhÄrÄ 340. "rÄjÄ mahÄvijito aá¹­á¹­hahaá¹…gehi samannÄgato, ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena abhirÅ«po dassanÄ«yo pÄsÄdiko paramÄya vaá¹‡á¹‡apokkharatÄya samannÄgato brahmavaá¹‡á¹‡Ä« brahmavacchasÄ« akhuddÄvakÄso dassanÄya, aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajato pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tadhanadhaÃ±Ã±o paripuá¹‡á¹‡akosakoá¹­á¹­hÄgÄro, balavÄ caturaá¹…giniyÄ senÄya samannÄgato assavÄya ovÄdapaá¹­ikarÄya sahati [patapati (sÄ«. pÄ«.), tapati (syÄ.)] maÃ±Ã±e paccatthike yasasÄ, saddho dÄyako dÄnapati anÄvaá¹­advÄro samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡akapaá¹‡addhikavaá¹‡ibbakayÄcakÄnaá¹ƒ opÄnabhÅ«to puÃ±Ã±Äni karoti, bahussuto tassa tassa sutajÄtassa, tassa tasseva kho pana bhÄsitassa atthaá¹ƒ jÄnÄti â€˜ayaá¹ƒ imassa bhÄsitassa attho ayaá¹ƒ imassa bhÄsitassa atthoâ€™ti, paá¹‡á¸ito, viyatto, medhÄvÄ«, paá¹­ibalo, atÄ«tÄnÄgatapaccuppanne atthe cintetuá¹ƒ. rÄjÄ mahÄvijito imehi aá¹­á¹­hahaá¹…gehi samannÄgato. iti imÄnipi aá¹­á¹­haá¹…gÄni tasseva yaÃ±Ã±assa parikkhÄrÄ bhavanti. catuparikkhÄraá¹ƒ 341. "purohito [purohitopi (ka. sÄ«. ka.)] brÄhmaá¹‡o catuhaá¹…gehi samannÄgato. ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, ajjhÄyako mantadharo tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayo, sÄ«lavÄ vuddhasÄ«lÄ«
"The chaplain ( *purohita* ) who is a *brÄhmin* is endowed with four things. He is well-born on both sides, from his mother and father, of pure conception back to the seventh generation of ancestors, irreproachable, blameless with regard to his caste, learned, a master of mantras, a master of the three Vedas, one who has reached the other shore, with texts on phonology, etymology, ritual, and grammar, and as fifth, ancient lore; skilled in word and sentence, a grammarian, without defect in worldly wisdom and the marks of a great man, virtuous, of increasing virtue, endowed with increasing virtue, learned, accomplished, wise, and is the first or second to hold the sacrificial ladle. The *purohita* (chaplain), the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* (Brahmin), is endowed with these four qualities. Thus, these four elements constitute the accessories to that very sacrifice (*yajÃ±a*). Three modes.
342. vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito viyatto medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o imehi catÅ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgato. iti imÄni cattÄri aá¹…gÄni tasseva yaÃ±Ã±assa parikkhÄrÄ bhavanti. tisso vidhÄ 342. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa pubbeva yaÃ±Ã±Ä tisso vidhÄ desesi. siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yiá¹­á¹­hukÄmassa [yiá¹­á¹­hakÄmassa (ka.)] kocideva vippaá¹­isÄro â€“ â€˜mahÄ vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchissatÄ«â€™ti, so bhotÄ raÃ±Ã±Ä vippaá¹­isÄro na karaá¹‡Ä«yo. siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajamÄnassa kocideva vippaá¹­isÄro â€“ â€˜mahÄ vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchatÄ«â€™ti, so bhotÄ raÃ±Ã±Ä vippaá¹­isÄro na karaá¹‡Ä«yo. siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yiá¹­á¹­hassa kocideva vippaá¹­isÄro â€“ â€˜mahÄ vata me bhogakkhandho vigatoâ€™ti, so bhotÄ raÃ±Ã±Ä vippaá¹­isÄro na karaá¹‡Ä«yo"ti. imÄ kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa pubbeva yaÃ±Ã±Ä tisso vidhÄ desesi. dasa ÄkÄrÄ 343. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa pubbeva yaÃ±Ã±Ä dasahÄkÄrehi paá¹­iggÄhakesu vippaá¹­isÄraá¹ƒ paá¹­ivinesi. â€˜Ägamissanti kho bhoto yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtinopi pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­iviratÄpi. ye tattha pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtino, tesaÃ±Ã±eva tena. ye tattha pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­iviratÄ, te Ärabbha yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, cittameva bhavaá¹ƒ antaraá¹ƒ pasÄdetu. Ägamissanti kho bhoto yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ adinnÄdÄyinopi adinnÄdÄnÄ paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦peâ€¦ kÄmesu micchÄcÄrinopi kÄmesumicchÄcÄrÄ paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦ musÄvÄdinopi musÄvÄdÄ paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦ pisuá¹‡avÄcinopi pisuá¹‡Äya vÄcÄya paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦ pharusavÄcinopi pharusÄya vÄcÄya paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦ samphappalÄpinopi
"Then, Brahmin, the *purohita brÄhmaá¹‡a* (Brahmin chaplain) of King MahÄvijita taught the three modes prior to the sacrifice (*yajÃ±a*). It might be that Your Majesty might have some qualms about intending to perform the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*): â€˜I am going to lose a lot of wealth.â€™ Your Majesty should not have such qualms. It might be that Your Majesty who is performing the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*) might have some qualms: â€˜I am losing a lot of wealth.â€™ Your Majesty should not have such qualms. It might be that Your Majesty might have some qualms after performing the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*): â€˜I have lost a lot of wealth.â€™ Your Majesty should not have such qualms." These are the three modes that the *purohita brÄhmaá¹‡a* (Brahmin chaplain) of King MahÄvijita taught prior to the sacrifice (*yajÃ±a*). Ten aspects.
343. vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgato, paá¹‡á¸ito viyatto medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o imehi catÅ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgato. iti imÄni cattÄri aá¹…gÄni tasseva yaÃ±Ã±assa parikkhÄrÄ bhavanti. tisso vidhÄ 342. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa pubbeva yaÃ±Ã±Ä tisso vidhÄ desesi. siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yiá¹­á¹­hukÄmassa [yiá¹­á¹­hakÄmassa (ka.)] kocideva vippaá¹­isÄro â€“ â€˜mahÄ vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchissatÄ«â€™ti, so bhotÄ raÃ±Ã±Ä vippaá¹­isÄro na karaá¹‡Ä«yo. siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajamÄnassa kocideva vippaá¹­isÄro â€“ â€˜mahÄ vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchatÄ«â€™ti, so bhotÄ raÃ±Ã±Ä vippaá¹­isÄro na karaá¹‡Ä«yo. siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yiá¹­á¹­hassa kocideva vippaá¹­isÄro â€“ â€˜mahÄ vata me bhogakkhandho vigatoâ€™ti, so bhotÄ raÃ±Ã±Ä vippaá¹­isÄro na karaá¹‡Ä«yo"ti. imÄ kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa pubbeva yaÃ±Ã±Ä tisso vidhÄ desesi. dasa ÄkÄrÄ 343. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa pubbeva yaÃ±Ã±Ä dasahÄkÄrehi paá¹­iggÄhakesu vippaá¹­isÄraá¹ƒ paá¹­ivinesi. â€˜Ägamissanti kho bhoto yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtinopi pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­iviratÄpi. ye tattha pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtino, tesaÃ±Ã±eva tena. ye tattha pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­iviratÄ, te Ärabbha yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, cittameva bhavaá¹ƒ antaraá¹ƒ pasÄdetu. Ägamissanti kho bhoto yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ adinnÄdÄyinopi adinnÄdÄnÄ paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦peâ€¦ kÄmesu micchÄcÄrinopi kÄmesumicchÄcÄrÄ paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦ musÄvÄdinopi musÄvÄdÄ paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦ pisuá¹‡avÄcinopi pisuá¹‡Äya vÄcÄya paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦ pharusavÄcinopi pharusÄya vÄcÄya paá¹­iviratÄpiâ€¦ samphappalÄpinopi
"Then, Brahmin, the *purohita brÄhmaá¹‡a* (Brahmin chaplain) of King MahÄvijita dispelled the doubts about the recipients with ten aspects prior to the sacrifice (*yajÃ±a*). 'Those who kill living beings and those who abstain from killing living beings will come to Your Majesty's sacrifice (*yajÃ±a*). To those who kill living beings, it will turn out accordingly. But those who abstain from killing living beingsâ€”because of them, may Your Majesty have a successful sacrifice (*yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty rejoice (*sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty be glad (*modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty calm their hearts within (cittameva bhavaá¹ƒ antaraá¹ƒ pasÄdetu). Those who take what is not given and those who abstain from taking what is not givenâ€¦peâ€¦ those who commit misconduct in sensual pleasures and those who abstain from misconduct in sensual pleasuresâ€¦ those who speak falsehood and those who abstain from speaking falsehoodâ€¦ those who speak malicious words and those who abstain from speaking malicious wordsâ€¦ those who speak harsh words and those who abstain from speaking harsh wordsâ€¦ those who engage in idle chatter, and those who abstain from idle chatterâ€¦ those who are covetous and those who are not covetousâ€¦ those who have minds filled with ill-will and those who have minds without ill-willâ€¦ those who have wrong view and those who have right viewâ€¦. To those who have wrong view, it will turn out accordingly. But those who have right viewâ€”because of them, may Your Majesty have a successful sacrifice (*yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty rejoice (*sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty be glad (*modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty calm their hearts within." These are the ten aspects with which the *purohita brÄhmaá¹‡a* (Brahmin chaplain) of King MahÄvijita dispelled the qualms concerning the recipients prior to the sacrifice (*yajÃ±a*). Sixteen aspects.
344. samphappalÄpÄ paá¹­iviratÄpi â€¦ abhijjhÄlunopi anabhijjhÄlunopiâ€¦ byÄpannacittÄpi abyÄpannacittÄpiâ€¦ micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hikÄpi sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hikÄpiâ€¦. ye tattha micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hikÄ, tesaÃ±Ã±eva tena. ye tattha sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hikÄ, te Ärabbha yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, cittameva bhavaá¹ƒ antaraá¹ƒ pasÄdetÅ«â€™ti. imehi kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa pubbeva yaÃ±Ã±Ä dasahÄkÄrehi paá¹­iggÄhakesu vippaá¹­isÄraá¹ƒ paá¹­ivinesi. soá¸·asa ÄkÄrÄ 344. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajamÄnassa soá¸·asahÄkÄrehi cittaá¹ƒ sandassesi samÄdapesi samuttejesi sampahaá¹ƒsesi siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajamÄnassa kocideva vattÄ â€“ â€˜rÄjÄ kho mahÄvijito mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajati, no ca kho tassa ÄmantitÄ khattiyÄ ÄnuyantÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, atha ca pana bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ evarÅ«paá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajatÄ«â€™ti. evampi bhoto raÃ±Ã±o vattÄ dhammato natthi. bhotÄ kho pana raÃ±Ã±Ä ÄmantitÄ khattiyÄ ÄnuyantÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca. iminÄpetaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ jÄnÄtu, yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, cittameva bhavaá¹ƒ antaraá¹ƒ pasÄdetu. "siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajamÄnassa kocideva vattÄ â€“ â€˜rÄjÄ kho mahÄvijito mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajati, no ca kho tassa ÄmantitÄ amaccÄ pÄrisajjÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ caâ€¦peâ€¦ brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ caâ€¦peâ€¦ gahapatinecayikÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, atha ca pana bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ evarÅ«paá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajatÄ«â€™ti. evampi bhoto raÃ±Ã±o vattÄ dhammato natthi. bhotÄ kho pana raÃ±Ã±Ä ÄmantitÄ gahapatinecayikÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca. iminÄpetaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ jÄnÄtu, yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, cittameva bhavaá¹ƒ antaraá¹ƒ pasÄdetu. "siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajamÄnassa kocideva vattÄ â€“ â€˜rÄjÄ kho mahÄvijito mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajati, no ca kho
"Then, Brahmin, the *purohita brÄhmaá¹‡a* (Brahmin chaplain) of King MahÄvijita showed, instructed, encouraged, and gladdened the heart of King MahÄvijita who was performing the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*) with sixteen aspects. It may be that some speaker may say this of Your Majesty who is performing the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*): 'King MahÄvijita performs the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*), but the *khattiyas* (nobles) who follow him, the townspeople, and the country people have not been invited by him. But yet, this King performs such a great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*)!' Even so, such a speaker of Your Majesty would not be in accordance with the Dharma. For Your Majesty has invited the *khattiyas* (nobles) who follow him, the townspeople, and the country people. Knowing this, may Your Majesty have a successful sacrifice (*yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty rejoice (*sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty be glad (*modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty calm their hearts within. "It may be that some speaker may say this of Your Majesty who is performing the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*): â€˜King MahÄvijita performs the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*), but the ministers, the attendants, the townspeople, and the country people have not been invited by himâ€¦peâ€¦ the Brahmin millionaires, the townspeople, and the country people have not been invited by himâ€¦peâ€¦ the wealthy householders, the townspeople, and the country people have not been invited by him. But yet, this King performs such a great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*)!â€™ Even so, such a speaker of Your Majesty would not be in accordance with the Dharma. For Your Majesty has invited the wealthy householders, the townspeople, and the country people. Knowing this, may Your Majesty have a successful sacrifice (*yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty rejoice (*sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty be glad (*modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ*), may Your Majesty calm their hearts within. "It may be that some speaker may say this of Your Majesty who is performing the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*): 'King MahÄvijita performs the great sacrifice (*mahÄyajÃ±a*), but â€œOr he might say: â€˜Whereas some ascetics and Brahmins, while living on the food offered by the faithful, earn their living by a wrong means of livelihood, by such debased arts as: sending for, arranging marriages ( *vivÄhanaá¹ƒ*), betrothals (*saá¹ƒvaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ*) and divorces (*vivaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ*); bringing together, scattering, making people lucky (*subhagakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ*) or unlucky (*dubbhagakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ*); causing miscarriages (*viruddhagabbhakaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ*); using spells to bind the tongue (*jivhÄnibandhanaá¹ƒ*), paralyze the jaws (*hanusaá¹ƒhananaá¹ƒ*), making the hands jerk (*hatthÄbhijappanaá¹ƒ*), or to bring on deafness (*kaá¹‡á¹‡ajappanaá¹ƒ*); questioning a mirror (*ÄdÄsapaÃ±haá¹ƒ*), a girl-medium (*kumÄrikapaÃ±haá¹ƒ*), a *deva*; worshipping the sun (*Ädiccupaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ*) or Great Brahma (*mahatupaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ*), breathing fire (*abbhujjalanaá¹ƒ*), invoking the goddess of luck (*sirivhÄyanaá¹ƒ*)â€™â€” thus it is that the ascetic Gotama refrains from such base arts and wrong means of livelihood.â€™ Thus it is, monks, that an ordinary person, when speaking in praise of the *TathÄgata*, would speak."
345. saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena, atha ca pana bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ evarÅ«paá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajatÄ«â€™ti. evampi bhoto raÃ±Ã±o vattÄ dhammato natthi. bhoto kho pana raÃ±Ã±o purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o ubhato sujÄto mÄtito ca pitito ca saá¹ƒsuddhagahaá¹‡iko yÄva sattamÄ pitÄmahayugÄ akkhitto anupakkuá¹­á¹­ho jÄtivÄdena. iminÄpetaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ jÄnÄtu, yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, cittameva bhavaá¹ƒ antaraá¹ƒ pasÄdetu. "siyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajamÄnassa kocideva vattÄ â€“ â€˜rÄjÄ kho mahÄvijito mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajati. no ca khvassa purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o ajjhÄyako mantadharo tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ vedÄnaá¹ƒ pÄragÅ« sanighaá¹‡á¸ukeá¹­ubhÄnaá¹ƒ sÄkkharappabhedÄnaá¹ƒ itihÄsapaÃ±camÄnaá¹ƒ padako veyyÄkaraá¹‡o lokÄyatamahÄpurisalakkhaá¹‡esu anavayoâ€¦peâ€¦ no ca khvassa purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄ«lavÄ vuddhasÄ«lÄ« vuddhasÄ«lena samannÄgatoâ€¦peâ€¦ no ca khvassa purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o paá¹‡á¸ito viyatto medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ, atha ca pana bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ evarÅ«paá¹ƒ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajatÄ«â€™ti. evampi bhoto raÃ±Ã±o vattÄ dhammato natthi. bhoto kho pana raÃ±Ã±o purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o paá¹‡á¸ito viyatto medhÄvÄ« paá¹­hamo vÄ dutiyo vÄ sujaá¹ƒ paggaá¹‡hantÄnaá¹ƒ. iminÄpetaá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ rÄjÄ jÄnÄtu, yajataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, sajjataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, modataá¹ƒ bhavaá¹ƒ, cittameva bhavaá¹ƒ antaraá¹ƒ pasÄdetÅ«ti. imehi kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o raÃ±Ã±o mahÄvijitassa mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajamÄnassa soá¸·asahi ÄkÄrehi cittaá¹ƒ sandassesi samÄdapesi samuttejesi sampahaá¹ƒsesi. 345. "tasmiá¹ƒ kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, yaÃ±Ã±e neva gÄvo haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na ajeá¸·akÄ haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na kukkuá¹­asÅ«karÄ haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na vividhÄ pÄá¹‡Ä saá¹…ghÄtaá¹ƒ Äpajjiá¹ƒsu, na rukkhÄ chijjiá¹ƒsu yÅ«patthÄya, na dabbhÄ lÅ«yiá¹ƒsu barihisatthÄya [parihiá¹ƒsatthÄya (syÄ. ka. sÄ«. ka.), parahiá¹ƒsatthÄya (ka.)]. yepissa ahesuá¹ƒ dÄsÄti vÄ pessÄti vÄ kammakarÄti vÄ, tepi na daá¹‡á¸atajjitÄ
"In this sacrifice, *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, no cows were slain, no goats or sheep were slain, no cocks or pigs were slain, no various living beings were subjected to slaughter, no trees were cut down for sacrificial posts, and no *dÅ«rvÄ* grass was cut for the sacrificial bed [nor for harming (syÄ. ka. sÄ«. ka. ), nor for harming (ka.)]. And those who were his slaves, servants, or workers did not perform their tasks under fear of punishment. They did not perform their tasks for fear of blows or threats, weeping and in tears. But those who wanted to do something did it, those who did not wish to did not; they did what they wanted to do, and not what they did not want to do. And that sacrifice came to completion with clarified butter, oil, fresh butter, curds, honey, and molasses.
346. na bhayatajjitÄ na assumukhÄ rudamÄnÄ parikammÄni akaá¹ƒsu. atha kho ye icchiá¹ƒsu, te akaá¹ƒsu, ye na icchiá¹ƒsu, na te akaá¹ƒsu, yaá¹ƒ icchiá¹ƒsu, taá¹ƒ akaá¹ƒsu, yaá¹ƒ na icchiá¹ƒsu, na taá¹ƒ akaá¹ƒsu. sappitelanavanÄ«tadadhimadhuphÄá¹‡itena ceva so yaÃ±Ã±o niá¹­á¹­hÄnamagamÄsi. 346. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, khattiyÄ ÄnuyantÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, amaccÄ pÄrisajjÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, gahapatinecayikÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca pahÅ«taá¹ƒ sÄpateyyaá¹ƒ ÄdÄya rÄjÄnaá¹ƒ mahÄvijitaá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ evamÄhaá¹ƒsu â€“ â€˜idaá¹ƒ, deva, pahÅ«taá¹ƒ sÄpateyyaá¹ƒ devaÃ±Ã±eva uddissÄbhataá¹ƒ, taá¹ƒ devo paá¹­iggaá¹‡hÄtÅ«â€™ti. â€˜alaá¹ƒ, bho, mamÄpidaá¹ƒ pahÅ«taá¹ƒ sÄpateyyaá¹ƒ dhammikena balinÄ abhisaá¹…khataá¹ƒ, taÃ±ca vo hotu, ito ca bhiyyo harathÄâ€™ti. te raÃ±Ã±Ä paá¹­ikkhittÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ apakkamma evaá¹ƒ samacintesuá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜na kho etaá¹ƒ amhÄkaá¹ƒ patirÅ«paá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ mayaá¹ƒ imÄni sÄpateyyÄni punadeva sakÄni gharÄni paá¹­ihareyyÄma. rÄjÄ kho mahÄvijito mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajati, handassa mayaá¹ƒ anuyÄgino homÄâ€™ti. 347. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, puratthimena yaÃ±Ã±avÄá¹­assa [yaÃ±Ã±ÄvÄá¹­assa (sÄ«. pÄ«. ka.)] khattiyÄ ÄnuyantÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca dÄnÄni paá¹­á¹­hapesuá¹ƒ. dakkhiá¹‡ena yaÃ±Ã±avÄá¹­assa amaccÄ pÄrisajjÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca dÄnÄni paá¹­á¹­hapesuá¹ƒ. pacchimena yaÃ±Ã±avÄá¹­assa brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca dÄnÄni paá¹­á¹­hapesuá¹ƒ. uttarena yaÃ±Ã±avÄá¹­assa gahapatinecayikÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca dÄnÄni paá¹­á¹­hapesuá¹ƒ. "tesupi kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, yaÃ±Ã±esu neva gÄvo haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na ajeá¸·akÄ haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na kukkuá¹­asÅ«karÄ haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na vividhÄ pÄá¹‡Ä saá¹…ghÄtaá¹ƒ Äpajjiá¹ƒsu, na rukkhÄ chijjiá¹ƒsu yÅ«patthÄya, na dabbhÄ lÅ«yiá¹ƒsu barihisatthÄya. yepi nesaá¹ƒ ahesuá¹ƒ dÄsÄti vÄ pessÄti vÄ kammakarÄti vÄ, tepi na daá¹‡á¸atajjitÄ na bhayatajjitÄ na assumukhÄ rudamÄnÄ parikammÄni akaá¹ƒsu. atha kho ye icchiá¹ƒsu, te akaá¹ƒsu, ye na icchiá¹ƒsu, na te akaá¹ƒsu, yaá¹ƒ icchiá¹ƒsu, taá¹ƒ akaá¹ƒsu, yaá¹ƒ na icchiá¹ƒsu na taá¹ƒ akaá¹ƒsu. sappitelanavanÄ«tadadhimadhuphÄá¹‡itena ceva te yaÃ±Ã±Ä niá¹­á¹­hÄnamagamaá¹ƒsu.
"Then, Brahmin, the Ká¹£atriyas, their followers consisting of townspeople and country folk, the ministers and counselors, their followers consisting of townspeople and country folk, the great Brahmin households, their followers consisting of townspeople and country folk, the wealthy householders, their followers consisting of townspeople and country folk, having taken abundant possessions, approached King MahÄvijita and said thus: 'This, Your Majesty, is abundant wealth brought intended for Your Majesty; may Your Majesty accept it.'" '"Enough, friends, I have accumulated sufficient wealth through righteous revenue. Let that be yours, and take away even more from here."' Refused by the king, they withdrew to one side and considered thus: 'It is not fitting for us to take these possessions back to our own homes. King MahÄvijita is performing a great sacrifice; come, let us be followers (anuyÄgino) ."
347. na bhayatajjitÄ na assumukhÄ rudamÄnÄ parikammÄni akaá¹ƒsu. atha kho ye icchiá¹ƒsu, te akaá¹ƒsu, ye na icchiá¹ƒsu, na te akaá¹ƒsu, yaá¹ƒ icchiá¹ƒsu, taá¹ƒ akaá¹ƒsu, yaá¹ƒ na icchiá¹ƒsu, na taá¹ƒ akaá¹ƒsu. sappitelanavanÄ«tadadhimadhuphÄá¹‡itena ceva so yaÃ±Ã±o niá¹­á¹­hÄnamagamÄsi. 346. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, khattiyÄ ÄnuyantÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, amaccÄ pÄrisajjÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca, gahapatinecayikÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca pahÅ«taá¹ƒ sÄpateyyaá¹ƒ ÄdÄya rÄjÄnaá¹ƒ mahÄvijitaá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ evamÄhaá¹ƒsu â€“ â€˜idaá¹ƒ, deva, pahÅ«taá¹ƒ sÄpateyyaá¹ƒ devaÃ±Ã±eva uddissÄbhataá¹ƒ, taá¹ƒ devo paá¹­iggaá¹‡hÄtÅ«â€™ti. â€˜alaá¹ƒ, bho, mamÄpidaá¹ƒ pahÅ«taá¹ƒ sÄpateyyaá¹ƒ dhammikena balinÄ abhisaá¹…khataá¹ƒ, taÃ±ca vo hotu, ito ca bhiyyo harathÄâ€™ti. te raÃ±Ã±Ä paá¹­ikkhittÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ apakkamma evaá¹ƒ samacintesuá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜na kho etaá¹ƒ amhÄkaá¹ƒ patirÅ«paá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ mayaá¹ƒ imÄni sÄpateyyÄni punadeva sakÄni gharÄni paá¹­ihareyyÄma. rÄjÄ kho mahÄvijito mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajati, handassa mayaá¹ƒ anuyÄgino homÄâ€™ti. 347. "atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, puratthimena yaÃ±Ã±avÄá¹­assa [yaÃ±Ã±ÄvÄá¹­assa (sÄ«. pÄ«. ka.)] khattiyÄ ÄnuyantÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca dÄnÄni paá¹­á¹­hapesuá¹ƒ. dakkhiá¹‡ena yaÃ±Ã±avÄá¹­assa amaccÄ pÄrisajjÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca dÄnÄni paá¹­á¹­hapesuá¹ƒ. pacchimena yaÃ±Ã±avÄá¹­assa brÄhmaá¹‡amahÄsÄlÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca dÄnÄni paá¹­á¹­hapesuá¹ƒ. uttarena yaÃ±Ã±avÄá¹­assa gahapatinecayikÄ negamÄ ceva jÄnapadÄ ca dÄnÄni paá¹­á¹­hapesuá¹ƒ. "tesupi kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, yaÃ±Ã±esu neva gÄvo haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na ajeá¸·akÄ haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na kukkuá¹­asÅ«karÄ haÃ±Ã±iá¹ƒsu, na vividhÄ pÄá¹‡Ä saá¹…ghÄtaá¹ƒ Äpajjiá¹ƒsu, na rukkhÄ chijjiá¹ƒsu yÅ«patthÄya, na dabbhÄ lÅ«yiá¹ƒsu barihisatthÄya. yepi nesaá¹ƒ ahesuá¹ƒ dÄsÄti vÄ pessÄti vÄ kammakarÄti vÄ, tepi na daá¹‡á¸atajjitÄ na bhayatajjitÄ na assumukhÄ rudamÄnÄ parikammÄni akaá¹ƒsu. atha kho ye icchiá¹ƒsu, te akaá¹ƒsu, ye na icchiá¹ƒsu, na te akaá¹ƒsu, yaá¹ƒ icchiá¹ƒsu, taá¹ƒ akaá¹ƒsu, yaá¹ƒ na icchiá¹ƒsu na taá¹ƒ akaá¹ƒsu. sappitelanavanÄ«tadadhimadhuphÄá¹‡itena ceva te yaÃ±Ã±Ä niá¹­á¹­hÄnamagamaá¹ƒsu.
"Then, Brahmin, to the east of the sacrificial ground, the Ká¹£atriyas, their followers consisting of townspeople and country folk, established gifts. To the south of the sacrificial ground, the ministers and counselors, their followers consisting of townspeople and country folk, established gifts. To the west of the sacrificial ground, the great Brahmin households, their followers consisting of townspeople and country folk, established gifts. To the north of the sacrificial ground, the wealthy householders, their followers consisting of townspeople and country folk, established gifts. "In those sacrifices, Brahmin, neither were cows slain, nor were goats or sheep slain, nor were chickens or pigs slain, nor did various living beings undergo slaughter, nor were trees felled for sacrificial posts, nor was *kusa* grass cut for the sacrificial bedding. Those who were his slaves, servants, or workmen did not perform their tasks for fear of the stick or fear, nor with tearful faces, weeping. Then those who wanted to did, those who did not want to, did not; what they wanted, they did, and what they did not want, they did not. And those sacrifices came to completion with clarified butter, oil, fresh butter, curds, honey, and molasses. "Thus, there were the four agreeing groups, King MahÄvijita was endowed with eight factors, the *purohita* Brahmin was endowed with four factors, these three aspects, Brahmin, are called the threefold success of the sacrifice, with sixteen requisites."
348. "iti cattÄro ca anumatipakkhÄ, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito aá¹­á¹­hahaá¹…gehi samannÄgato, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o catÅ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgato, tisso ca vidhÄ ayaá¹ƒ vuccati brÄhmaá¹‡a tividhÄ yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄ soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄ"ti. 348. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä unnÄdino uccÄsaddamahÄsaddÄ ahesuá¹ƒ â€“ "aho yaÃ±Ã±o, aho yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄ"ti! kÅ«á¹­adanto pana brÄhmaá¹‡o tÅ«á¹‡hÄ«bhÅ«tova nisinno hoti. atha kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "kasmÄ pana bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡assa gotamassa subhÄsitaá¹ƒ subhÄsitato nÄbbhanumodatÄ«"ti? "nÄhaá¹ƒ, bho, samaá¹‡assa gotamassa subhÄsitaá¹ƒ subhÄsitato nÄbbhanumodÄmi. muddhÄpi tassa vipateyya, yo samaá¹‡assa gotamassa subhÄsitaá¹ƒ subhÄsitato nÄbbhanumodeyya. api ca me, bho, evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ samaá¹‡o gotamo na evamÄha â€“ â€˜evaá¹ƒ me sutaâ€™nti vÄ â€˜evaá¹ƒ arahati bhavituâ€™nti vÄ, api ca samaá¹‡o gotamo â€“ â€˜evaá¹ƒ tadÄ Äsi, itthaá¹ƒ tadÄ Äsiâ€™ tveva bhÄsati. tassa mayhaá¹ƒ bho evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ â€˜addhÄ samaá¹‡o gotamo tena samayena rÄjÄ vÄ ahosi mahÄvijito yaÃ±Ã±assÄmi purohito vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o tassa yaÃ±Ã±assa yÄjetÄâ€™ti. abhijÄnÄti pana bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo evarÅ«paá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajitvÄ vÄ yÄjetvÄ vÄ kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ƒ maraá¹‡Ä sugatiá¹ƒ saggaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ upapajjitÄti"? "abhijÄnÄmahaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, evarÅ«paá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajitvÄ vÄ yÄjetvÄ vÄ kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ƒ maraá¹‡Ä sugatiá¹ƒ saggaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ upapajjitÄ, ahaá¹ƒ tena samayena purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o ahosiá¹ƒ tassa yaÃ±Ã±assa yÄjetÄ"ti. niccadÄnaanukulayaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ 349. "atthi pana, bho gotama, aÃ±Ã±o yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya [tividhayaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya (ka.)] soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya appaá¹­á¹­hataro [appatthataro (syÄ. kaá¹ƒ.)] ca appasamÄrambhataro [appasamÄrabbhataro (sÄ«. pÄ«. ka.)] ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti.
When this was said, those Brahmins became noisy, greatly loud, very loud â€“ "Oh, the sacrifice, oh, the success of the sacrifice!" But KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin remained sitting silently. Then those Brahmins said to KÅ«á¹­adanta the Brahmin, "Why, good KÅ«á¹­adanta, do you not approve of the well-spoken words of the *Å›ramaá¹‡a* Gotama as well-spoken?" "I do not, good sirs, approve of the well-spoken words of the *Å›ramaá¹‡a* Gotama as well-spoken. His head might fall off, who would not approve of the well-spoken words of the *Å›ramaá¹‡a* Gotama as well-spoken. Moreover, it occurs to me thus, good sirs â€“ the *Å›ramaá¹‡a* Gotama does not say thus, â€˜Thus I have heard,â€™ or â€˜Thus it should be,â€™ but the *Å›ramaá¹‡a* Gotama speaks only thus, â€˜Thus it was then, in this way it was then.â€™ It occurs to me thus, good sirs â€“ â€˜Surely the *Å›ramaá¹‡a* Gotama was at that time either King MahÄvijita, the master of the sacrifice, or the *purohita* Brahmin, the performer of that sacrifice.â€™" "Does the esteemed Gotama acknowledge that after performing or causing to be performed a sacrifice of such a kind, one is reborn after death, after the breaking up of the body, in a good destination, a heavenly world?" "I acknowledge, Brahmin, that after performing or causing to be performed a sacrifice of such a kind, one is reborn after death, after the breaking up of the body, in a good destination, a heavenly world; I was at that time the *purohita* Brahmin, the performer of that sacrifice." Continuous giving and the sacrifice agreeable.
349. "iti cattÄro ca anumatipakkhÄ, rÄjÄ mahÄvijito aá¹­á¹­hahaá¹…gehi samannÄgato, purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o catÅ«haá¹…gehi samannÄgato, tisso ca vidhÄ ayaá¹ƒ vuccati brÄhmaá¹‡a tividhÄ yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄ soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄ"ti. 348. evaá¹ƒ vutte, te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä unnÄdino uccÄsaddamahÄsaddÄ ahesuá¹ƒ â€“ "aho yaÃ±Ã±o, aho yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄ"ti! kÅ«á¹­adanto pana brÄhmaá¹‡o tÅ«á¹‡hÄ«bhÅ«tova nisinno hoti. atha kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä kÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ "kasmÄ pana bhavaá¹ƒ kÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡assa gotamassa subhÄsitaá¹ƒ subhÄsitato nÄbbhanumodatÄ«"ti? "nÄhaá¹ƒ, bho, samaá¹‡assa gotamassa subhÄsitaá¹ƒ subhÄsitato nÄbbhanumodÄmi. muddhÄpi tassa vipateyya, yo samaá¹‡assa gotamassa subhÄsitaá¹ƒ subhÄsitato nÄbbhanumodeyya. api ca me, bho, evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ samaá¹‡o gotamo na evamÄha â€“ â€˜evaá¹ƒ me sutaâ€™nti vÄ â€˜evaá¹ƒ arahati bhavituâ€™nti vÄ, api ca samaá¹‡o gotamo â€“ â€˜evaá¹ƒ tadÄ Äsi, itthaá¹ƒ tadÄ Äsiâ€™ tveva bhÄsati. tassa mayhaá¹ƒ bho evaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ â€˜addhÄ samaá¹‡o gotamo tena samayena rÄjÄ vÄ ahosi mahÄvijito yaÃ±Ã±assÄmi purohito vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o tassa yaÃ±Ã±assa yÄjetÄâ€™ti. abhijÄnÄti pana bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo evarÅ«paá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajitvÄ vÄ yÄjetvÄ vÄ kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ƒ maraá¹‡Ä sugatiá¹ƒ saggaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ upapajjitÄti"? "abhijÄnÄmahaá¹ƒ, brÄhmaá¹‡a, evarÅ«paá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ yajitvÄ vÄ yÄjetvÄ vÄ kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ƒ maraá¹‡Ä sugatiá¹ƒ saggaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ upapajjitÄ, ahaá¹ƒ tena samayena purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o ahosiá¹ƒ tassa yaÃ±Ã±assa yÄjetÄ"ti. niccadÄnaanukulayaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ 349. "atthi pana, bho gotama, aÃ±Ã±o yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya [tividhayaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya (ka.)] soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya appaá¹­á¹­hataro [appatthataro (syÄ. kaá¹ƒ.)] ca appasamÄrambhataro [appasamÄrabbhataro (sÄ«. pÄ«. ka.)] ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti.
"Is there, good Gotama, another sacrifice that is simpler, less elaborate, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold success of the sacrifice with its sixteen accessories?" 'There is, Brahmin, another sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories.' 'What, Reverend Gotama, is that sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories?' 'Brahmin, those regular gifts and continuous sacrifices that are given specifically to virtuous renunciants are a sacrifice simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories.' 'Reverend Gotama, what is the cause, what is the reason, why that regular gift, that continuous sacrifice, is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories?' 'Brahmin, Arahants or those who have attained the path to Arahantship do not attend such a sacrifice. What is the reason for that? Because beatings with sticks and seizing by the throat are seen there, Brahmin. Therefore, Arahants or those who have attained the path to Arahantship do not attend such a sacrifice. Brahmin, those regular gifts and continuous sacrifices that are given specifically to virtuous renunciants, Arahants or those who have attained the path to Arahantship attend this kind of sacrifice. What is the reason for that? Because beatings with sticks and seizing by the throat are not seen there, Brahmin. Therefore, Arahants or those who have attained the path to Arahantship attend such a sacrifice. This, Brahmin, is the cause, this is the reason, why that regular gift, that continuous sacrifice, is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories.' 'And, Reverend Gotama, is there any other sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories, and this regular gift, this continuous sacrifice?' 'There is, Brahmin, another sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories, and this regular gift, this continuous sacrifice.' 'What, Reverend Gotama, is that sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories, and this regular gift, this continuous sacrifice?' 'Brahmin, if one makes a dwelling (vihÄra) for the Saá¹…gha (community) from the four directions, this is a sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories, and this regular gift, this continuous sacrifice.' 'And, Reverend Gotama, is there any other sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories, this regular gift, this continuous sacrifice, and this gift of a dwelling?' 'There is, Brahmin, another sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories, this regular gift, this continuous sacrifice, and this gift of a dwelling.' 'What, Reverend Gotama, is that sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories, this regular gift, this continuous sacrifice, and this gift of a dwelling?' 'Brahmin, if one with a serene mind goes to the Buddha for refuge (Buddhaá¹ƒ saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ gacchati), goes to the Dharma for refuge (Dhammaá¹ƒ saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ gacchati), and goes to the Saá¹…gha for refuge (Saá¹…ghaá¹ƒ saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ gacchati), this is a sacrifice that is simpler, less demanding, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold sacrifice with its sixteen accessories, this regular gift, this continuous sacrifice, and this gift of a dwelling.'
350. "atthi kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, aÃ±Ã±o yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya appaá¹­á¹­hataro ca appasamÄrambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti. "katamo pana so, bho gotama, yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya appaá¹­á¹­hataro ca appasamÄrambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti. "yÄni kho pana tÄni, brÄhmaá¹‡a, niccadÄnÄni anukulayaÃ±Ã±Äni sÄ«lavante pabbajite uddissa diyyanti, ayaá¹ƒ kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya appaá¹­á¹­hataro ca appasamÄrambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti. "ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo, yena taá¹ƒ niccadÄnaá¹ƒ anukulayaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ imÄya tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya appaá¹­á¹­hataraÃ±ca appasamÄrambhataraÃ±ca mahapphalataraÃ±ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataraÃ±cÄ"ti. "na kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, evarÅ«paá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamanti arahanto vÄ arahattamaggaá¹ƒ vÄ samÄpannÄ. taá¹ƒ kissa hetu? dissanti hettha, brÄhmaá¹‡a, daá¹‡á¸appahÄrÄpi galaggahÄpi, tasmÄ evarÅ«paá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ na upasaá¹…kamanti arahanto vÄ arahattamaggaá¹ƒ vÄ samÄpannÄ. yÄni kho pana tÄni, brÄhmaá¹‡a, niccadÄnÄni anukulayaÃ±Ã±Äni sÄ«lavante pabbajite uddissa diyyanti, evarÅ«paá¹ƒ kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamanti arahanto vÄ arahattamaggaá¹ƒ vÄ samÄpannÄ. taá¹ƒ kissa hetu? na hettha, brÄhmaá¹‡a, dissanti daá¹‡á¸appahÄrÄpi galaggahÄpi, tasmÄ evarÅ«paá¹ƒ yaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamanti arahanto vÄ arahattamaggaá¹ƒ vÄ samÄpannÄ. ayaá¹ƒ kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, hetu ayaá¹ƒ paccayo, yena taá¹ƒ niccadÄnaá¹ƒ anukulayaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ imÄya tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya appaá¹­á¹­hataraÃ±ca appasamÄrambhataraÃ±ca mahapphalataraÃ±ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataraÃ±cÄ"ti. 350. "atthi pana, bho gotama, aÃ±Ã±o yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya ca tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya iminÄ ca niccadÄnena anukulayaÃ±Ã±ena appaá¹­á¹­hataro ca appasamÄrambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti.
[Translation for paragraph 350]
351. "atthi kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, aÃ±Ã±o yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya ca tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya iminÄ ca niccadÄnena anukulayaÃ±Ã±ena appaá¹­á¹­hataro ca appasamÄrambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti. "katamo pana so, bho gotama, yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya ca tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya iminÄ ca niccadÄnena anukulayaÃ±Ã±ena appaá¹­á¹­hataro ca appasamÄrambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti. "yo kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, cÄtuddisaá¹ƒ saá¹…ghaá¹ƒ uddissa vihÄraá¹ƒ karoti, ayaá¹ƒ kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya ca tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya iminÄ ca niccadÄnena anukulayaÃ±Ã±ena appaá¹­á¹­hataro ca appasamÄrambhataro ca mahapphalataro ca mahÄnisaá¹ƒsataro cÄ"ti. 351. "atthi kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, aÃ±Ã±o yaÃ±Ã±o imÄya ca tividhÄya yaÃ±Ã±asampadÄya soá¸·asaparikkhÄrÄya iminÄ ca niccadÄnena anukulayaÃ±Ã±ena iminÄ ca vihÄradÄnena imehi ca saraá¹‡agamanehi imehi ca sikkhÄpadehi
â€œBut, Reverend Gotama, is there any sacrifice (yajÃ±a) that is more distinguished, less arduous, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold accomplishment of sacrifice (yajÃ±asampadÄ) with its sixteen accessories (soá¸·asaparikkhÄra), than this regular giving (niccadÄna), this continuous sacrifice (anukulayaÃ±Ã±a), than this giving of monasteries (vihÄradÄna), and than these going for refuge (saraá¹‡agamana)?â€ â€œThere is, Brahmin.â€ â€œWhat is it, Reverend Gotama, that is a sacrifice (yajÃ±a) more distinguished, less arduous, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold accomplishment of sacrifice (yajÃ±asampadÄ) with its sixteen accessories (soá¸·asaparikkhÄra)?â€ â€œBrahmin, if anyone with a pure heart (pasannacitto) undertakes the precepts (sikkhÄpadÄni)â€”to refrain from taking life (pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ veramaá¹‡iá¹ƒ), from taking what is not given (adinnÄdÄnÄ veramaá¹‡iá¹ƒ), from sexual immorality (kÄmesumicchÄcÄrÄ veramaá¹‡iá¹ƒ), from lying speech (musÄvÄdÄ veramaá¹‡iá¹ƒ), and from taking strong drink and sloth-producing drugs (surÄmerayamajjapamÄdaá¹­á¹­hÄnÄ veramaá¹‡iá¹ƒ). This, Brahmin, constitutes a sacrifice (yajÃ±a) more distinguished, less arduous, more fruitful, and more beneficial than this threefold accomplishment of sacrifice (yajÃ±asampadÄ) with its sixteen accessories (soá¸·asaparikkhÄra), than this regular giving (niccadÄna), this continuous sacrifice (anukulayaÃ±Ã±a), than this giving of monasteries (vihÄradÄna), and than these going for refuge (saraá¹‡agamana).â€
