When this was said, the wanderer Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda said this to the Blessed One: "Magnificent, venerable sir! Magnificent, venerable sir! Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms. In the same way has the Dhamma been explained by the Blessed One in many ways. I go to the Blessed One for refuge, and to the Dhamma and the *Saá¹…gha* of monks. May the Blessed One remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life." The going forth of Citta Hatthi-sÄriputta
442. cittahatthisÄriputtaupasampadÄ 442. citto pana hatthisÄriputto bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "abhikkantaá¹ƒ, bhante, abhikkantaá¹ƒ, bhante! seyyathÄpi, bhante, nikkujjitaá¹ƒ vÄ ukkujjeyya, paá¹­icchannaá¹ƒ vÄ vivareyya, mÅ«á¸·hassa vÄ maggaá¹ƒ Äcikkheyya, andhakÄre vÄ telapajjotaá¹ƒ dhÄreyya â€“ â€˜cakkhumanto rÅ«pÄni dakkhantÄ«â€™ti. evamevaá¹ƒ bhagavatÄ anekapariyÄyena dhammo pakÄsito. esÄhaá¹ƒ, bhante, bhagavantaá¹ƒ saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ gacchÄmi dhammaÃ±ca bhikkhusaá¹…ghaÃ±ca. labheyyÄhaá¹ƒ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaá¹ƒ, labheyyaá¹ƒ upasampada"nti. 443. alattha kho citto hatthisÄriputto bhagavato santike pabbajjaá¹ƒ, alattha upasampadaá¹ƒ. acirÅ«pasampanno kho panÄyasmÄ citto hatthisÄriputto eko vÅ«pakaá¹­á¹­ho appamatto ÄtÄpÄ« pahitatto viharanto na cirasseva â€“ yassatthÄya kulaputtÄ sammadeva agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ƒ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraá¹ƒ â€“ brahmacariyapariyosÄnaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­heva dhamme sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ upasampajja vihÄsi. â€˜khÄ«á¹‡Ä jÄti, vusitaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ, kataá¹ƒ karaá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ, nÄparaá¹ƒ itthattÄyÄâ€™ti â€“ abbhaÃ±Ã±Äsi. aÃ±Ã±ataro kho panÄyasmÄ citto hatthisÄriputto arahataá¹ƒ ahosÄ«ti. poá¹­á¹­hapÄdasuttaá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ navamaá¹ƒ.
Citta, the elephant trainer's son, said this to the Blessed One: "Magnificent, venerable sir! Magnificent, venerable sir! Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms. In the same way has the Dhamma been explained by the Blessed One in many ways. I go to the Blessed One for refuge, and to the Dhamma and the *Saá¹…gha* of monks. May I receive from the Blessed One admission to the Order (*pabbajjaá¹ƒ*), and also the higher ordination (*upasampadaá¹ƒ*)?"
443. cittahatthisÄriputtaupasampadÄ 442. citto pana hatthisÄriputto bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "abhikkantaá¹ƒ, bhante, abhikkantaá¹ƒ, bhante! seyyathÄpi, bhante, nikkujjitaá¹ƒ vÄ ukkujjeyya, paá¹­icchannaá¹ƒ vÄ vivareyya, mÅ«á¸·hassa vÄ maggaá¹ƒ Äcikkheyya, andhakÄre vÄ telapajjotaá¹ƒ dhÄreyya â€“ â€˜cakkhumanto rÅ«pÄni dakkhantÄ«â€™ti. evamevaá¹ƒ bhagavatÄ anekapariyÄyena dhammo pakÄsito. esÄhaá¹ƒ, bhante, bhagavantaá¹ƒ saraá¹‡aá¹ƒ gacchÄmi dhammaÃ±ca bhikkhusaá¹…ghaÃ±ca. labheyyÄhaá¹ƒ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaá¹ƒ, labheyyaá¹ƒ upasampada"nti. 443. alattha kho citto hatthisÄriputto bhagavato santike pabbajjaá¹ƒ, alattha upasampadaá¹ƒ. acirÅ«pasampanno kho panÄyasmÄ citto hatthisÄriputto eko vÅ«pakaá¹­á¹­ho appamatto ÄtÄpÄ« pahitatto viharanto na cirasseva â€“ yassatthÄya kulaputtÄ sammadeva agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ƒ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraá¹ƒ â€“ brahmacariyapariyosÄnaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­heva dhamme sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ upasampajja vihÄsi. â€˜khÄ«á¹‡Ä jÄti, vusitaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ, kataá¹ƒ karaá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ, nÄparaá¹ƒ itthattÄyÄâ€™ti â€“ abbhaÃ±Ã±Äsi. aÃ±Ã±ataro kho panÄyasmÄ citto hatthisÄriputto arahataá¹ƒ ahosÄ«ti. poá¹­á¹­hapÄdasuttaá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ navamaá¹ƒ.
So Citta Hatthi-sÄriputta obtained the going forth (*pabbajjaá¹ƒ*) in the Blessed One's presence; he obtained the higher ordination (*upasampadaá¹ƒ*). And not long after his Acceptanceâ€”dwelling alone, secluded, heedful, ardent, & resoluteâ€”he in no long time reached & remained in the supreme goal of the holy life (*brahmacariyapariyosÄnaá¹ƒ*), for which clansmen rightly go forth from home into homelessness, knowing & realizing it for himself in the here & now. He directly knew: â€œBirth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.â€ (*khÄ«á¹‡Ä jÄti, vusitaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ, kataá¹ƒ karaá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ, nÄparaá¹ƒ itthattÄyÄâ€™ti*). And thus Ven. Elephant-trainerâ€™s Son became another one of the *arahants*. The Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda Sutta is finished.
444. 10. subhasuttaá¹ƒ subhamÄá¹‡avavatthu 444. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ ÄyasmÄ Änando sÄvatthiyaá¹ƒ viharati jetavane anÄthapiá¹‡á¸ikassa ÄrÄme aciraparinibbute bhagavati. tena kho pana samayena subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto sÄvatthiyaá¹ƒ paá¹­ivasati kenacideva karaá¹‡Ä«yena. 445. atha kho subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡avaka, yena samaá¹‡o Änando tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ mama vacanena samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ puccha â€“ â€˜subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchatÄ«â€™ti. evaÃ±ca vadehi â€“ â€˜sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. 446. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so mÄá¹‡avako subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa paá¹­issutvÄ yenÄyasmÄ Änando tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ ÄyasmatÄ Änandena saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho so mÄá¹‡avako Äyasmantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ â€˜sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. 447. evaá¹ƒ vutte, ÄyasmÄ Änando taá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "akÄlo kho, mÄá¹‡avaka. atthi me ajja bhesajjamattÄ pÄ«tÄ. appevanÄma svepi upasaá¹…kameyyÄma kÄlaÃ±ca samayaÃ±ca upÄdÄyÄ"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so mÄá¹‡avako Äyasmato Änandassa paá¹­issutvÄ uá¹­á¹­hÄyÄsanÄ yena subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto
Thus have I heard: On one occasion, the Venerable Ä€nanda was staying near SÄvatthÄ«, in Jeta's Grove at AnÄthapindika's Park, not long after the Blessed One's *parinibbÄna*. At that time, Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, was residing in SÄvatthÄ« on some business.
445. 10. subhasuttaá¹ƒ subhamÄá¹‡avavatthu 444. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ ÄyasmÄ Änando sÄvatthiyaá¹ƒ viharati jetavane anÄthapiá¹‡á¸ikassa ÄrÄme aciraparinibbute bhagavati. tena kho pana samayena subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto sÄvatthiyaá¹ƒ paá¹­ivasati kenacideva karaá¹‡Ä«yena. 445. atha kho subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡avaka, yena samaá¹‡o Änando tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ mama vacanena samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ puccha â€“ â€˜subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchatÄ«â€™ti. evaÃ±ca vadehi â€“ â€˜sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. 446. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so mÄá¹‡avako subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa paá¹­issutvÄ yenÄyasmÄ Änando tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ ÄyasmatÄ Änandena saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho so mÄá¹‡avako Äyasmantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ â€˜sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. 447. evaá¹ƒ vutte, ÄyasmÄ Änando taá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "akÄlo kho, mÄá¹‡avaka. atthi me ajja bhesajjamattÄ pÄ«tÄ. appevanÄma svepi upasaá¹…kameyyÄma kÄlaÃ±ca samayaÃ±ca upÄdÄyÄ"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so mÄá¹‡avako Äyasmato Änandassa paá¹­issutvÄ uá¹­á¹­hÄyÄsanÄ yena subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto
Then Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, addressed a certain student: â€œCome, student, go to where the ascetic Ä€nanda is, and upon arriving, ask the ascetic Ä€nanda in my name if he is well, free from illness, nimble, strong, and living comfortably, saying, â€˜Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, asks after your well-being, if you are free from illness, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.â€™ And speak thus: â€˜It would be good if the esteemed Ä€nanda would visit the dwelling of Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, out of compassion.â€™â€
446. 10. subhasuttaá¹ƒ subhamÄá¹‡avavatthu 444. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ ÄyasmÄ Änando sÄvatthiyaá¹ƒ viharati jetavane anÄthapiá¹‡á¸ikassa ÄrÄme aciraparinibbute bhagavati. tena kho pana samayena subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto sÄvatthiyaá¹ƒ paá¹­ivasati kenacideva karaá¹‡Ä«yena. 445. atha kho subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡avaka, yena samaá¹‡o Änando tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ mama vacanena samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ puccha â€“ â€˜subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchatÄ«â€™ti. evaÃ±ca vadehi â€“ â€˜sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. 446. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so mÄá¹‡avako subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa paá¹­issutvÄ yenÄyasmÄ Änando tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ ÄyasmatÄ Änandena saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho so mÄá¹‡avako Äyasmantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ â€˜sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. 447. evaá¹ƒ vutte, ÄyasmÄ Änando taá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "akÄlo kho, mÄá¹‡avaka. atthi me ajja bhesajjamattÄ pÄ«tÄ. appevanÄma svepi upasaá¹…kameyyÄma kÄlaÃ±ca samayaÃ±ca upÄdÄyÄ"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so mÄá¹‡avako Äyasmato Änandassa paá¹­issutvÄ uá¹­á¹­hÄyÄsanÄ yena subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto
"Yes, sir," the student replied to Subha, the student, son of Todeyya. Then he went to where the Venerable Ä€nanda was, and upon arriving, exchanged courteous greetings with the Venerable Ä€nanda. Having concluded the courteous and amiable talk, he sat down to one side. Seated to one side, the student said to the Venerable Ä€nanda: "Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, asks after your well-being, if you are free from illness, nimble, strong, and living comfortably. And he says this: â€˜It would be good if the esteemed Ä€nanda would visit the dwelling of Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, out of compassion.â€™"
447. 10. subhasuttaá¹ƒ subhamÄá¹‡avavatthu 444. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ ÄyasmÄ Änando sÄvatthiyaá¹ƒ viharati jetavane anÄthapiá¹‡á¸ikassa ÄrÄme aciraparinibbute bhagavati. tena kho pana samayena subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto sÄvatthiyaá¹ƒ paá¹­ivasati kenacideva karaá¹‡Ä«yena. 445. atha kho subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡avaka, yena samaá¹‡o Änando tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ mama vacanena samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ puccha â€“ â€˜subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchatÄ«â€™ti. evaÃ±ca vadehi â€“ â€˜sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. 446. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so mÄá¹‡avako subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa paá¹­issutvÄ yenÄyasmÄ Änando tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ ÄyasmatÄ Änandena saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho so mÄá¹‡avako Äyasmantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ â€˜sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. 447. evaá¹ƒ vutte, ÄyasmÄ Änando taá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avakaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "akÄlo kho, mÄá¹‡avaka. atthi me ajja bhesajjamattÄ pÄ«tÄ. appevanÄma svepi upasaá¹…kameyyÄma kÄlaÃ±ca samayaÃ±ca upÄdÄyÄ"ti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho so mÄá¹‡avako Äyasmato Änandassa paá¹­issutvÄ uá¹­á¹­hÄyÄsanÄ yena subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto
When this was said, the Venerable Ä€nanda replied to the student: â€œIt is not the right time, student. Today, I have taken some medicine. Perhaps we might visit tomorrow when the time and occasion are suitable.â€ "Yes, sir," the student replied to the Venerable Ä€nanda. Rising from his seat, he went to where Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, was. Upon arriving, he said to Subha, the student, son of Todeyya: "I have delivered your message to the esteemed Ä€nanda, â€˜Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, asks after your well-being, if you are free from illness, nimble, strong, and living comfortably. And he says this: "It would be good if the esteemed Ä€nanda would visit the dwelling of Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, out of compassion."â€™ When this was said, sir, the ascetic Ä€nanda told me, â€˜It is not the right time, student. Today, I have taken some medicine. Perhaps we might visit tomorrow when the time and occasion are suitable.â€™ Even with this much, sir, what is the reason that the esteemed Ä€nanda made an opportunity for even a future visit?"
448. tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ subhaá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ todeyyaputtaá¹ƒ etadavoca, "avocumhÄ kho mayaá¹ƒ bhoto vacanena taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ "sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. evaá¹ƒ vutte, bho, samaá¹‡o Änando maá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜akÄlo kho, mÄá¹‡avaka. atthi me ajja bhesajjamattÄ pÄ«tÄ. appevanÄma svepi upasaá¹…kameyyÄma kÄlaÃ±ca samayaÃ±ca upÄdÄyÄâ€™ti. ettÄvatÄpi kho, bho, katameva etaá¹ƒ, yato kho so bhavaá¹ƒ Änando okÄsamakÄsi svÄtanÄyapi upasaá¹…kamanÄyÄ"ti. 448. atha kho ÄyasmÄ Änando tassÄ rattiyÄ accayena pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya cetakena bhikkhunÄ pacchÄsamaá¹‡ena yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ paÃ±Ã±atte Äsane nisÄ«di. atha kho subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto yenÄyasmÄ Änando tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ ÄyasmatÄ Änandena saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto Äyasmantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "bhavaÃ±hi Änando tassa bhoto gotamassa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hÄko santikÄvacaro samÄ«pacÄrÄ«. bhavametaá¹ƒ Änando jÄneyya, yesaá¹ƒ so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo dhammÄnaá¹ƒ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesi. katamesÄnaá¹ƒ kho, bho Änanda, dhammÄnaá¹ƒ so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, kattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesÄ«"ti? 449. "tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, khandhÄnaá¹ƒ so bhagavÄ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, ettha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesi. katamesaá¹ƒ tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ? ariyassa sÄ«lakkhandhassa, ariyassa samÄdhikkhandhassa, ariyassa paÃ±Ã±Äkkhandhassa. imesaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ khandhÄnaá¹ƒ so bhagavÄ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, ettha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesÄ«"ti.
Then, as that night passed, the Venerable Ä€nanda, in the early morning, dressed, took his bowl and robe, and accompanied by the bhikkhu Cetaka as his attendant, went to the dwelling of Subha, the student, son of Todeyya. Upon arriving, he sat down on the prepared seat. Then Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, went to where the Venerable Ä€nanda was. Upon arriving, he exchanged courteous greetings with the Venerable Ä€nanda. Having concluded the courteous and amiable talk, he sat down to one side. Seated to one side, Subha, the student, son of Todeyya, said to the Venerable Ä€nanda: â€œThe esteemed Ä€nanda has been a long-time attendant of the esteemed Gotama, living and staying nearby. The esteemed Ä€nanda would know what qualities the esteemed Gotama praised, and in what he encouraged, guided, and established this populace. What qualities, esteemed Ä€nanda, did the esteemed Gotama praise, and in what did he encourage, guide, and establish this populace?"
449. tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ subhaá¹ƒ mÄá¹‡avaá¹ƒ todeyyaputtaá¹ƒ etadavoca, "avocumhÄ kho mayaá¹ƒ bhoto vacanena taá¹ƒ bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto bhavantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ "sÄdhu kira bhavaá¹ƒ Änando yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kamatu anukampaá¹ƒ upÄdÄyÄ"â€™ti. evaá¹ƒ vutte, bho, samaá¹‡o Änando maá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜akÄlo kho, mÄá¹‡avaka. atthi me ajja bhesajjamattÄ pÄ«tÄ. appevanÄma svepi upasaá¹…kameyyÄma kÄlaÃ±ca samayaÃ±ca upÄdÄyÄâ€™ti. ettÄvatÄpi kho, bho, katameva etaá¹ƒ, yato kho so bhavaá¹ƒ Änando okÄsamakÄsi svÄtanÄyapi upasaá¹…kamanÄyÄ"ti. 448. atha kho ÄyasmÄ Änando tassÄ rattiyÄ accayena pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya cetakena bhikkhunÄ pacchÄsamaá¹‡ena yena subhassa mÄá¹‡avassa todeyyaputtassa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ paÃ±Ã±atte Äsane nisÄ«di. atha kho subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto yenÄyasmÄ Änando tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ ÄyasmatÄ Änandena saddhiá¹ƒ sammodi. sammodanÄ«yaá¹ƒ kathaá¹ƒ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ƒ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho subho mÄá¹‡avo todeyyaputto Äyasmantaá¹ƒ Änandaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "bhavaÃ±hi Änando tassa bhoto gotamassa dÄ«gharattaá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hÄko santikÄvacaro samÄ«pacÄrÄ«. bhavametaá¹ƒ Änando jÄneyya, yesaá¹ƒ so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo dhammÄnaá¹ƒ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesi. katamesÄnaá¹ƒ kho, bho Änanda, dhammÄnaá¹ƒ so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, kattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesÄ«"ti? 449. "tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, khandhÄnaá¹ƒ so bhagavÄ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, ettha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesi. katamesaá¹ƒ tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ? ariyassa sÄ«lakkhandhassa, ariyassa samÄdhikkhandhassa, ariyassa paÃ±Ã±Äkkhandhassa. imesaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ khandhÄnaá¹ƒ so bhagavÄ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, ettha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesÄ«"ti.
"Subha, the Blessed One praised three aggregates, and in them, he encouraged, guided, and established this populace. Which three? The aggregate of morality (*Å›Ä«la*) of the noble one (*Ärya*), the aggregate of concentration (*samÄdhi*) of the noble one (*Ärya*), and the aggregate of wisdom (*prajÃ±Ä*) of the noble one (*Ärya*). These, Subha, are the three aggregates that the Blessed One praised, and in them, he encouraged, guided, and established this populace." The Virtue Category.
450. sÄ«lakkhandho 450. "katamo pana so, bho Änanda, ariyo sÄ«lakkhandho, yassa so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesÄ«"ti? "idha, mÄá¹‡ava, tathÄgato loke uppajjati arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄ. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. taá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ suá¹‡Äti gahapati vÄ gahapatiputto vÄ aÃ±Ã±atarasmiá¹ƒ vÄ kule paccÄjÄto. so taá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ sutvÄ tathÄgate saddhaá¹ƒ paá¹­ilabhati. so tena saddhÄpaá¹­ilÄbhena samannÄgato iti paá¹­isaÃ±cikkhati â€“ â€˜sambÄdho gharÄvÄso rajopatho, abbhokÄso pabbajjÄ, nayidaá¹ƒ sukaraá¹ƒ agÄraá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasatÄ ekantaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ ekantaparisuddhaá¹ƒ saá¹…khalikhitaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ carituá¹ƒ. yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ kesamassuá¹ƒ ohÄretvÄ kÄsÄyÄni vatthÄni acchÄdetvÄ agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ƒ pabbajeyyaâ€™nti. so aparena samayena appaá¹ƒ vÄ bhogakkhandhaá¹ƒ pahÄya mahantaá¹ƒ vÄ bhogakkhandhaá¹ƒ pahÄya appaá¹ƒ vÄ Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­aá¹ƒ pahÄya mahantaá¹ƒ vÄ Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­aá¹ƒ pahÄya kesamassuá¹ƒ ohÄretvÄ kÄsÄyÄni vatthÄni acchÄdetvÄ agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ƒ pabbajati. so evaá¹ƒ pabbajito samÄno pÄtimokkhasaá¹ƒvarasaá¹ƒvuto viharati, ÄcÄragocarasampanno, anumattesu vajjesu bhayadassÄvÄ«, samÄdÄya sikkhati sikkhÄpadesu, kÄyakammavacÄ«kammena samannÄgato kusalena, parisuddhÄjÄ«vo, sÄ«lasampanno, indriyesu guttadvÄro, satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, santuá¹­á¹­ho. 451. "kathaÃ±ca, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu sÄ«lasampanno hoti? idha, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtaá¹ƒ pahÄya pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti, nihitadaá¹‡á¸o nihitasattho lajjÄ« dayÄpanno, sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ« viharati. yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtaá¹ƒ pahÄya pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti, nihitadaá¹‡á¸o nihitasattho lajjÄ« dayÄpanno,
"Well, Reverend Ä€nanda, what is the noble Virtue Category that the Reverend Gotama praised, and where did he encourage, settle, and establish this populace?" "Here, young sir, a *TathÄgata* arises in the world, a worthy one (*arahaá¹ƒ*), a fully enlightened one (*sammÄsambuddho*), endowed with knowledge and conduct (*vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno*), a well-farer (*sugato*), a knower of the worlds (*lokavidÅ«*), an unsurpassed trainer of those to be tamed (*anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi*), a teacher of gods and humans (*satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ*), an awakened one (*buddho*), a blessed one (*bhagavÄ*). He, having realized it by his own super-knowledge (*abhiÃ±Ã±Ä*), proclaims this world with its gods (*sadevakaá¹ƒ*), its *MÄras* (*samÄrakaá¹ƒ*) and *BrahmÄs* (*sabrahmakaá¹ƒ*), its ascetics and *BrÄhmaá¹‡as* (*sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ*), its people (*pajaá¹ƒ*), with its gods and humans (*sadevamanussaá¹ƒ*). He teaches the *Dhamma* (*dhammaá¹ƒ*) that is good in the beginning (*ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), good in the middle (*majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), and good in the end (*pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ*), with its meaning (*sÄtthaá¹ƒ*) and with its phrasing (*sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ*), and reveals the spiritual life (*brahmacariyaá¹ƒ*) that is utterly perfect (*kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ*) and pure (*parisuddhaá¹ƒ*). A householder (*gahapati*) or a householderâ€™s son (*gahapatiputto*) or one born in some other clan (*kule paccÄjÄto*) hears that *Dhamma* (*dhammaá¹ƒ*). Having heard that *Dhamma* (*dhammaá¹ƒ*), he gains faith (*saddhaá¹ƒ*) in the *TathÄgata*. Endowed with that gain of faith (*saddhÄpaá¹­ilÄbhena*), he reflects thus: â€˜Household life is crowded, a dusty path; the homeless life is open. It is not easy, while living in a house, to lead the perfectly complete, perfectly pure spiritual life, like a polished shell. What if I were to shave off my hair and beard (*kesamassuá¹ƒ ohÄretvÄ*), put on the saffron robes (*kÄsÄyÄni vatthÄni acchÄdetvÄ*), and go forth from the household life into homelessness (*agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ƒ pabbajeyya*)?â€™ Then, at a later time, having abandoned a small or a large accumulation of wealth (*bhogakkhandhaá¹ƒ pahÄya*), having abandoned a small or a large circle of relatives (*Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­aá¹ƒ pahÄya*), he shaves off his hair and beard (*kesamassuá¹ƒ ohÄretvÄ*), puts on the saffron robes (*kÄsÄyÄni vatthÄni acchÄdetvÄ*), and goes forth from the home life into homelessness (*agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ƒ pabbajati*). Having thus gone forth, he lives restrained by the restraint of the monastic rules (*pÄtimokkhasaá¹ƒvarasaá¹ƒvuto*), possessed of proper behavior and resort (*ÄcÄragocarasampanno*), seeing danger in the slightest faults (*anumattesu vajjesu bhayadassÄvÄ«*), having undertaken to train himself in the training rules (*sikkhÄpadesu*), endowed with wholesome bodily and verbal action (*kÄyakammavacÄ«kammena samannÄgato kusalena*), his livelihood is purified (*parisuddhÄjÄ«vo*), he is accomplished in virtue (*sÄ«lasampanno*), with the doors of his senses guarded (*indriyesu guttadvÄro*), endowed with mindfulness and clear comprehension (*satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato*), and is content (*santuá¹­á¹­ho*).
451. sÄ«lakkhandho 450. "katamo pana so, bho Änanda, ariyo sÄ«lakkhandho, yassa so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesÄ«"ti? "idha, mÄá¹‡ava, tathÄgato loke uppajjati arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄ. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. taá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ suá¹‡Äti gahapati vÄ gahapatiputto vÄ aÃ±Ã±atarasmiá¹ƒ vÄ kule paccÄjÄto. so taá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ sutvÄ tathÄgate saddhaá¹ƒ paá¹­ilabhati. so tena saddhÄpaá¹­ilÄbhena samannÄgato iti paá¹­isaÃ±cikkhati â€“ â€˜sambÄdho gharÄvÄso rajopatho, abbhokÄso pabbajjÄ, nayidaá¹ƒ sukaraá¹ƒ agÄraá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasatÄ ekantaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ ekantaparisuddhaá¹ƒ saá¹…khalikhitaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ carituá¹ƒ. yaá¹ƒnÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ kesamassuá¹ƒ ohÄretvÄ kÄsÄyÄni vatthÄni acchÄdetvÄ agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ƒ pabbajeyyaâ€™nti. so aparena samayena appaá¹ƒ vÄ bhogakkhandhaá¹ƒ pahÄya mahantaá¹ƒ vÄ bhogakkhandhaá¹ƒ pahÄya appaá¹ƒ vÄ Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­aá¹ƒ pahÄya mahantaá¹ƒ vÄ Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­aá¹ƒ pahÄya kesamassuá¹ƒ ohÄretvÄ kÄsÄyÄni vatthÄni acchÄdetvÄ agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ƒ pabbajati. so evaá¹ƒ pabbajito samÄno pÄtimokkhasaá¹ƒvarasaá¹ƒvuto viharati, ÄcÄragocarasampanno, anumattesu vajjesu bhayadassÄvÄ«, samÄdÄya sikkhati sikkhÄpadesu, kÄyakammavacÄ«kammena samannÄgato kusalena, parisuddhÄjÄ«vo, sÄ«lasampanno, indriyesu guttadvÄro, satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, santuá¹­á¹­ho. 451. "kathaÃ±ca, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu sÄ«lasampanno hoti? idha, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtaá¹ƒ pahÄya pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti, nihitadaá¹‡á¸o nihitasattho lajjÄ« dayÄpanno, sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ« viharati. yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtaá¹ƒ pahÄya pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti, nihitadaá¹‡á¸o nihitasattho lajjÄ« dayÄpanno,
"And how, young sir, is a monk accomplished in virtue (*sÄ«lasampanno*)? Here, young sir, a monk, having abandoned the killing of living beings (*pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtaá¹ƒ pahÄya*), abstains from killing living beings (*pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti*); with rod and weapon laid aside (*nihitadaá¹‡á¸o nihitasattho*), scrupulous (*lajjÄ«*), kindly (*dayÄpanno*), he dwells compassionate to all living beings (*sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ« viharati*). Also, young sir, a monk, having abandoned the killing of living beings (*pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtaá¹ƒ pahÄya*), abstains from killing living beings (*pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti*); with rod and weapon laid aside (*nihitadaá¹‡á¸o nihitasattho*), scrupulous (*lajjÄ«*), kindly (*dayÄpanno*), He dwells, full of compassion for the welfare of all living beings; this, too, pertains to his morality. (As explained extensively in sections 194 to 210). â€œOr, some ascetics and Brahmins, while living on the food offered by the faithful, earn their living by wrong means of livelihood, by such debased arts as: performing appeasement rituals ( *santikamma*), performing vows (*paá¹‡idhikamma*), demonology (*bhÅ«takamma*), inducing virility (*bhÅ«rikamma*), spells to secure success (*vassakamma*), spells to undo previous spells (*vossakamma*), preparing sites for houses (*vatthukamma*), consecrating sites (*vatthuparikamma*), giving ceremonial mouthwashes (*Äcamana*), giving ceremonial bathing (*nhÄpana*), offering sacrificial fires (*juhana*), administering emetics (*vamana*), administering purgatives (*virecana*), administering expectorants (*uddhaá¹ƒvirecana*), administering phlegmagogues (*adhovirecana*), administering head-purge (*sÄ«savirecana*), giving ear-oil (*kaá¹‡á¹‡atelaá¹ƒ*), giving eye-salves (*nettatappanaá¹ƒ*), administering nasal treatments (*natthukammaá¹ƒ*), applying collyrium (*aÃ±janaá¹ƒ*), applying counter-collyrium (*paccaÃ±janaá¹ƒ*), performing eye-surgery (*sÄlÄkiyaá¹ƒ*), performing surgery (*sallakattiyaá¹ƒ*), practicing pediatrics (*dÄrakatikicchÄ*), providing roots as medicine (*mÅ«labhesajjÄnaá¹ƒ anuppadÄnaá¹ƒ*), and dispensing herbal remedies (*osadhÄ«naá¹ƒ paá¹­imokkho*). A monk refrains from such base arts and wrong means of livelihood. And furthermore, young man, a monk refrains from such debased practices whereby some ascetics and Brahmins, while living on the food offered by the faithful, earn their living by wrong means of livelihood, such as performing appeasement rituals (*santikamma*), performing vows (*paá¹‡idhikamma*)â€¦ and dispensing herbal remedies (*osadhÄ«naá¹ƒ paá¹­imokkho*). A monk refrains from such base arts and wrong means of livelihood. This, too, pertains to his morality.
452. sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ« viharati, idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. (yathÄ 194 yÄva 210 anucchedesu evaá¹ƒ vitthÄretabbaá¹ƒ). "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ santikammaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhikammaá¹ƒ bhÅ«takammaá¹ƒ bhÅ«rikammaá¹ƒ vassakammaá¹ƒ vossakammaá¹ƒ vatthukammaá¹ƒ vatthuparikammaá¹ƒ Äcamanaá¹ƒ nhÄpanaá¹ƒ juhanaá¹ƒ vamanaá¹ƒ virecanaá¹ƒ uddhaá¹ƒvirecanaá¹ƒ adhovirecanaá¹ƒ sÄ«savirecanaá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡atelaá¹ƒ nettatappanaá¹ƒ natthukammaá¹ƒ aÃ±janaá¹ƒ paccaÃ±janaá¹ƒ sÄlÄkiyaá¹ƒ sallakattiyaá¹ƒ dÄrakatikicchÄ mÅ«labhesajjÄnaá¹ƒ anuppadÄnaá¹ƒ osadhÄ«naá¹ƒ paá¹­imokkho iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ, santikammaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhikammaá¹ƒâ€¦peâ€¦ osadhÄ«naá¹ƒ paá¹­imokkho iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 452. "sa kho so [ayaá¹ƒ kho so (ka.)], mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasampanno na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato. seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, rÄjÄ khattiyo muddhÄvasitto nihatapaccÄmitto na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ paccatthikato. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasampanno na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato. so iminÄ ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato ajjhattaá¹ƒ anavajjasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu sÄ«lasampanno hoti. 453. "ayaá¹ƒ kho so, mÄá¹‡ava, ariyo sÄ«lakkhandho yassa so bhagavÄ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesi. atthi cevettha uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«ya"nti. "acchariyaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda, abbhutaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda! so cÄyaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda, ariyo sÄ«lakkhandho paripuá¹‡á¹‡o, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡o. evaá¹ƒ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ cÄhaá¹ƒ, bho, Änanda, ariyaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakkhandhaá¹ƒ ito bahiddhÄ aÃ±Ã±esu samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡esu
"Young man, the monk who is thus perfected in morality sees no fear from any side, owing to his being restrained by morality (*sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato*). Just as, young man, a Khattiya king, anointed as king, having defeated his enemies, sees no fear from any side, owing to his having vanquished his adversaries (*paccatthikato*). In the same way, young man, the monk who is thus perfected in morality sees no fear from any side, owing to his being restrained by morality (*sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato*). Possessing this noble aggregate of moral discipline (*arÄ«yena sÄ«lakkhandhena*), he experiences within himself a blameless happiness (*anavajjasukhaá¹ƒ*). In this way, young man, a monk is perfected in morality (*sÄ«lasampanno*).
453. sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ« viharati, idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. (yathÄ 194 yÄva 210 anucchedesu evaá¹ƒ vitthÄretabbaá¹ƒ). "yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ santikammaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhikammaá¹ƒ bhÅ«takammaá¹ƒ bhÅ«rikammaá¹ƒ vassakammaá¹ƒ vossakammaá¹ƒ vatthukammaá¹ƒ vatthuparikammaá¹ƒ Äcamanaá¹ƒ nhÄpanaá¹ƒ juhanaá¹ƒ vamanaá¹ƒ virecanaá¹ƒ uddhaá¹ƒvirecanaá¹ƒ adhovirecanaá¹ƒ sÄ«savirecanaá¹ƒ kaá¹‡á¹‡atelaá¹ƒ nettatappanaá¹ƒ natthukammaá¹ƒ aÃ±janaá¹ƒ paccaÃ±janaá¹ƒ sÄlÄkiyaá¹ƒ sallakattiyaá¹ƒ dÄrakatikicchÄ mÅ«labhesajjÄnaá¹ƒ anuppadÄnaá¹ƒ osadhÄ«naá¹ƒ paá¹­imokkho iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu yathÄ vÄ paneke bhonto samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä saddhÄdeyyÄni bhojanÄni bhuÃ±jitvÄ te evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ƒ kappenti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ, santikammaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhikammaá¹ƒâ€¦peâ€¦ osadhÄ«naá¹ƒ paá¹­imokkho iti vÄ iti evarÅ«pÄya tiracchÄnavijjÄya micchÄjÄ«vÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti. idampissa hoti sÄ«lasmiá¹ƒ. 452. "sa kho so [ayaá¹ƒ kho so (ka.)], mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasampanno na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato. seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, rÄjÄ khattiyo muddhÄvasitto nihatapaccÄmitto na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ paccatthikato. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu evaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasampanno na kutoci bhayaá¹ƒ samanupassati, yadidaá¹ƒ sÄ«lasaá¹ƒvarato. so iminÄ ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato ajjhattaá¹ƒ anavajjasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu sÄ«lasampanno hoti. 453. "ayaá¹ƒ kho so, mÄá¹‡ava, ariyo sÄ«lakkhandho yassa so bhagavÄ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesi. atthi cevettha uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«ya"nti. "acchariyaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda, abbhutaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda! so cÄyaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda, ariyo sÄ«lakkhandho paripuá¹‡á¹‡o, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡o. evaá¹ƒ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ cÄhaá¹ƒ, bho, Änanda, ariyaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakkhandhaá¹ƒ ito bahiddhÄ aÃ±Ã±esu samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡esu
"Young man, this is that noble aggregate of moral discipline (*ariyo sÄ«lakkhandho*) which the Blessed One praised, and with which he inspired, established, and settled this populace. Something more remains to be done here." "It is wonderful, Ä€nanda, it is marvelous, Ä€nanda! This noble aggregate of moral discipline (*ariyo sÄ«lakkhandho*) is perfectly complete, not incomplete. And I do not see this aggregate of moral discipline (*ariyaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakkhandhaá¹ƒ*) thus perfectly complete anywhere outside of this, among other ascetics and Brahmins. I do not perceive. And if, Reverend Ä€nanda, other ascetics and Brahmins were to perceive this complete noble category of virtue in themselves, they would be pleased with just that much, thinking: â€˜Enough has been done! The goal of asceticism has been reached! There is nothing more to be done!â€™ And yet the esteemed Ä€nanda says thus: â€˜But there is still more to be done!â€™ [Immediately after this, sÄ«. pÄ«. The reading "paá¹­hamabhÄá¹‡avÄraá¹ƒ" is seen in the books]. The concentration category.
454. na samanupassÄmi. evaá¹ƒ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aÃ±ca, bho Änanda, ariyaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakkhandhaá¹ƒ ito bahiddhÄ aÃ±Ã±e samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä attani samanupasseyyuá¹ƒ, te tÄvatakeneva attamanÄ assu â€“ â€˜alamettÄvatÄ, katamettÄvatÄ, anuppatto no sÄmaÃ±Ã±attho, natthi no kiÃ±ci uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«yaâ€™nti. atha ca pana bhavaá¹ƒ Änando evamÄha â€“ â€˜atthi cevettha uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«ya"â€™nti [imassa anantaraá¹ƒ sÄ«. pÄ«. potthakesu "paá¹­hamabhÄá¹‡avÄraá¹ƒ"ti pÄá¹­ho dissati]. samÄdhikkhandho 454. "katamo pana so, bho Änanda, ariyo samÄdhikkhandho, yassa so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesÄ«"ti. "kathaÃ±ca, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvÄro hoti? idha, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu cakkhunÄ rÅ«paá¹ƒ disvÄ na nimittaggÄhÄ« hoti nÄnubyaÃ±janaggÄhÄ«, yatvÄdhikaraá¹‡amenaá¹ƒ cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ viharantaá¹ƒ abhijjhÄdomanassÄ pÄpakÄ akusalÄ dhammÄ anvÄssaveyyuá¹ƒ tassa saá¹ƒvarÄya paá¹­ipajjati, rakkhati cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ, cakkhundriye saá¹ƒvaraá¹ƒ Äpajjati. sotena saddaá¹ƒ sutvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ ghÄnena gandhaá¹ƒ ghÄyitvÄâ€¦ jivhÄya rasaá¹ƒ sÄyitvÄâ€¦ kÄyena phoá¹­á¹­habbaá¹ƒ phusitvÄâ€¦ manasÄ dhammaá¹ƒ viÃ±Ã±Äya na nimittaggÄhÄ« hoti nÄnubyaÃ±janaggÄhÄ«, yatvÄdhikaraá¹‡amenaá¹ƒ manindriyaá¹ƒ asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ viharantaá¹ƒ abhijjhÄdomanassÄ pÄpakÄ akusalÄ dhammÄ anvÄssaveyyuá¹ƒ tassa saá¹ƒvarÄya paá¹­ipajjati, rakkhati manindriyaá¹ƒ, manindriye saá¹ƒvaraá¹ƒ Äpajjati. so iminÄ ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato ajjhattaá¹ƒ abyÄsekasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvÄro hoti. 455. "kathaÃ±ca, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti? idha, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu abhikkante paá¹­ikkante sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, Älokite vilokite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, samiÃ±jite pasÄrite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, saá¹…ghÄá¹­ipattacÄ«varadhÄraá¹‡e sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, asite pÄ«te khÄyite sÄyite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, uccÄrapassÄvakamme sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, gate á¹­hite
"What, Ä€nanda, is that noble concentration category, the virtues of which the esteemed Gotama expounded, and in which he encouraged, trained, and established these people?" "And how, young man, does a monk guard the senses? Here, young man, on seeing a form with the eye, a monk does not grasp at its signs and features. Because if he dwells with the eye faculty unrestrained, evil and unwholesome states of longing and sadness might invade him, he practices its restraint, he guards the eye faculty, he undertakes the restraint of the eye faculty. Having heard a sound with the ear...pe... Having smelled an odor with the nose... Having tasted a taste with the tongue... Having felt a tactile object with the body... Having cognized a mental phenomenon with the mind, he does not grasp its signs and features. Since, if he dwells with the mind faculty unrestrained, bad unwholesome states of longing and dejection might invade him, he practices restraint over it, he guards the mind faculty, he undertakes the restraint of the mind faculty. Endowed with this noble restraint of the sense faculties ( *indriyasaá¹ƒvara* ), he experiences within himself unblemished happiness. In this way, young man, a monk is a guardian of the senses.
455. na samanupassÄmi. evaá¹ƒ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aÃ±ca, bho Änanda, ariyaá¹ƒ sÄ«lakkhandhaá¹ƒ ito bahiddhÄ aÃ±Ã±e samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä attani samanupasseyyuá¹ƒ, te tÄvatakeneva attamanÄ assu â€“ â€˜alamettÄvatÄ, katamettÄvatÄ, anuppatto no sÄmaÃ±Ã±attho, natthi no kiÃ±ci uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«yaâ€™nti. atha ca pana bhavaá¹ƒ Änando evamÄha â€“ â€˜atthi cevettha uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«ya"â€™nti [imassa anantaraá¹ƒ sÄ«. pÄ«. potthakesu "paá¹­hamabhÄá¹‡avÄraá¹ƒ"ti pÄá¹­ho dissati]. samÄdhikkhandho 454. "katamo pana so, bho Änanda, ariyo samÄdhikkhandho, yassa so bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesÄ«"ti. "kathaÃ±ca, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvÄro hoti? idha, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu cakkhunÄ rÅ«paá¹ƒ disvÄ na nimittaggÄhÄ« hoti nÄnubyaÃ±janaggÄhÄ«, yatvÄdhikaraá¹‡amenaá¹ƒ cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ viharantaá¹ƒ abhijjhÄdomanassÄ pÄpakÄ akusalÄ dhammÄ anvÄssaveyyuá¹ƒ tassa saá¹ƒvarÄya paá¹­ipajjati, rakkhati cakkhundriyaá¹ƒ, cakkhundriye saá¹ƒvaraá¹ƒ Äpajjati. sotena saddaá¹ƒ sutvÄâ€¦peâ€¦ ghÄnena gandhaá¹ƒ ghÄyitvÄâ€¦ jivhÄya rasaá¹ƒ sÄyitvÄâ€¦ kÄyena phoá¹­á¹­habbaá¹ƒ phusitvÄâ€¦ manasÄ dhammaá¹ƒ viÃ±Ã±Äya na nimittaggÄhÄ« hoti nÄnubyaÃ±janaggÄhÄ«, yatvÄdhikaraá¹‡amenaá¹ƒ manindriyaá¹ƒ asaá¹ƒvutaá¹ƒ viharantaá¹ƒ abhijjhÄdomanassÄ pÄpakÄ akusalÄ dhammÄ anvÄssaveyyuá¹ƒ tassa saá¹ƒvarÄya paá¹­ipajjati, rakkhati manindriyaá¹ƒ, manindriye saá¹ƒvaraá¹ƒ Äpajjati. so iminÄ ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato ajjhattaá¹ƒ abyÄsekasukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvÄro hoti. 455. "kathaÃ±ca, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti? idha, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu abhikkante paá¹­ikkante sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, Älokite vilokite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, samiÃ±jite pasÄrite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, saá¹…ghÄá¹­ipattacÄ«varadhÄraá¹‡e sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, asite pÄ«te khÄyite sÄyite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, uccÄrapassÄvakamme sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, gate á¹­hite
"And how, young man, is a monk endowed with mindfulness and clear comprehension ( *satisampajaÃ±Ã±a* )? Here, young man, a monk is fully aware when going forward and returning; fully aware when looking ahead and looking away; fully aware when flexing and extending his limbs; fully aware when wearing his robes and carrying his outer robe and bowl; fully aware when eating, drinking, consuming food, and tasting; fully aware when defecating or urinating; fully aware when walking, standing, In sitting, in sleeping, in waking, in talking, and in maintaining silence, he acts with full awareness. In this way, young man, the *bhikkhu* is accomplished in mindfulness and clear comprehension.
456. nisinne sutte jÄgarite bhÄsite tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄve sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti. 456. "kathaÃ±ca, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti? idha, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, pakkhÄ« sakuá¹‡o yena yeneva á¸eti, sapattabhÄrova á¸eti, evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti. 457. "so iminÄ ca ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, imÄya ca ariyÄya santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ samannÄgato vivittaá¹ƒ senÄsanaá¹ƒ bhajati araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ pabbataá¹ƒ kandaraá¹ƒ giriguhaá¹ƒ susÄnaá¹ƒ vanapatthaá¹ƒ abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ. so pacchÄbhattaá¹ƒ piá¹‡á¸apÄtappaá¹­ikkanto nisÄ«dati pallaá¹…kaá¹ƒ ÄbhujitvÄ, ujuá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhÄya, parimukhaá¹ƒ satiá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hapetvÄ. 458. "so abhijjhaá¹ƒ loke pahÄya vigatÄbhijjhena cetasÄ viharati abhijjhÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ pahÄya abyÄpannacitto viharati sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ« byÄpÄdapadosÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. thinamiddhaá¹ƒ pahÄya vigatathinamiddho viharati ÄlokasaÃ±Ã±Ä« sato sampajÄno, thinamiddhÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. uddhaccakukkuccaá¹ƒ pahÄya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasantacitto uddhaccakukkuccÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. vicikicchaá¹ƒ pahÄya tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho viharati akathaá¹ƒkathÄ« kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. 459. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante payojeyya. tassa te kammantÄ samijjheyyuá¹ƒ. so yÄni ca porÄá¹‡Äni iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni tÄni ca byantiá¹ƒ kareyya, siyÄ cassa uttariá¹ƒ avasiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ dÄrabharaá¹‡Äya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante
"And how, young man, is a *bhikkhu* content? Here, young man, a *bhikkhu* is content with robes to protect his body (*kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena*) and with almsfood (*piá¹‡á¸apÄta*) to sustain his belly (*kucchiparihÄrikena*). Wherever he goes, he sets out taking only along with him. Just as a bird, young man, wherever it goes, flies with its wings as its only burden, so too, young man, the *bhikkhu* becomes content with robes to protect his body and with almsfood to maintain his stomach. Wherever he goes, he sets out taking only along with him. In this way, young man, the *bhikkhu* is content.

"so iminÄ ca ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, imÄya ca ariyÄya santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ samannÄgato vivittaá¹ƒ senÄsanaá¹ƒ bhajati araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ pabbataá¹ƒ kandaraá¹ƒ giriguhaá¹ƒ susÄnaá¹ƒ vanapatthaá¹ƒ abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ. so pacchÄbhattaá¹ƒ piá¹‡á¸apÄtappaá¹­ikkanto nisÄ«dati pallaá¹…kaá¹ƒ ÄbhujitvÄ, ujuá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhÄya, parimukhaá¹ƒ satiá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hapetvÄ. 458. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante payojeyya. tassa te kammantÄ samijjheyyuá¹ƒ. so yÄni ca porÄá¹‡Äni iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni tÄni ca byantiá¹ƒ kareyya, siyÄ cassa uttariá¹ƒ avasiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ dÄrabharaá¹‡Äya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante
â€œEndowed with this noble aggregate of moral discipline (*arÄ«yena sÄ«lakkhandhena*), this noble restraint over the sense faculties (*indriyasaá¹ƒvarena*), this noble mindfulness and clear comprehension (*satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena*), and this noble contentment (*santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ*), he resorts to a secluded dwellingâ€”a forest (*araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ*), the foot of a tree (*rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ*), a mountain (*pabbataá¹ƒ*), a glen (*kandaraá¹ƒ*), a hillside cave (*giriguhaá¹ƒ*), a cremation ground (*susÄnaá¹ƒ*), a jungle grove (*vanapatthaá¹ƒ*), the open air (*abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ*), a heap of straw (*palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ*). Then, having eaten after his return from the alms-round (*piá¹‡á¸apÄta*), he sits down cross-legged, holding his body erect, and concentrates on keeping mindfulness established before him.
458. nisinne sutte jÄgarite bhÄsite tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄve sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti. 456. "kathaÃ±ca, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti? idha, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, pakkhÄ« sakuá¹‡o yena yeneva á¸eti, sapattabhÄrova á¸eti, evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti kÄyaparihÄrikena cÄ«varena kucchiparihÄrikena piá¹‡á¸apÄtena. so yena yeneva pakkamati, samÄdÄyeva pakkamati. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu santuá¹­á¹­ho hoti. 457. "so iminÄ ca ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, imÄya ca ariyÄya santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ samannÄgato vivittaá¹ƒ senÄsanaá¹ƒ bhajati araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ pabbataá¹ƒ kandaraá¹ƒ giriguhaá¹ƒ susÄnaá¹ƒ vanapatthaá¹ƒ abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ. so pacchÄbhattaá¹ƒ piá¹‡á¸apÄtappaá¹­ikkanto nisÄ«dati pallaá¹…kaá¹ƒ ÄbhujitvÄ, ujuá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhÄya, parimukhaá¹ƒ satiá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hapetvÄ. 458. "so abhijjhaá¹ƒ loke pahÄya vigatÄbhijjhena cetasÄ viharati abhijjhÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ pahÄya abyÄpannacitto viharati sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ« byÄpÄdapadosÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. thinamiddhaá¹ƒ pahÄya vigatathinamiddho viharati ÄlokasaÃ±Ã±Ä« sato sampajÄno, thinamiddhÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. uddhaccakukkuccaá¹ƒ pahÄya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasantacitto uddhaccakukkuccÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. vicikicchaá¹ƒ pahÄya tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho viharati akathaá¹ƒkathÄ« kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. 459. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante payojeyya. tassa te kammantÄ samijjheyyuá¹ƒ. so yÄni ca porÄá¹‡Äni iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni tÄni ca byantiá¹ƒ kareyya, siyÄ cassa uttariá¹ƒ avasiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ dÄrabharaá¹‡Äya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante
"Abandoning covetousness (*abhijjhaá¹ƒ*) for the world, he abides with a mind free from covetousness; he purifies his mind from covetousness (*abhijjhaá¹ƒ*). Abandoning ill will and hatred (*byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ*), he abides with a mind free from ill will, compassionate for the welfare of all living beings (*sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ«*); he purifies his mind from ill will and hatred. Abandoning sloth and torpor (*thinamiddhaá¹ƒ*), he abides free from sloth and torpor, percipient of light (*ÄlokasaÃ±Ã±Ä«*), mindful and fully aware (*sato sampajÄno*); he purifies his mind from sloth and torpor. Abandoning restlessness and remorse (*uddhaccakukkuccaá¹ƒ*), he abides unagitated with a mind inwardly peaceful (*ajjhattaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasantacitto*); he purifies his mind from restlessness and remorse. Abandoning doubt (*vicikicchaá¹ƒ*), he abides having gone beyond doubt, unperplexed about wholesome states (*kusalesu dhammesu*); he purifies his mind from doubt.
459. nisinne sutte jÄgarite bhÄsite tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄve sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti. evaá¹ƒ kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato hoti. 456. "so iminÄ ca ariyena sÄ«lakkhandhena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena indriyasaá¹ƒvarena samannÄgato, iminÄ ca ariyena satisampajaÃ±Ã±ena samannÄgato, imÄya ca ariyÄya santuá¹­á¹­hiyÄ samannÄgato vivittaá¹ƒ senÄsanaá¹ƒ bhajati araÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rukkhamÅ«laá¹ƒ pabbataá¹ƒ kandaraá¹ƒ giriguhaá¹ƒ susÄnaá¹ƒ vanapatthaá¹ƒ abbhokÄsaá¹ƒ palÄlapuÃ±jaá¹ƒ. so pacchÄbhattaá¹ƒ piá¹‡á¸apÄtappaá¹­ikkanto nisÄ«dati pallaá¹…kaá¹ƒ ÄbhujitvÄ, ujuá¹ƒ kÄyaá¹ƒ paá¹‡idhÄya, parimukhaá¹ƒ satiá¹ƒ upaá¹­á¹­hapetvÄ. 458. "so abhijjhaá¹ƒ loke pahÄya vigatÄbhijjhena cetasÄ viharati abhijjhÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. byÄpÄdapadosaá¹ƒ pahÄya abyÄpannacitto viharati sabbapÄá¹‡abhÅ«tahitÄnukampÄ« byÄpÄdapadosÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. thinamiddhaá¹ƒ pahÄya vigatathinamiddho viharati ÄlokasaÃ±Ã±Ä« sato sampajÄno, thinamiddhÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. uddhaccakukkuccaá¹ƒ pahÄya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasantacitto uddhaccakukkuccÄ cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. vicikicchaá¹ƒ pahÄya tiá¹‡á¹‡avicikiccho viharati akathaá¹ƒkathÄ« kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchÄya cittaá¹ƒ parisodheti. 459. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante payojeyya. tassa te kammantÄ samijjheyyuá¹ƒ. so yÄni ca porÄá¹‡Äni iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni tÄni ca byantiá¹ƒ kareyya, siyÄ cassa uttariá¹ƒ avasiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ dÄrabharaá¹‡Äya. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya kammante
"Just as, young man, a man were to take a loan (*iá¹‡aá¹ƒ ÄdÄya*) and apply it to his business (*kammante payojeyya*). And his business were to succeed. So that he might pay off his old debts (*iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni*), and with what was left over could support a wife (*dÄrabharaá¹‡Äya*). He might think: â€œBefore this I developed my business by borrowing. And my business succeeded. And I have paid off my old debts, and there is something left over for supporting a wife.â€ And as a result he would become glad and experience joy.
460. payojesiá¹ƒ. tassa me te kammantÄ samijjhiá¹ƒsu. sohaá¹ƒ yÄni ca porÄá¹‡Äni iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni tÄni ca byantiá¹ƒ akÄsiá¹ƒ, atthi ca me uttariá¹ƒ avasiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ dÄrabharaá¹‡ÄyÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 460. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso ÄbÄdhiko assa dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±cassa nacchÄdeyya, na cassa kÄye balamattÄ. so aparena samayena tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mucceyya, bhattaÃ±cassa chÄdeyya, siyÄ cassa kÄye balamattÄ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe ÄbÄdhiko ahosiá¹ƒ dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±ca me nacchÄdesi, na ca me Äsi kÄye balamattÄ. somhi etarahi tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mutto bhattaÃ±ca me chÄdeti, atthi ca me kÄye balamattÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 461. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso bandhanÄgÄre baddho assa. so aparena samayena tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ mucceyya sotthinÄ abbhayena, na cassa kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe bandhanÄgÄre baddho ahosiá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ mutto sotthinÄ abbhayena, natthi ca me kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 462. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso dÄso assa anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. so aparena samayena tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mucceyya, attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe dÄso ahosiá¹ƒ anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. somhi etarahi tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mutto attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 463. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjeyya dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. so aparena samayena taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthareyya, sotthinÄ gÄmantaá¹ƒ anupÄpuá¹‡eyya khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. tassa
"Or suppose, young man, a man were afflicted, suffering and gravely ill (*ÄbÄdhiko dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno*), and his food would not agree with him and his body had no strength. But later he would recover from the affliction (*ÄbÄdhÄ*), and his food would agree with him and his body would regain strength. He might think: â€œBefore this I was ill, suffering and gravely ill, and my food did not agree with me and my body had no strength. But now I have recovered from that illness, and my food agrees with me, and my body has regained strength.â€ And as a result he would become glad and experience joy.

"seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso ÄbÄdhiko assa dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±cassa nacchÄdeyya, na cassa kÄye balamattÄ. so aparena samayena tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mucceyya, bhattaÃ±cassa chÄdeyya, siyÄ cassa kÄye balamattÄ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe ÄbÄdhiko ahosiá¹ƒ dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±ca me nacchÄdesi, na ca me Äsi kÄye balamattÄ. somhi etarahi tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mutto bhattaÃ±ca me chÄdeti, atthi ca me kÄye balamattÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 461. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjeyya dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. so aparena samayena taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthareyya, sotthinÄ gÄmantaá¹ƒ anupÄpuá¹‡eyya khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. tassa
"Or suppose, young man, a man were locked up in a prison (*bandhanÄgÄre baddho*). After some time he would be released from prison, safe and secure, with no loss of his possessions (*bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayo*). He might think: â€œBefore this I was in prison. But now I have been released from that prison, safe and secure, and I have suffered no loss of possessions.â€ And as a result he would become glad and experience joy.

"seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso ÄbÄdhiko assa dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±cassa nacchÄdeyya, na cassa kÄye balamattÄ. so aparena samayena tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mucceyya, bhattaÃ±cassa chÄdeyya, siyÄ cassa kÄye balamattÄ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe ÄbÄdhiko ahosiá¹ƒ dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±ca me nacchÄdesi, na ca me Äsi kÄye balamattÄ. somhi etarahi tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mutto bhattaÃ±ca me chÄdeti, atthi ca me kÄye balamattÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 461. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjeyya dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. so aparena samayena taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthareyya, sotthinÄ gÄmantaá¹ƒ anupÄpuá¹‡eyya khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. tassa
"Or suppose, young man, a man were a slave (*dÄso*), without independence (*anattÄdhÄ«no*), subservient to others (*parÄdhÄ«no*), unable to go where he wants (*na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo*). After some time, he would be released from that slavery, self-dependent, independent of others, a free man able to go where he wants. He might think: "Before this, I was a slave, not self-dependent, dependent on others, not able to go where I wanted. Now at this time, I am freed from that slavery, self-dependent, independent of others, a free man able to go where I want." As a result of that, he would gain joy (*prÄmojjaá¹ƒ*) and experience gladness (*saumanassaá¹ƒ*).
463. payojesiá¹ƒ. tassa me te kammantÄ samijjhiá¹ƒsu. sohaá¹ƒ yÄni ca porÄá¹‡Äni iá¹‡amÅ«lÄni tÄni ca byantiá¹ƒ akÄsiá¹ƒ, atthi ca me uttariá¹ƒ avasiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ dÄrabharaá¹‡ÄyÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 460. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso ÄbÄdhiko assa dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±cassa nacchÄdeyya, na cassa kÄye balamattÄ. so aparena samayena tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mucceyya, bhattaÃ±cassa chÄdeyya, siyÄ cassa kÄye balamattÄ. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe ÄbÄdhiko ahosiá¹ƒ dukkhito bÄá¸·hagilÄno, bhattaÃ±ca me nacchÄdesi, na ca me Äsi kÄye balamattÄ. somhi etarahi tamhÄ ÄbÄdhÄ mutto bhattaÃ±ca me chÄdeti, atthi ca me kÄye balamattÄâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 461. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso bandhanÄgÄre baddho assa. so aparena samayena tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ mucceyya sotthinÄ abbhayena, na cassa kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe bandhanÄgÄre baddho ahosiá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi tamhÄ bandhanÄgÄrÄ mutto sotthinÄ abbhayena, natthi ca me kiÃ±ci bhogÄnaá¹ƒ vayoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 462. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso dÄso assa anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. so aparena samayena tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mucceyya, attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. tassa evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe dÄso ahosiá¹ƒ anattÄdhÄ«no parÄdhÄ«no na yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamo. somhi etarahi tamhÄ dÄsabyÄ mutto attÄdhÄ«no aparÄdhÄ«no bhujisso yenakÄmaá¹ƒgamoâ€™ti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 463. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjeyya dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. so aparena samayena taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthareyya, sotthinÄ gÄmantaá¹ƒ anupÄpuá¹‡eyya khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. tassa
"Just as, young man, a person with wealth and possessions might travel a desert road, where food is scarce and dangers abound. After some time, he would cross that desert, and arrive safely at a village, secure and free from danger. Thus he might think: 'Before this, I, with wealth and possessions, undertook a dangerous and frightening journey through the wilderness. Now I have safely crossed the wilderness, reached the edge of the village in safety, and am free from fear.' Then, as a result, he would gain joy (*pÄmojjaá¹ƒ*) and attain gladness (*somanassaá¹ƒ*).
464. evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjiá¹ƒ dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthiá¹‡á¹‡o, sotthinÄ gÄmantaá¹ƒ anuppatto khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaâ€™nti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 464. "evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu yathÄ iá¹‡aá¹ƒ yathÄ rogaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ yathÄ dÄsabyaá¹ƒ yathÄ kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ, evaá¹ƒ ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e appahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 465. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, yathÄ Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ yathÄ Ärogyaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ yathÄ bhujissaá¹ƒ yathÄ khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ. evameva bhikkhu ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 466. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. 467. "so vivicceva kÄmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, dakkho nhÄpako vÄ nhÄpakantevÄsÄ« vÄ kaá¹ƒsathÄle nhÄnÄ«yacuá¹‡á¹‡Äni ÄkiritvÄ udakena paripphosakaá¹ƒ paripphosakaá¹ƒ sandeyya. sÄyaá¹ƒ nhÄnÄ«yapiá¹‡á¸i snehÄnugatÄ snehaparetÄ santarabÄhirÄ phuá¹­Ä snehena, na ca paggharaá¹‡Ä«. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu vivicceva kÄmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato
"Just so, MÄá¹‡ava, a *bhikkhu* sees these five hindrances (*paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e*) as unabandoned within himself, like a debt, a disease, a prison, slavery, or a dangerous wilderness road (*kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ*).
465. evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjiá¹ƒ dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthiá¹‡á¹‡o, sotthinÄ gÄmantaá¹ƒ anuppatto khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaâ€™nti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 464. "Just as, MÄá¹‡ava, it is like freedom from debt (*Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ*), like good health (*Ärogyaá¹ƒ*), like release from prison (*bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ*), like freedom from slavery (*bhujissaá¹ƒ*), like a safe land (*khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ*). Just so, a *bhikkhu* sees these five hindrances (*paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e*) as abandoned within himself.
466. evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjiá¹ƒ dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthiá¹‡á¹‡o, sotthinÄ gÄmantaá¹ƒ anuppatto khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaâ€™nti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 464. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. 467. "so vivicceva kÄmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, dakkho nhÄpako vÄ nhÄpakantevÄsÄ« vÄ kaá¹ƒsathÄle nhÄnÄ«yacuá¹‡á¹‡Äni ÄkiritvÄ udakena paripphosakaá¹ƒ paripphosakaá¹ƒ sandeyya. sÄyaá¹ƒ nhÄnÄ«yapiá¹‡á¸i snehÄnugatÄ snehaparetÄ santarabÄhirÄ phuá¹­Ä snehena, na ca paggharaá¹‡Ä«. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu vivicceva kÄmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato
"When he sees these five hindrances (*paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e*) as abandoned within himself, gladness (*pÄmojjaá¹ƒ*) arises. When he is gladdened, rapture (*pÄ«ti*) arises. When his mind is filled with rapture (*pÄ«timanassa*), his body becomes tranquil (*passambhati*); with a tranquil body (*passaddhakÄyo*), he experiences happiness (*sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti*); being happy (*sukhino*), his mind becomes concentrated (*samÄdhiyati*).
467. evamassa â€“ â€˜ahaá¹ƒ kho pubbe sadhano sabhogo kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ paá¹­ipajjiá¹ƒ dubbhikkhaá¹ƒ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹ƒ. somhi etarahi kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthiá¹‡á¹‡o, sotthinÄ gÄmantaá¹ƒ anuppatto khemaá¹ƒ appaá¹­ibhayaâ€™nti. so tatonidÄnaá¹ƒ labhetha pÄmojjaá¹ƒ, adhigaccheyya somanassaá¹ƒ. 464. "evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu yathÄ iá¹‡aá¹ƒ yathÄ rogaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄgÄraá¹ƒ yathÄ dÄsabyaá¹ƒ yathÄ kantÄraddhÄnamaggaá¹ƒ, evaá¹ƒ ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e appahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 465. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, yathÄ Äá¹‡aá¹‡yaá¹ƒ yathÄ Ärogyaá¹ƒ yathÄ bandhanÄmokkhaá¹ƒ yathÄ bhujissaá¹ƒ yathÄ khemantabhÅ«miá¹ƒ. evameva bhikkhu ime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassati. 466. "tassime paÃ±ca nÄ«varaá¹‡e pahÄ«ne attani samanupassato pÄmojjaá¹ƒ jÄyati, pamuditassa pÄ«ti jÄyati, pÄ«timanassa kÄyo passambhati, passaddhakÄyo sukhaá¹ƒ vedeti, sukhino cittaá¹ƒ samÄdhiyati. 467. "so vivicceva kÄmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, dakkho nhÄpako vÄ nhÄpakantevÄsÄ« vÄ kaá¹ƒsathÄle nhÄnÄ«yacuá¹‡á¹‡Äni ÄkiritvÄ udakena paripphosakaá¹ƒ paripphosakaá¹ƒ sandeyya. sÄyaá¹ƒ nhÄnÄ«yapiá¹‡á¸i snehÄnugatÄ snehaparetÄ santarabÄhirÄ phuá¹­Ä snehena, na ca paggharaá¹‡Ä«. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu vivicceva kÄmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato
"Quite secluded from sense pleasures (*kÄmehi*), secluded from unwholesome states (*akusalehi dhammehi*), with applied and sustained thought (*savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ*), he enters and remains in the first *jhÄna*, which is with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion (*vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati*). He drenches, steeps, saturates, and suffuses this very body (*kÄyaá¹ƒ*) with the rapture and happiness born of seclusion (*vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena*), so that there is no part of his entire body which is not suffused by this rapture and happiness born of seclusion (*vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti*). "Just as, MÄá¹‡ava, a skilled bath man or a bath manâ€™s apprentice pours bath powder into a metal basin, sprinkles it with water, and kneads it bit by bit. The ball of bath powder becomes permeated and saturated inside and out with moisture, yet does not drip. Just so, MÄá¹‡ava, a *bhikkhu* drenches, steeps, saturates, and suffuses this very body (*kÄyaá¹ƒ*) with the rapture and happiness born of seclusion (*vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena*), so that there is no part of his entire body which is not suffused by this rapture and happiness born of seclusion (*vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti*). And further, MÄá¹‡ava, the *bhikkhu*, quite secluded from sense pleasures (*kÄmehi*), secluded from unwholesome states (*akusalehi dhammehi*), with applied and sustained thought (*savitakkaá¹ƒ savicÄraá¹ƒ*), enters and remains in the first *jhÄna*, which is with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion (*vivekajaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ paá¹­hamaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati*). He drenches, steeps, saturates, and suffuses this very body (*kÄyaá¹ƒ*) with the rapture and happiness born of seclusion (*vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena*), so that there is no part of his entire ...so that there is no part of his body unpervaded by the rapture and pleasure born of seclusion. This comes to him through concentration.
468. kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampissa hoti samÄdhismiá¹ƒ. 468. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu vitakkavicÄrÄnaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasamÄ ajjhattaá¹ƒ sampasÄdanaá¹ƒ cetaso ekodibhÄvaá¹ƒ avitakkaá¹ƒ avicÄraá¹ƒ samÄdhijaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ dutiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, udakarahado gambhÄ«ro ubbhidodako. tassa nevassa puratthimÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na dakkhiá¹‡Äya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na pacchimÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na uttarÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, devo ca na kÄlena kÄlaá¹ƒ sammÄ dhÄraá¹ƒ anupaveccheyya. atha kho tamhÄva udakarahadÄ sÄ«tÄ vÄridhÄrÄ ubbhijjitvÄ tameva udakarahadaá¹ƒ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisandeyya parisandeyya paripÅ«reyya paripphareyya, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato udakarahadassa sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhuâ€¦peâ€¦ yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu vitakkavicÄrÄnaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasamÄâ€¦ peâ€¦ dutiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati, so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampissa hoti samÄdhismiá¹ƒ. 469. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu pÄ«tiyÄ ca virÄgÄ upekkhako ca viharati sato sampajÄno, sukhaÃ±ca kÄyena paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti, yaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ ariyÄ Äcikkhanti â€“ "upekkhako satimÄ sukhavihÄrÄ«"ti, tatiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ nippÄ«tikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa nippÄ«tikena sukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, uppaliniyaá¹ƒ vÄ paduminiyaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kiniyaá¹ƒ vÄ appekaccÄni uppalÄni vÄ padumÄni vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄni vÄ udake jÄtÄni udake saá¹ƒvaá¸á¸hÄni udakÄnuggatÄni antonimuggaposÄ«ni, tÄni yÄva caggÄ yÄva ca mÅ«lÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisannÄni parisannÄni paripÅ«rÄni paripphuá¹­Äni, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvataá¹ƒ uppalÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ padumÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄnaá¹ƒ
"Again, mÄá¹‡ava, with the stilling of applied and sustained thought, a *bhiká¹£u* enters upon and abides in the second *jhÄna*, which has self-confidence and singleness of mind without applied and sustained thought, with rapture and pleasure born of concentration. And with this delight and joy born of concentration he so suffuses his body that no spot remains untouched. "Just as though there were a lake whose waters welled up from below. It would have no inlet for water from the east, west, north, or south, nor would it be refilled from time to time with showers of rain; then the cool fount of water welling up in the lake would make the cool water drench, steep, fill, and pervade the lake, so that there would be no part of the whole lake unpervaded by cool water. So too, mÄá¹‡ava, a *bhiká¹£u*â€¦peâ€¦ with the subsiding of thinking and ponderingâ€¦ peâ€¦ enters and remains in the second *jhÄna*, so he makes the rapture and pleasure born of concentration drench, steep, fill, and pervade this body, so that there is no part of his whole body unpervaded by the rapture and pleasure born of concentration. This comes to him through concentration.
469. kÄyassa vivekajena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampissa hoti samÄdhismiá¹ƒ. 468. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu vitakkavicÄrÄnaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasamÄ ajjhattaá¹ƒ sampasÄdanaá¹ƒ cetaso ekodibhÄvaá¹ƒ avitakkaá¹ƒ avicÄraá¹ƒ samÄdhijaá¹ƒ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ƒ dutiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, udakarahado gambhÄ«ro ubbhidodako. tassa nevassa puratthimÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na dakkhiá¹‡Äya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na pacchimÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, na uttarÄya disÄya udakassa Äyamukhaá¹ƒ, devo ca na kÄlena kÄlaá¹ƒ sammÄ dhÄraá¹ƒ anupaveccheyya. atha kho tamhÄva udakarahadÄ sÄ«tÄ vÄridhÄrÄ ubbhijjitvÄ tameva udakarahadaá¹ƒ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisandeyya parisandeyya paripÅ«reyya paripphareyya, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato udakarahadassa sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhuâ€¦peâ€¦ yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu vitakkavicÄrÄnaá¹ƒ vÅ«pasamÄâ€¦ peâ€¦ dutiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati, so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa samÄdhijena pÄ«tisukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampissa hoti samÄdhismiá¹ƒ. 469. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu pÄ«tiyÄ ca virÄgÄ upekkhako ca viharati sato sampajÄno, sukhaÃ±ca kÄyena paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti, yaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ ariyÄ Äcikkhanti â€“ "upekkhako satimÄ sukhavihÄrÄ«"ti, tatiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ nippÄ«tikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa nippÄ«tikena sukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, uppaliniyaá¹ƒ vÄ paduminiyaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kiniyaá¹ƒ vÄ appekaccÄni uppalÄni vÄ padumÄni vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄni vÄ udake jÄtÄni udake saá¹ƒvaá¸á¸hÄni udakÄnuggatÄni antonimuggaposÄ«ni, tÄni yÄva caggÄ yÄva ca mÅ«lÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ abhisannÄni parisannÄni paripÅ«rÄni paripphuá¹­Äni, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvataá¹ƒ uppalÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ padumÄnaá¹ƒ vÄ puá¹‡á¸arÄ«kÄnaá¹ƒ
"Again, mÄá¹‡ava, with the fading away as well of rapture, a *bhiká¹£u* abides in equanimity, and mindful and fully aware, still feeling pleasure with the body, he enters upon and abides in the third *jhÄna*, on account of which noble ones announce: â€˜He has a pleasant abiding who has equanimity and is mindful.â€™ And with this joy devoid of delight he so suffuses his body that no spot remains untouched. "Just as in a pond of blue or red or white lotuses, some lotuses that are born and grow in the water thrive immersed in the water without rising out of it, and cool water drenches, steeps, fills, and pervades them to their tips and their roots, so that there is no part of all those lotuses unpervaded by cool water; There he dwells, mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the air, abiding in glory. And he continues thus for a long, long period of time.
470. vÄ sÄ«tena vÄrinÄ apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhuâ€¦peâ€¦ yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu pÄ«tiyÄ ca virÄgÄâ€¦peâ€¦ tatiyaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ nippÄ«tikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripÅ«reti parippharati, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa nippÄ«tikena sukhena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampissa hoti samÄdhismiá¹ƒ. 470. "puna caparaá¹ƒ, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahÄnÄ dukkhassa ca pahÄnÄ pubbeva somanassadomanassÄnaá¹ƒ atthaá¹…gamÄ adukkhamasukhaá¹ƒ upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhiá¹ƒ catutthaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena pharitvÄ nisinno hoti, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. "seyyathÄpi, mÄá¹‡ava, puriso odÄtena vatthena sasÄ«saá¹ƒ pÄrupitvÄ nisinno assa, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa odÄtena vatthena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ assa. evameva kho, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhuâ€¦peâ€¦ yampi, mÄá¹‡ava, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahÄnÄ dukkhassa ca pahÄnÄ pubbeva somanassadomanassÄnaá¹ƒ atthaá¹…gamÄ adukkhamasukhaá¹ƒ upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhiá¹ƒ catutthaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ upasampajja viharati. so imameva kÄyaá¹ƒ parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena pharitvÄ nisinno hoti, nÄssa kiÃ±ci sabbÄvato kÄyassa parisuddhena cetasÄ pariyodÄtena apphuá¹­aá¹ƒ hoti. idampissa hoti samÄdhismiá¹ƒ. 471. "ayaá¹ƒ kho so, mÄá¹‡ava, ariyo samÄdhikkhandho yassa so bhagavÄ vaá¹‡á¹‡avÄdÄ« ahosi, yattha ca imaá¹ƒ janataá¹ƒ samÄdapesi nivesesi patiá¹­á¹­hÄpesi. atthi cevettha uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«ya"nti. "acchariyaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda, abbhutaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda! so cÄyaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda, ariyo samÄdhikkhandho paripuá¹‡á¹‡o, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡o. evaá¹ƒ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ cÄhaá¹ƒ, bho Änanda, ariyaá¹ƒ samÄdhikkhandhaá¹ƒ ito bahiddhÄ aÃ±Ã±esu samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡esu na samanupassÄmi. evaá¹ƒ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aÃ±ca, bho Änanda, ariyaá¹ƒ samÄdhikkhandhaá¹ƒ ito bahiddhÄ aÃ±Ã±e samaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä attani samanupasseyyuá¹ƒ, te tÄvatakeneva attamanÄ assu â€“ â€˜alamettÄvatÄ, katamettÄvatÄ, anuppatto no sÄmaÃ±Ã±attho, natthi no kiÃ±ci uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«yaâ€™nti. atha ca pana bhavaá¹ƒ Änando evamÄha â€“ â€˜atthi cevettha uttarikaraá¹‡Ä«ya"â€™nti.
â€œAgain, young man, with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous disappearance of joy and grief, a *bhikkhu* enters upon and abides in the fourth *jhÄna*, which has neither-pain-nor-pleasure and purity of mindfulness due to equanimity (*upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhiá¹ƒ catutthaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ*). He sits pervading this body with a pure bright mind, so that there is no part of his entire body not suffused by the pure bright mind. "Just as if, young man, a man were sitting covered from head to foot in a white garment, so that there would be no part of his entire body not suffused by the white cloth. Even so, young man, a *bhikkhu*â€¦ with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous disappearance of joy and grief, a *bhikkhu* enters upon and abides in the fourth *jhÄna*, which has neither-pain-nor-pleasure and purity of mindfulness due to equanimity (*upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhiá¹ƒ catutthaá¹ƒ jhÄnaá¹ƒ*). He sits pervading this body with a pure bright mind, so that there is no part of his entire body not suffused by the pure bright mind. This comes to him through concentration (*samÄdhi*).
