"atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu yena vasavattÄ« devaputto tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ vasavattiá¹ƒ devaputtaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? evaá¹ƒ vutte, kevaá¹­á¹­a, vasavattÄ« devaputto taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na jÄnÄmi yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«ti. atthi kho, bhikkhu, brahmakÄyikÄ nÄma devÄ amhehi abhikkantatarÄ ca paá¹‡Ä«tatarÄ ca. te kho etaá¹ƒ jÄneyyuá¹ƒ, yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti. 493. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu tathÄrÅ«paá¹ƒ samÄdhiá¹ƒ samÄpajji, yathÄsamÄhite citte brahmayÄniyo maggo pÄturahosi. atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu yena brahmakÄyikÄ devÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ brahmakÄyike deve etadavoca â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? evaá¹ƒ vutte, kevaá¹­á¹­a, brahmakÄyikÄ devÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jÄnÄma, yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«ti. atthi kho, bhikkhu, brahmÄ mahÄbrahmÄ abhibhÅ« anabhibhÅ«to aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso vasavattÄ«
Then that monk, Kevatta, approached the deva-son Vasavatti, and having approached, said this to the deva-son Vasavatti: 'Where, friend, do these four great elements cease without remainder, namely, the earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), the water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), the fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and the air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*)?' When this was said, Kevatta, the deva-son Vasavatti said this to that monk: 'I also, monk, do not know where these four great elements cease without remainder, namely, the earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), the water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), the fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and the air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*). Furthermore, monk, the Brahmakayika gods exist, and are more eminent and refined than us. They would know where the four great elements cease without remainder, namely, the earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), the water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), the fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and the air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*).
493. na jÄnÄmi, yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«ti. atthi kho, bhikkhu, yÄmÄ nÄma devÄâ€¦peâ€¦ suyÄmo nÄma devaputtoâ€¦ tusitÄ nÄma devÄâ€¦ santussito nÄma devaputtoâ€¦ nimmÄnaratÄ« nÄma devÄ â€¦ sunimmito nÄma devaputtoâ€¦ paranimmitavasavattÄ« nÄma devÄâ€¦ vasavattÄ« nÄma devaputto amhehi abhikkantataro ca paá¹‡Ä«tataro ca. so kho etaá¹ƒ jÄneyya, yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti. 492. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu yena vasavattÄ« devaputto tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ vasavattiá¹ƒ devaputtaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? evaá¹ƒ vutte, kevaá¹­á¹­a, vasavattÄ« devaputto taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na jÄnÄmi yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«ti. atthi kho, bhikkhu, brahmakÄyikÄ nÄma devÄ amhehi abhikkantatarÄ ca paá¹‡Ä«tatarÄ ca. te kho etaá¹ƒ jÄneyyuá¹ƒ, yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti. 493. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu tathÄrÅ«paá¹ƒ samÄdhiá¹ƒ samÄpajji, yathÄsamÄhite citte brahmayÄniyo maggo pÄturahosi. atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu yena brahmakÄyikÄ devÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ brahmakÄyike deve etadavoca â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? evaá¹ƒ vutte, kevaá¹­á¹­a, brahmakÄyikÄ devÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavocuá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jÄnÄma, yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«ti. atthi kho, bhikkhu, brahmÄ mahÄbrahmÄ abhibhÅ« anabhibhÅ«to aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso vasavattÄ«
Then that monk, Kevatta, attained to such a state of concentration (*samÄdhi*) that the path to the Brahma-world (*brahmayÄniyo maggo*) became visible in his mind that was concentrated. Then that monk, Kevatta, approached the Brahmakayika gods, and having approached, said this to the Brahmakayika gods: 'Where, friend, do these four great elements cease without remainder, namely, the earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), the water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), the fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and the air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*)?' When this was said, Kevatta, the Brahmakayika gods said this to that monk: 'We also, monk, do not know where these four great elements cease without remainder, namely, the earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), the water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), the fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and the air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*). Furthermore, monk, BrahmÄ, the Great BrahmÄ (*mahÄbrahmÄ*), the Conqueror (*abhibhÅ«*), the Unconquered (*anabhibhÅ«to*), the All-seeing (*aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso*), the All-Powerful (*vasavattÄ«*). He is the Lord, the Maker, the Creator, the Best, the Organizer, the Controller, the Father of Beings, loftier and more excellent than we. He would know where the four great elements cease without remainder, namely, the earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), the water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), the fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and the air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*). â€œWhere, friend, is the Great Brahma now?â€ â€œMonk, we do not know when, where, or how Brahma will appear. But when the signs appearâ€”when a light is born, a radiance shines forthâ€”then Brahma will appear. These signs are a prior indication of Brahmaâ€™s appearance: a light is born, a radiance shines forth.â€ Then, the Great Brahma, Kevatta, appeared not long after.
494. issaro kattÄ nimmÄtÄ seá¹­á¹­ho sajitÄ vasÄ« pitÄ bhÅ«tabhabyÄnaá¹ƒ amhehi abhikkantataro ca paá¹‡Ä«tataro ca. so kho etaá¹ƒ jÄneyya, yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«"ti. "â€˜kahaá¹ƒ panÄvuso, etarahi so mahÄbrahmÄâ€™ti? â€˜mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jÄnÄma, yattha vÄ brahmÄ yena vÄ brahmÄ yahiá¹ƒ vÄ brahmÄ, api ca, bhikkhu, yathÄ nimittÄ dissanti, Äloko saÃ±jÄyati, obhÄso pÄtubhavati, brahmÄ pÄtubhavissati, brahmuno hetaá¹ƒ pubbanimittaá¹ƒ pÄtubhÄvÄya, yadidaá¹ƒ Äloko saÃ±jÄyati, obhÄso pÄtubhavatÄ«â€™ti. atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, mahÄbrahmÄ nacirasseva pÄturahosi. 494. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu yena so mahÄbrahmÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ taá¹ƒ mahÄbrahmÄnaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«"ti? evaá¹ƒ vutte, kevaá¹­á¹­a, so mahÄbrahmÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜ahamasmi, bhikkhu, brahmÄ mahÄbrahmÄ abhibhÅ« anabhibhÅ«to aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso vasavattÄ« issaro kattÄ nimmÄtÄ seá¹­á¹­ho sajitÄ vasÄ« pitÄ bhÅ«tabhabyÄnaâ€™nti. "dutiyampi kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu taá¹ƒ mahÄbrahmÄnaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜na khohaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ, Ävuso, evaá¹ƒ pucchÄmi â€“ "tvamasi brahmÄ mahÄbrahmÄ abhibhÅ« anabhibhÅ«to aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso vasavattÄ« issaro kattÄ nimmÄtÄ seá¹­á¹­ho sajitÄ vasÄ« pitÄ bhÅ«tabhabyÄna"nti. evaÃ±ca kho ahaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ, Ävuso, pucchÄmi â€“ "kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«"â€™ti? "dutiyampi kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, mahÄbrahmÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜ahamasmi, bhikkhu, brahmÄ mahÄbrahmÄ abhibhÅ« anabhibhÅ«to aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso vasavattÄ« issaro kattÄ nimmÄtÄ seá¹­á¹­ho sajitÄ vasÄ« pitÄ bhÅ«tabhabyÄnaâ€™nti. tatiyampi kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu taá¹ƒ mahÄbrahmÄnaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜na khohaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ, Ävuso, evaá¹ƒ pucchÄmi â€“ "tvamasi brahmÄ mahÄbrahmÄ
Then, Kevatta, that monk approached the Great Brahma and said to him: "Where, friend, do these four great elementsâ€”namely, the earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), the water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), the fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and the air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*)â€”cease without remainder?" When this was said, Kevatta, the Great Brahma said to that monk: "I am, monk, BrahmÄ, Great BrahmÄ, the Conqueror, the Unconquered, the All-Seeing, the All-Powerful, the Lord, the Maker, the Creator, the Best, the Organizer, the Controller, the Father of All That Have Been and Shall Be." The monk said a second time, "Friend, I am not asking whether you are BrahmÄ, Great BrahmÄ, the Conqueror, the Unconquered, the All-Seeing, the All-Powerful, the Lord, the Maker, the Creator, the Best, the Organizer, the Controller, the Father of All That Have Been and Shall Be." And so I ask you, friend, where do these four great elements â€“ namely, the earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), the water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), the fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and the air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*) â€“ cease without remainder?" The Great Brahma said to the monk for the second time: "I am, monk, BrahmÄ, Great BrahmÄ, the Conqueror, the Unconquered, the All-Seeing, the All-Powerful, the Lord, the Maker, the Creator, the Best, the Organizer, the Controller, the Father of All That Have Been and Shall Be." The monk said to the Great Brahma for the third time: "Friend, I am not asking whether you are BrahmÄ, Great BrahmÄ, The Conqueror, the Unconquered, the All-Seeing, All-Powerful, the Lord, the Maker and Creator, the Ruler, Appointer and Orderer, Father of All That Have Been and Shall Be. And so, friend, I ask you, "Where do these four great elements â€“ earth element (*pathavÄ«dhÄtu*), water element (*ÄpodhÄtu*), fire element (*tejodhÄtu*), and air element (*vÄyodhÄtu*) â€“ cease without remainder?"
495. abhibhÅ« anabhibhÅ«to aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso vasavattÄ« issaro kattÄ nimmÄtÄ seá¹­á¹­ho sajitÄ vasÄ« pitÄ bhÅ«tabhabyÄna"nti. evaÃ±ca kho ahaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ, Ävuso, pucchÄmi â€“ "kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«"â€™ti? 495. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, mahÄbrahmÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ bÄhÄyaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ apanetvÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜ime kho maá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, brahmakÄyikÄ devÄ evaá¹ƒ jÄnanti, "natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno aÃ±Ã±Ätaá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno adiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno aviditaá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno asacchikata"nti. tasmÄhaá¹ƒ tesaá¹ƒ sammukhÄ na byÄkÄsiá¹ƒ. ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na jÄnÄmi yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«ti. tasmÄtiha, bhikkhu, tuyhevetaá¹ƒ dukkaá¹­aá¹ƒ, tuyhevetaá¹ƒ aparaddhaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ tvaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ bhagavantaá¹ƒ atidhÄvitvÄ bahiddhÄ pariyeá¹­á¹­hiá¹ƒ Äpajjasi imassa paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡Äya. gaccha tvaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, tameva bhagavantaá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ imaá¹ƒ paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccha, yathÄ ca te bhagavÄ byÄkaroti, tathÄ naá¹ƒ dhÄreyyÄsÄ«â€™ti. 496. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu â€“ seyyathÄpi nÄma balavÄ puriso samiÃ±jitaá¹ƒ vÄ bÄhaá¹ƒ pasÄreyya, pasÄritaá¹ƒ vÄ bÄhaá¹ƒ samiÃ±jeyya evameva brahmaloke antarahito mama purato pÄturahosi. atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu maá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di, ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho, kevaá¹­á¹­a, so bhikkhu maá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, bhante, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? tÄ«radassisakuá¹‡upamÄ 497. "evaá¹ƒ vutte, ahaá¹ƒ, kevaá¹­á¹­a, taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavocaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜bhÅ«tapubbaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, sÄmuddikÄ vÄá¹‡ijÄ tÄ«radassiá¹ƒ sakuá¹‡aá¹ƒ gahetvÄ nÄvÄya samuddaá¹ƒ ajjhogÄhanti. te atÄ«radakkhiniyÄ nÄvÄya tÄ«radassiá¹ƒ sakuá¹‡aá¹ƒ muÃ±canti. so gacchateva puratthimaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati dakkhiá¹‡aá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati pacchimaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati uttaraá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati uddhaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati anudisaá¹ƒ. sace so samantÄ
Then, Kevatta, the Great BrahmÄ took that monk by the arm, led him aside and said: â€œMonk, these devas who belong to the assembly of BrahmÄ think of me in this way: â€˜There is nothing that BrahmÄ does not know, nothing that he does not see, nothing that he is unaware of, nothing that he has not realized.â€™ That is why I did not speak in front of them. And I, monk, do not know where these four great elements â€“ earth element, water element, fire element and air element â€“ cease without remainder. Therefore, monk, you have acted wrongly, you have acted incorrectly by going beyond the Blessed Lord and going in search of an answer to this question elsewhere. Now, monk, you just go to the Blessed Lord and put this question to him, and whatever answer he gives, accept it.â€
496. abhibhÅ« anabhibhÅ«to aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso vasavattÄ« issaro kattÄ nimmÄtÄ seá¹­á¹­ho sajitÄ vasÄ« pitÄ bhÅ«tabhabyÄna"nti. evaÃ±ca kho ahaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ, Ävuso, pucchÄmi â€“ "kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«"â€™ti? 495. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, mahÄbrahmÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ bÄhÄyaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ apanetvÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜ime kho maá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, brahmakÄyikÄ devÄ evaá¹ƒ jÄnanti, "natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno aÃ±Ã±Ätaá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno adiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno aviditaá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno asacchikata"nti. tasmÄhaá¹ƒ tesaá¹ƒ sammukhÄ na byÄkÄsiá¹ƒ. ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na jÄnÄmi yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«ti. tasmÄtiha, bhikkhu, tuyhevetaá¹ƒ dukkaá¹­aá¹ƒ, tuyhevetaá¹ƒ aparaddhaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ tvaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ bhagavantaá¹ƒ atidhÄvitvÄ bahiddhÄ pariyeá¹­á¹­hiá¹ƒ Äpajjasi imassa paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡Äya. gaccha tvaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, tameva bhagavantaá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ imaá¹ƒ paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccha, yathÄ ca te bhagavÄ byÄkaroti, tathÄ naá¹ƒ dhÄreyyÄsÄ«â€™ti. 496. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu â€“ seyyathÄpi nÄma balavÄ puriso samiÃ±jitaá¹ƒ vÄ bÄhaá¹ƒ pasÄreyya, pasÄritaá¹ƒ vÄ bÄhaá¹ƒ samiÃ±jeyya evameva brahmaloke antarahito mama purato pÄturahosi. atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu maá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di, ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho, kevaá¹­á¹­a, so bhikkhu maá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, bhante, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? tÄ«radassisakuá¹‡upamÄ 497. "evaá¹ƒ vutte, ahaá¹ƒ, kevaá¹­á¹­a, taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavocaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜bhÅ«tapubbaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, sÄmuddikÄ vÄá¹‡ijÄ tÄ«radassiá¹ƒ sakuá¹‡aá¹ƒ gahetvÄ nÄvÄya samuddaá¹ƒ ajjhogÄhanti. te atÄ«radakkhiniyÄ nÄvÄya tÄ«radassiá¹ƒ sakuá¹‡aá¹ƒ muÃ±canti. so gacchateva puratthimaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati dakkhiá¹‡aá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati pacchimaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati uttaraá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati uddhaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati anudisaá¹ƒ. sace so samantÄ
Then, Kevatta, that monk, as swiftly as a strong man might flex or extend his arm, vanished from the BrahmÄ world and appeared in my presence. Then, Kevatta, that monk prostrated himself before me, then sat down to one side and said: â€œLord, where do these four great elements â€“ the earth element, the water element, the fire element and the air element â€“ cease without remainder?â€ Like the simile of the land-sighting bird.
497. abhibhÅ« anabhibhÅ«to aÃ±Ã±adatthudaso vasavattÄ« issaro kattÄ nimmÄtÄ seá¹­á¹­ho sajitÄ vasÄ« pitÄ bhÅ«tabhabyÄna"nti. evaÃ±ca kho ahaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ, Ävuso, pucchÄmi â€“ "kattha nu kho, Ävuso, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«"â€™ti? 495. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, mahÄbrahmÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ bÄhÄyaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ apanetvÄ taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜ime kho maá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, brahmakÄyikÄ devÄ evaá¹ƒ jÄnanti, "natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno aÃ±Ã±Ätaá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno adiá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno aviditaá¹ƒ, natthi kiÃ±ci brahmuno asacchikata"nti. tasmÄhaá¹ƒ tesaá¹ƒ sammukhÄ na byÄkÄsiá¹ƒ. ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na jÄnÄmi yatthime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«ti. tasmÄtiha, bhikkhu, tuyhevetaá¹ƒ dukkaá¹­aá¹ƒ, tuyhevetaá¹ƒ aparaddhaá¹ƒ, yaá¹ƒ tvaá¹ƒ taá¹ƒ bhagavantaá¹ƒ atidhÄvitvÄ bahiddhÄ pariyeá¹­á¹­hiá¹ƒ Äpajjasi imassa paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡Äya. gaccha tvaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, tameva bhagavantaá¹ƒ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ imaá¹ƒ paÃ±haá¹ƒ puccha, yathÄ ca te bhagavÄ byÄkaroti, tathÄ naá¹ƒ dhÄreyyÄsÄ«â€™ti. 496. "atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu â€“ seyyathÄpi nÄma balavÄ puriso samiÃ±jitaá¹ƒ vÄ bÄhaá¹ƒ pasÄreyya, pasÄritaá¹ƒ vÄ bÄhaá¹ƒ samiÃ±jeyya evameva brahmaloke antarahito mama purato pÄturahosi. atha kho so, kevaá¹­á¹­a, bhikkhu maá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di, ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho, kevaá¹­á¹­a, so bhikkhu maá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, bhante, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? tÄ«radassisakuá¹‡upamÄ 497. "evaá¹ƒ vutte, ahaá¹ƒ, kevaá¹­á¹­a, taá¹ƒ bhikkhuá¹ƒ etadavocaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜bhÅ«tapubbaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, sÄmuddikÄ vÄá¹‡ijÄ tÄ«radassiá¹ƒ sakuá¹‡aá¹ƒ gahetvÄ nÄvÄya samuddaá¹ƒ ajjhogÄhanti. te atÄ«radakkhiniyÄ nÄvÄya tÄ«radassiá¹ƒ sakuá¹‡aá¹ƒ muÃ±canti. so gacchateva puratthimaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati dakkhiá¹‡aá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati pacchimaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati uttaraá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati uddhaá¹ƒ disaá¹ƒ, gacchati anudisaá¹ƒ. sace so samantÄ
When this was said, I said to that monk, Kevatta: â€œOnce upon a time seafaring merchants, when they set sail on the ocean, took in their ship a land-sighting bird. When they could not see the land themselves, they released this bird. The bird flew to the east, to the south, to the west, to the north, it flew upwards, and to the intermediate directions. If it sees land all around, it heads off in that direction. But if it saw no land all around, it returned to the ship. In the same way, monk, you have been as far as the BrahmÄ world searching for an answer to this question and not finding it, and now you come back to me. Monk, you should not ask your question in this way: â€˜Where do the four great elements â€“ the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the air element â€“ cease without remainder?â€™
498. tÄ«raá¹ƒ passati, tathÄgatakova [tathÄpakkantova (syÄ.)] hoti. sace pana so samantÄ tÄ«raá¹ƒ na passati, tameva nÄvaá¹ƒ paccÄgacchati. evameva kho tvaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, yato yÄva brahmalokÄ pariyesamÄno imassa paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ nÄjjhagÄ, atha mamaÃ±Ã±eva santike paccÄgato. na kho eso, bhikkhu, paÃ±ho evaá¹ƒ pucchitabbo â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, bhante, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? 498. "evaÃ±ca kho eso, bhikkhu, paÃ±ho pucchitabbo â€“ â€˜kattha Äpo ca pathavÄ«, tejo vÄyo na gÄdhati, kattha dÄ«ghaÃ±ca rassaÃ±ca, aá¹‡uá¹ƒ thÅ«laá¹ƒ subhÄsubhaá¹ƒ, kattha nÄmaÃ±ca rÅ«paÃ±ca, asesaá¹ƒ uparujjhatÄ«â€™ti. 499. "tatra veyyÄkaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ bhavati â€“ â€˜viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ anidassanaá¹ƒ, anantaá¹ƒ sabbatopabhaá¹ƒ, ettha Äpo ca pathavÄ«, tejo vÄyo na gÄdhati. ettha dÄ«ghaÃ±ca rassaÃ±ca, aá¹‡uá¹ƒ thÅ«laá¹ƒ subhÄsubhaá¹ƒ, ettha nÄmaÃ±ca rÅ«paÃ±ca, asesaá¹ƒ uparujjhati, viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡assa nirodhena, etthetaá¹ƒ uparujjhatÄ«â€™ti. 500. idamavoca bhagavÄ. attamano kevaá¹­á¹­o gahapatiputto bhagavato bhÄsitaá¹ƒ abhinandÄ«ti. kevaá¹­á¹­asuttaá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ ekÄdasamaá¹ƒ.
Instead, monk, this is how the question should be asked: â€˜Where do water, earth, fire and air find no footing? Where are long and short, small and great, fair and foulâ€” Where are name and form wholly destroyed?â€™â€
499. tÄ«raá¹ƒ passati, tathÄgatakova [tathÄpakkantova (syÄ.)] hoti. sace pana so samantÄ tÄ«raá¹ƒ na passati, tameva nÄvaá¹ƒ paccÄgacchati. evameva kho tvaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, yato yÄva brahmalokÄ pariyesamÄno imassa paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ nÄjjhagÄ, atha mamaÃ±Ã±eva santike paccÄgato. na kho eso, bhikkhu, paÃ±ho evaá¹ƒ pucchitabbo â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, bhante, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? 498. "evaÃ±ca kho eso, bhikkhu, paÃ±ho pucchitabbo â€“ â€˜kattha Äpo ca pathavÄ«, tejo vÄyo na gÄdhati, kattha dÄ«ghaÃ±ca rassaÃ±ca, aá¹‡uá¹ƒ thÅ«laá¹ƒ subhÄsubhaá¹ƒ, kattha nÄmaÃ±ca rÅ«paÃ±ca, asesaá¹ƒ uparujjhatÄ«â€™ti. 499. "tatra veyyÄkaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ bhavati â€“ â€˜viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ anidassanaá¹ƒ, anantaá¹ƒ sabbatopabhaá¹ƒ, ettha Äpo ca pathavÄ«, tejo vÄyo na gÄdhati. ettha dÄ«ghaÃ±ca rassaÃ±ca, aá¹‡uá¹ƒ thÅ«laá¹ƒ subhÄsubhaá¹ƒ, ettha nÄmaÃ±ca rÅ«paÃ±ca, asesaá¹ƒ uparujjhati, viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡assa nirodhena, etthetaá¹ƒ uparujjhatÄ«â€™ti. 500. idamavoca bhagavÄ. attamano kevaá¹­á¹­o gahapatiputto bhagavato bhÄsitaá¹ƒ abhinandÄ«ti. kevaá¹­á¹­asuttaá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ ekÄdasamaá¹ƒ.
â€œThere, the explanation is this: â€˜Consciousness is invisible, endless, and all-illuminating. That is where water, earth, fire, and air find no footing. There, long and short, small and great, fair and foulâ€” There, name and form are wholly destroyed. With the cessation of consciousness, all of this ceases.â€™â€
500. tÄ«raá¹ƒ passati, tathÄgatakova [tathÄpakkantova (syÄ.)] hoti. sace pana so samantÄ tÄ«raá¹ƒ na passati, tameva nÄvaá¹ƒ paccÄgacchati. evameva kho tvaá¹ƒ, bhikkhu, yato yÄva brahmalokÄ pariyesamÄno imassa paÃ±hassa veyyÄkaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ nÄjjhagÄ, atha mamaÃ±Ã±eva santike paccÄgato. na kho eso, bhikkhu, paÃ±ho evaá¹ƒ pucchitabbo â€“ â€˜kattha nu kho, bhante, ime cattÄro mahÄbhÅ«tÄ aparisesÄ nirujjhanti, seyyathidaá¹ƒ â€“ pathavÄ«dhÄtu ÄpodhÄtu tejodhÄtu vÄyodhÄtÅ«â€™ti? 498. "evaÃ±ca kho eso, bhikkhu, paÃ±ho pucchitabbo â€“ â€˜kattha Äpo ca pathavÄ«, tejo vÄyo na gÄdhati, kattha dÄ«ghaÃ±ca rassaÃ±ca, aá¹‡uá¹ƒ thÅ«laá¹ƒ subhÄsubhaá¹ƒ, kattha nÄmaÃ±ca rÅ«paÃ±ca, asesaá¹ƒ uparujjhatÄ«â€™ti. 499. "tatra veyyÄkaraá¹‡aá¹ƒ bhavati â€“ â€˜viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ƒ anidassanaá¹ƒ, anantaá¹ƒ sabbatopabhaá¹ƒ, ettha Äpo ca pathavÄ«, tejo vÄyo na gÄdhati. ettha dÄ«ghaÃ±ca rassaÃ±ca, aá¹‡uá¹ƒ thÅ«laá¹ƒ subhÄsubhaá¹ƒ, ettha nÄmaÃ±ca rÅ«paÃ±ca, asesaá¹ƒ uparujjhati, viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡assa nirodhena, etthetaá¹ƒ uparujjhatÄ«â€™ti. 500. idamavoca bhagavÄ. attamano kevaá¹­á¹­o gahapatiputto bhagavato bhÄsitaá¹ƒ abhinandÄ«ti. kevaá¹­á¹­asuttaá¹ƒ niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ ekÄdasamaá¹ƒ.
This is what the Blessed One said. Kevatta, the householderâ€™s son, was satisfied and delighted with the Blessed Oneâ€™s words. The Kevatta Discourse is finished, the eleventh.
501. 12. lohiccasuttaá¹ƒ lohiccabrÄhmaá¹‡avatthu 501. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ kosalesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena sÄlavatikÄ tadavasari. tena kho pana samayena lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä pasenadinÄ kosalena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ, brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. 502. tena kho pana samayena lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa evarÅ«paá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ƒ uppannaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ "idha samaá¹‡o vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o vÄ kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigaccheyya, kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigantvÄ na parassa Äroceyya, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissati. seyyathÄpi nÄma purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ chinditvÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ navaá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ kareyya, evaá¹ƒsampadamidaá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ lobhadhammaá¹ƒ vadÄmi, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissatÄ«"ti. 503. assosi kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito kosalesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ anuppatto. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. 504. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o rosikaá¹ƒ [bhesikaá¹ƒ (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] nhÄpitaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, samma rosike, yena samaá¹‡o gotamo
Thus have I heard: At one time the Blessed One was wandering in Kosala, accompanied by a large Sangha of monks, about five hundred in all. He arrived at SÄlavatikÄ. At that time, the Brahmin Lohicca was living in SÄlavatikÄ, a populous place, full of grass, timber, water and corn, which had been given to him by King Pasenadi of Kosala as a royal gift, a rent-free grant.
502. 12. lohiccasuttaá¹ƒ lohiccabrÄhmaá¹‡avatthu 501. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ kosalesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena sÄlavatikÄ tadavasari. tena kho pana samayena lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä pasenadinÄ kosalena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ, brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. 502. tena kho pana samayena lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa evarÅ«paá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ƒ uppannaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ "idha samaá¹‡o vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o vÄ kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigaccheyya, kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigantvÄ na parassa Äroceyya, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissati. seyyathÄpi nÄma purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ chinditvÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ navaá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ kareyya, evaá¹ƒsampadamidaá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ lobhadhammaá¹ƒ vadÄmi, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissatÄ«"ti. 503. assosi kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito kosalesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ anuppatto. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. 504. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o rosikaá¹ƒ [bhesikaá¹ƒ (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] nhÄpitaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, samma rosike, yena samaá¹‡o gotamo
At that time, this wicked thought arose in the mind of the Brahmin Lohicca: "If a renunciate or a Brahmin were to attain a wholesome teaching, having attained a wholesome teaching, he should not announce it to others; for what could another do for another? It is just as if someone, having cut an old bond, were to create a new bond. I declare that such a thing is an evil deed rooted in attachment, for what can one person do for another?"
503. 12. lohiccasuttaá¹ƒ lohiccabrÄhmaá¹‡avatthu 501. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ kosalesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena sÄlavatikÄ tadavasari. tena kho pana samayena lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä pasenadinÄ kosalena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ, brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. 502. tena kho pana samayena lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa evarÅ«paá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ƒ uppannaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ "idha samaá¹‡o vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o vÄ kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigaccheyya, kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigantvÄ na parassa Äroceyya, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissati. seyyathÄpi nÄma purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ chinditvÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ navaá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ kareyya, evaá¹ƒsampadamidaá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ lobhadhammaá¹ƒ vadÄmi, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissatÄ«"ti. 503. assosi kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito kosalesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ anuppatto. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. 504. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o rosikaá¹ƒ [bhesikaá¹ƒ (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] nhÄpitaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, samma rosike, yena samaá¹‡o gotamo
Then the Brahmin Lohicca heard, "The renunciate Gotama, son of the Sakyans, gone forth from the Sakyan clan, is wandering in Kosala with a large Sangha of monks, about five hundred in all, and has arrived at SÄlavatikÄ. And concerning the esteemed Gotama, such a good report has spread: â€˜Indeed, the Blessed One is an Arhat, a fully enlightened Buddha, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, Knower of the worlds, unsurpassed trainer of beings to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.â€™ He realizes for himself with direct knowledge this world with its gods, its MÄras, and its BrahmÄs, this generation with its recluses and brahmins, its rulers and people, and makes it known. He teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the meaning and with the letter; he reveals the spiritual life that is utterly perfect and pure. It is good to see such accomplished Arahants."
504. 12. lohiccasuttaá¹ƒ lohiccabrÄhmaá¹‡avatthu 501. evaá¹ƒ me sutaá¹ƒ â€“ ekaá¹ƒ samayaá¹ƒ bhagavÄ kosalesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi yena sÄlavatikÄ tadavasari. tena kho pana samayena lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ƒ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ƒ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ rÄjabhoggaá¹ƒ raÃ±Ã±Ä pasenadinÄ kosalena dinnaá¹ƒ rÄjadÄyaá¹ƒ, brahmadeyyaá¹ƒ. 502. tena kho pana samayena lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa evarÅ«paá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ƒ uppannaá¹ƒ hoti â€“ "idha samaá¹‡o vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o vÄ kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigaccheyya, kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigantvÄ na parassa Äroceyya, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissati. seyyathÄpi nÄma purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ chinditvÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ navaá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ kareyya, evaá¹ƒsampadamidaá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ lobhadhammaá¹ƒ vadÄmi, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissatÄ«"ti. 503. assosi kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o â€“ "samaá¹‡o khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulÄ pabbajito kosalesu cÄrikaá¹ƒ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ƒ paÃ±camattehi bhikkhusatehi sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ anuppatto. taá¹ƒ kho pana bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ evaá¹ƒ kalyÄá¹‡o kittisaddo abbhuggato â€“ â€˜itipi so bhagavÄ arahaá¹ƒ sammÄsambuddho vijjÄcaraá¹‡asampanno sugato lokavidÅ« anuttaro purisadammasÄrathi satthÄ devamanussÄnaá¹ƒ buddho bhagavÄâ€™. so imaá¹ƒ lokaá¹ƒ sadevakaá¹ƒ samÄrakaá¹ƒ sabrahmakaá¹ƒ sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iá¹ƒ pajaá¹ƒ sadevamanussaá¹ƒ sayaá¹ƒ abhiÃ±Ã±Ä sacchikatvÄ pavedeti. so dhammaá¹ƒ deseti ÄdikalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ majjhekalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ pariyosÄnakalyÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ sÄtthaá¹ƒ sabyaÃ±janaá¹ƒ kevalaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ƒ parisuddhaá¹ƒ brahmacariyaá¹ƒ pakÄseti. sÄdhu kho pana tathÄrÅ«pÄnaá¹ƒ arahataá¹ƒ dassanaá¹ƒ hotÄ«"ti. 504. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o rosikaá¹ƒ [bhesikaá¹ƒ (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] nhÄpitaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, samma rosike, yena samaá¹‡o gotamo
Then the Brahmin Lohicca addressed the barber Rosika [Bhesika (SÄ«. PÄ«.)]: "Come, good Rosika, go to the renunciate Gotama, and on arrival, ask the renunciate Gotama, in my name, whether he is free from illness and affliction, healthy, strong and living comfortably, saying, 'Lohicca, good Gotama, the Brahmin, asks you whether you are free from illness and affliction, healthy, strong and living comfortably.'" And say this: "May the esteemed Gotama accept a meal from Lohicca the Brahmin, with the Sangha of monks, tomorrow."
505. tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ mama vacanena samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ puccha â€“ lohicco, bho gotama, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchatÄ«"ti. evaÃ±ca vadehi â€“ "adhivÄsetu kira bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. 505. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti [evaá¹ƒ bhanteti (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] kho rosikÄ nhÄpito lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "lohicco, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ adhivÄsetu kira, bhante, bhagavÄ lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 506. atha kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ viditvÄ uá¹­á¹­hÄyÄsanÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ padakkhiá¹‡aá¹ƒ katvÄ yena lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ lohiccaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "avocumhÄ kho mayaá¹ƒ bhoto [mayaá¹ƒ bhante tava (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] vacanena taá¹ƒ bhagavantaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜lohicco, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ adhivÄsetu kira, bhante, bhagavÄ lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄâ€™ti. adhivutthaÃ±ca pana tena bhagavatÄ"ti. 507. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o tassÄ rattiyÄ accayena sake nivesane paá¹‡Ä«taá¹ƒ khÄdanÄ«yaá¹ƒ bhojanÄ«yaá¹ƒ paá¹­iyÄdÄpetvÄ rosikaá¹ƒ nhÄpitaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, samma rosike, yena samaá¹‡o gotamo tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ samaá¹‡assa gotamassa kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocehi â€“ kÄlo bho, gotama, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho rosikÄ nhÄpito lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ
"Very well, sir," said Rosika the barber, and assenting to the Brahmin Lohicca's words, he went to the Blessed One, and on arrival, paid homage to the Blessed One and sat down at one side. Seated at one side, Rosika the barber said to the Blessed One, "Lohicca, venerable sir, the Brahmin, asks you whether you are free from illness and affliction, healthy, strong and living comfortably, and says this: 'May the venerable Gotama accept a meal from Lohicca the Brahmin, with the Sangha of monks, tomorrow.'" The Blessed One accepted in silence.
506. tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ mama vacanena samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ puccha â€“ lohicco, bho gotama, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchatÄ«"ti. evaÃ±ca vadehi â€“ "adhivÄsetu kira bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. 505. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti [evaá¹ƒ bhanteti (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] kho rosikÄ nhÄpito lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "lohicco, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ adhivÄsetu kira, bhante, bhagavÄ lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 506. atha kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ viditvÄ uá¹­á¹­hÄyÄsanÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ padakkhiá¹‡aá¹ƒ katvÄ yena lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ lohiccaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "avocumhÄ kho mayaá¹ƒ bhoto [mayaá¹ƒ bhante tava (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] vacanena taá¹ƒ bhagavantaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜lohicco, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ adhivÄsetu kira, bhante, bhagavÄ lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄâ€™ti. adhivutthaÃ±ca pana tena bhagavatÄ"ti. 507. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o tassÄ rattiyÄ accayena sake nivesane paá¹‡Ä«taá¹ƒ khÄdanÄ«yaá¹ƒ bhojanÄ«yaá¹ƒ paá¹­iyÄdÄpetvÄ rosikaá¹ƒ nhÄpitaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, samma rosike, yena samaá¹‡o gotamo tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ samaá¹‡assa gotamassa kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocehi â€“ kÄlo bho, gotama, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho rosikÄ nhÄpito lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ
Then Rosika the barber, knowing of the Blessed One's acceptance, rose from his seat, paid homage to the Blessed One, circumambulated him, and went to the Brahmin Lohicca, and on arrival, said to the Brahmin Lohicca: "I have told the Blessed One, according to your words: 'Lohicca, venerable sir, the Brahmin asks the Blessed One whether he is free from illness and affliction, healthy, strong and living comfortably, and says this: May the venerable Gotama accept a meal from Lohicca the Brahmin, with the Sangha of monks, tomorrow.' And it has been accepted by the Blessed One."
507. tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ mama vacanena samaá¹‡aá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ puccha â€“ lohicco, bho gotama, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhavantaá¹ƒ gotamaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchatÄ«"ti. evaÃ±ca vadehi â€“ "adhivÄsetu kira bhavaá¹ƒ gotamo lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. 505. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti [evaá¹ƒ bhanteti (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] kho rosikÄ nhÄpito lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinno kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "lohicco, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ adhivÄsetu kira, bhante, bhagavÄ lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄ"ti. adhivÄsesi bhagavÄ tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄvena. 506. atha kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavato adhivÄsanaá¹ƒ viditvÄ uá¹­á¹­hÄyÄsanÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ padakkhiá¹‡aá¹ƒ katvÄ yena lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ lohiccaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "avocumhÄ kho mayaá¹ƒ bhoto [mayaá¹ƒ bhante tava (sÄ«. pÄ«.)] vacanena taá¹ƒ bhagavantaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜lohicco, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ appÄbÄdhaá¹ƒ appÄtaá¹…kaá¹ƒ lahuá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ƒ balaá¹ƒ phÄsuvihÄraá¹ƒ pucchati, evaÃ±ca vadeti â€“ adhivÄsetu kira, bhante, bhagavÄ lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa svÄtanÄya bhattaá¹ƒ saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghenÄâ€™ti. adhivutthaÃ±ca pana tena bhagavatÄ"ti. 507. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o tassÄ rattiyÄ accayena sake nivesane paá¹‡Ä«taá¹ƒ khÄdanÄ«yaá¹ƒ bhojanÄ«yaá¹ƒ paá¹­iyÄdÄpetvÄ rosikaá¹ƒ nhÄpitaá¹ƒ Ämantesi â€“ "ehi tvaá¹ƒ, samma rosike, yena samaá¹‡o gotamo tenupasaá¹…kama, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ samaá¹‡assa gotamassa kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocehi â€“ kÄlo bho, gotama, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. "evaá¹ƒ, bho"ti kho rosikÄ nhÄpito lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavantaá¹ƒ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ
Then, at the end of the night, the Brahmin Lohicca had fine foods prepared, hard and soft, in his own dwelling, and addressed the barber Rosika: "Come, good Rosika, go to the renunciate Gotama, and on arrival, inform the renunciate Gotama that it is time, saying, 'It is time, good Gotama, the meal is ready.'" "Very well, sir," said Rosika the barber, and assenting to the Brahmin Lohicca's words, he went to the Blessed One, and on arrival, paid homage to the Blessed One and sat down at one side. He stood. Standing to one side, Rosika the barber announced the time to the Blessed One: "It is time, venerable sir, the meal is ready."
508. aá¹­á¹­hÄsi. ekamantaá¹ƒ á¹­hito kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavato kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocesi â€“ "kÄlo, bhante, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. 508. atha kho bhagavÄ pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena yena sÄlavatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kami. tena kho pana samayena rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavantaá¹ƒ piá¹­á¹­hito piá¹­á¹­hito anubandho hoti. atha kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "lohiccassa, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡assa evarÅ«paá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ƒ uppannaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜idha samaá¹‡o vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o vÄ kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigaccheyya, kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigantvÄ na parassa Äroceyya â€“ kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissati. seyyathÄpi nÄma purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ chinditvÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ navaá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ kareyya, evaá¹ƒ sampadamidaá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ lobhadhammaá¹ƒ vadÄmi â€“ kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissatÄ«â€™ti. sÄdhu, bhante, bhagavÄ lohiccaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etasmÄ pÄpakÄ diá¹­á¹­higatÄ vivecetÅ«"ti. "appeva nÄma siyÄ rosike, appeva nÄma siyÄ rosike"ti. atha kho bhagavÄ yena lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ paÃ±Ã±atte Äsane nisÄ«di. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o buddhappamukhaá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghaá¹ƒ paá¹‡Ä«tena khÄdanÄ«yena bhojanÄ«yena sahatthÄ santappesi sampavÄresi. lohiccabrÄhmaá¹‡Änuyogo 509. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ bhuttÄviá¹ƒ onÄ«tapattapÄá¹‡iá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ nÄ«caá¹ƒ Äsanaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnaá¹ƒ kho lohiccaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ bhagavÄ etadavoca â€“ "saccaá¹ƒ kira te, lohicca, evarÅ«paá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ƒ uppannaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜idha samaá¹‡o vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o vÄ kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigaccheyya, kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigantvÄ na parassa Äroceyya â€“ kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissati. seyyathÄpi nÄma purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ chinditvÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ navaá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ kareyya, evaá¹ƒ sampadamidaá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ lobhadhammaá¹ƒ vadÄmi, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissatÄ«"â€™ ti? "evaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "taá¹ƒ kiá¹ƒ maÃ±Ã±asi lohicca nanu tvaá¹ƒ sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasasÄ«"ti? "evaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "yo nu kho, lohicca, evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ â€˜lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati. yÄ sÄlavatikÄya samudayasaÃ±jÄti lohiccova taá¹ƒ
Then, the Blessed One, having dressed in the early morning and taken his bowl and robe, went with his order of monks to SÄlavatikÄ. At that time, Rosika the barber was following the Blessed One closely behind. Then Rosika the barber said to the Blessed One: "This kind of evil view has arisen in the brahmin Lohicca: 'Here, if a *Å›ramaá¹‡a* or a *brÄhmaá¹‡a* were to attain wholesome *dharma*, having attained wholesome *dharma*, he should not declare it to anotherâ€”for what can one person do for another? Just as if, having cut through an old fetter, one were to make a new one, I declare that this is an evil doctrine rooted in attachment (*lobhadhamma*)...for what can one man do for another?'" "It is good, venerable sir, may the Blessed One dissuade the brahmin Lohicca from these evil views." "It may well be so, Rosika, it may well be so." Then the Blessed One went to the dwelling of the brahmin Lohicca, and having arrived, he sat down on the prepared seat. Then Lohicca the brahmin personally served the Saá¹ƒgha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with choice hard and soft food until they were satisfied and had enough. Lohicca Brahmana's Inquiry
509. aá¹­á¹­hÄsi. ekamantaá¹ƒ á¹­hito kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavato kÄlaá¹ƒ Ärocesi â€“ "kÄlo, bhante, niá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ bhatta"nti. 508. atha kho bhagavÄ pubbaá¹‡hasamayaá¹ƒ nivÄsetvÄ pattacÄ«varamÄdÄya saddhiá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena yena sÄlavatikÄ tenupasaá¹…kami. tena kho pana samayena rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavantaá¹ƒ piá¹­á¹­hito piá¹­á¹­hito anubandho hoti. atha kho rosikÄ nhÄpito bhagavantaá¹ƒ etadavoca â€“ "lohiccassa, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡assa evarÅ«paá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ƒ uppannaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜idha samaá¹‡o vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o vÄ kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigaccheyya, kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigantvÄ na parassa Äroceyya â€“ kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissati. seyyathÄpi nÄma purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ chinditvÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ navaá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ kareyya, evaá¹ƒ sampadamidaá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ lobhadhammaá¹ƒ vadÄmi â€“ kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissatÄ«â€™ti. sÄdhu, bhante, bhagavÄ lohiccaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ etasmÄ pÄpakÄ diá¹­á¹­higatÄ vivecetÅ«"ti. "appeva nÄma siyÄ rosike, appeva nÄma siyÄ rosike"ti. atha kho bhagavÄ yena lohiccassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa nivesanaá¹ƒ tenupasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ paÃ±Ã±atte Äsane nisÄ«di. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o buddhappamukhaá¹ƒ bhikkhusaá¹…ghaá¹ƒ paá¹‡Ä«tena khÄdanÄ«yena bhojanÄ«yena sahatthÄ santappesi sampavÄresi. lohiccabrÄhmaá¹‡Änuyogo 509. atha kho lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ƒ bhuttÄviá¹ƒ onÄ«tapattapÄá¹‡iá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ nÄ«caá¹ƒ Äsanaá¹ƒ gahetvÄ ekamantaá¹ƒ nisÄ«di. ekamantaá¹ƒ nisinnaá¹ƒ kho lohiccaá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ƒ bhagavÄ etadavoca â€“ "saccaá¹ƒ kira te, lohicca, evarÅ«paá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ƒ uppannaá¹ƒ â€“ â€˜idha samaá¹‡o vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡o vÄ kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigaccheyya, kusalaá¹ƒ dhammaá¹ƒ adhigantvÄ na parassa Äroceyya â€“ kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissati. seyyathÄpi nÄma purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ chinditvÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ƒ navaá¹ƒ bandhanaá¹ƒ kareyya, evaá¹ƒ sampadamidaá¹ƒ pÄpakaá¹ƒ lobhadhammaá¹ƒ vadÄmi, kiÃ±hi paro parassa karissatÄ«"â€™ ti? "yo nu kho, lohicca, evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ â€˜lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati. yÄ sÄlavatikÄya samudayasaÃ±jÄti lohiccova taá¹ƒ
Then, when Lohicca the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* saw that the Blessed One had finished eating and had removed his hand from the bowl, he took a low seat and sat down to one side. The Blessed One said this to Lohicca the *brÄhmaá¹‡a*, who was sitting to one side: "Lohicca, is it true that this kind of evil view has arisen in you: 'Here, if a *Å›ramaá¹‡a* or a *brÄhmaá¹‡a* were to attain wholesome *dharma*, having attained wholesome *dharma*, he should not declare it to anotherâ€”for what can one person do for another? Just as if, having cut through an old fetter, one were to make a new one, I declare that this is an evil doctrine rooted in attachment...for what can one man do for another?'" "Yes, Master Gotama." "What do you think, Lohicca, do you not reside at SÄlavatikÄ?" "Yes, Master Gotama." "If someone were to say, Lohicca: 'The *brÄhmaá¹‡a* Lohicca resides at SÄlavatikÄ. Lohicca alone enjoys that which arises from SÄlavatikÄ. and that the *brÄhmaá¹‡a* should alone enjoy it, not giving anything to others." "Would not anyone who spoke like that be a source of danger to his tenants?" "He would be a source of danger, reverend Gotama." "Being a source of danger, would he be solicitous for their welfare or not?'' "Not solicitous for their welfare, reverend Gotama." "By not being solicitous for their welfare, would he have a heart full of loving-kindness (*mettÄ*) for them, or of hatred?" "Of hatred, reverend Gotama." "And in a heart of hatred, is there wrong view (*micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hi*) or right view (*sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi*)?" "Wrong view, reverend Gotama." "Lohicca, I declare that wrong view leads to one of two destiniesâ€”hell (*niraya*) or the animal realm (*tiracchÄnayoni*)."
510. brÄhmaá¹‡o ekako paribhuÃ±jeyya, na aÃ±Ã±esaá¹ƒ dadeyyÄâ€™ti. evaá¹ƒ vÄdÄ« so ye taá¹ƒ upajÄ«vanti, tesaá¹ƒ antarÄyakaro vÄ hoti, no vÄ"ti? "antarÄyakaro, bho gotama". "taá¹ƒ kiá¹ƒ maÃ±Ã±asi, lohicca, nanu rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo kÄsikosalaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasatÄ«"ti? "evaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "ahitÄnukampissa mettaá¹ƒ vÄ tesu cittaá¹ƒ paccupaá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ hoti sapattakaá¹ƒ vÄ"ti? "sapattakaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "sapattake citte paccupaá¹­á¹­hite micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hi vÄ hoti sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi vÄ"ti? "micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hi, bho gotama". "micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hissa kho ahaá¹ƒ, lohicca, dvinnaá¹ƒ gatÄ«naá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ gatiá¹ƒ vadÄmi â€“ nirayaá¹ƒ vÄ tiracchÄnayoniá¹ƒ vÄ". 511. "iti kira, lohicca, yo evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ "lohicco brÄhmaá¹‡o sÄlavatikaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati, yÄ sÄlavatikÄya samudayasaÃ±jÄti, lohiccova taá¹ƒ brÄhmaá¹‡o ekako paribhuÃ±jeyya, na aÃ±Ã±esaá¹ƒ dadeyyÄ"ti. evaá¹ƒvÄdÄ« so ye taá¹ƒ upajÄ«vanti, tesaá¹ƒ antarÄyakaro hoti. antarÄyakaro samÄno ahitÄnukampÄ« hoti, ahitÄnukampissa sapattakaá¹ƒ cittaá¹ƒ paccupaá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ƒ hoti, sapattake citte paccupaá¹­á¹­hite micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hi hoti. evameva kho, lohicca, yo evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ "idha
"What do you think, Lohicca? Does King Pasenadi of Kosala reside at Kasi-Kosala?" "Yes, reverend Gotama." "Well, if anyone should say: â€˜King Pasenadi of Kosala resides at Kasi-Kosala, and King Pasenadi of Kosala should alone enjoy the entire revenue that arises in Kasi-Kosala, not giving anything away to othersâ€™â€” would not anyone who spoke like that be a source of danger to those of you and the others who are King Pasenadi's tenants?" "He would be a source of danger, reverend Gotama." "Being a source of danger, would he be solicitous for their welfare or not?'' "Not solicitous for their welfare, reverend Gotama." "By not being solicitous for their welfare, would he have a heart full of loving-kindness (*mettÄ*) for them, or of hatred?" "Of hatred, reverend Gotama." "And in a heart of hatred, is there wrong view (*micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hi*) or right view (*sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi*)?" "Wrong view, reverend Gotama." "Lohicca, I declare that wrong view leads to one of two destiniesâ€”hell (*niraya*) or the animal realm (*tiracchÄnayoni*)."

"sapattakaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "sapattake citte paccupaá¹­á¹­hite micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hi vÄ hoti sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi vÄ"ti? "micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hi, bho gotama". "micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hissa kho ahaá¹ƒ, lohicca, dvinnaá¹ƒ gatÄ«naá¹ƒ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ƒ gatiá¹ƒ vadÄmi â€“ nirayaá¹ƒ vÄ tiracchÄnayoniá¹ƒ vÄ". 510. "taá¹ƒ kiá¹ƒ maÃ±Ã±asi, lohicca, nanu rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo kÄsikosalaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasatÄ«"ti? "evaá¹ƒ, bho gotama". "yo nu kho, lohicca, evaá¹ƒ vadeyya â€“ â€˜rÄjÄ pasenadi kosalo kÄsikosalaá¹ƒ ajjhÄvasati, yÄ kÄsikosale samudayasaÃ±jÄti, rÄjÄva taá¹ƒ pasenadi kosalo ekako paribhuÃ±jeyya, na aÃ±Ã±esaá¹ƒ dadeyyÄâ€™ti. evaá¹ƒ vÄdÄ« so ye rÄjÄnaá¹ƒ pasenadiá¹ƒ kosalaá¹ƒ upajÄ«vanti tumhe ceva aÃ±Ã±e ca, tesaá¹ƒ antarÄyakaro vÄ hoti, no vÄ"ti?
